Article: Priorities USA, a Democratic super PAC with the goal of defeating President Donald Trump, is preparing an advertising campaign to defend Joe Biden, the latest sign the partyâ€™s establishment is getting behind the former vice presidentâ€™s bid for the White House.

Headline: Biden snaps at Michigan auto worker over guns, curses at him
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential front-runner Joe Biden on Tuesday angrily turned on an auto worker at a campaign stop when questioned whether he was going to take away people's guns.

Headline: Trump vows 'major' steps to aid U.S. economy amid coronavirus rise
Article: President Donald Trump on Monday said he will be taking "major" steps to gird the economy against the impact of the spreading coronavirus outbreak and will discuss a payroll tax cut with congressional Republicans on Tuesday.

Headline: Biden joined by Booker, Harris in show of unity ahead of key Michigan vote
Article: Seeking a decisive win in the Michigan primary, Joe Biden was joined onstage in Detroit on Monday by two former Democratic presidential rivals, Cory Booker and Kamala Harris, in the latest sign the party establishment is lining up behind him.

Headline: Biden, Sanders consider changing campaign plans amid coronavirus outbreak
Article: Democratic presidential candidates Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders said on Monday they were consulting with public health experts about coronavirus risks in planning their next campaign moves, as election officials in upcoming primary states urged people to consider voting early.

Headline: Biden, not Sanders, gains in popularity after Warren drops out: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Elizabeth Warren's departure from the Democratic presidential race appears to have benefited front-runner Joe Biden more than Bernie Sanders, her liberal ally on many issues, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national opinion poll released on Monday.

Headline: Where Biden and Sanders diverge on climate change
Article: Democratic White House hopefuls Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders believe climate change is an existential threat, that the United States should immediately rejoin global climate talks, and that fossil fuel workers need help adjusting to a cleaner energy economy.

Headline: Democratic U.S. Senator Booker endorses Biden for 2020 presidential nod
Article: U.S. Senator and former Democratic presidential candidate Cory Booker on Monday endorsed former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden for the party's 2020 presidential nomination.

Headline: Montana Governor Bullock announces bid for U.S. Senate
Article: Governor Steve Bullock of Montana announced his bid for the U.S. Senate on Monday, a widely anticipated move that breathes life into Democratic hopes to take control of the upper chamber come November.

Headline: On the trail: In dueling endorsements, Kamala Harris backs Biden, while Jesse Jackson campaigns for Sanders
Article: Democratic presidential contenders Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders touted dueling endorsements on Sunday, with onetime Biden rival Kamala Harris supporting the former vice president, while civil rights leader Jesse Jackson campaigned for Sanders.

Headline: Senator Cruz self quarantines after contact with coronavirus carrier
Article: U.S. Senator Ted Cruz on Sunday said he would self-quarantine after he had contact with a CPAC political conference attendee who tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Battleground Michigan seen as last stand for Bernie Sanders
Article: For Bernie Sanders to remain competitive with Joe Biden in the battle for the Democratic presidential nomination, he will have to repeat what he did four years ago: win the Michigan primary.

Headline: Kamala Harris endorses one-time rival Joe Biden's White House bid
Article: U.S. Senator Kamala Harris, a former 2020 Democratic presidential candidate, on Sunday said she would endorse her one-time rival Joe Biden's bid for the White House.

Headline: On the trail: Biden launches biggest ad blitz of his campaign, Sanders attacks amid 'bloodbath' warning
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidates Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders campaigned in the Midwest on Saturday, as the two prepare for a showdown in Michigan, Missouri and four other nominating contests next week.

Headline: FTA advises on transit cleaning, little guidance on system shutdowns due to virus
Article: The Federal Transit Administration (FTA) had little new advice to offer transit systems in the event they might have to shut down their commuter networks for the coronavirus outbreak in a conference call on Friday, but told operators they could find sanitation guidance on government websites.

Headline: Coronavirus found on cruise ship as more U.S. states report cases
Article: Twenty-one people aboard a cruise ship that was barred from docking in San Francisco have tested positive for coronavirus, U.S. officials said on Friday, as eight more states reported their first cases of the fast-spreading respiratory disease.

Headline: Americans divided on party lines over risk from coronavirus: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Americans who now find themselves politically divided over seemingly everything are now forming two very different views of another major issue: the dangers of the new coronavirus.

Headline: U.S. financial regulators start contingency planning as virus reaches Washington
Article: U.S. financial regulators are preparing contingency arrangements, including travel restrictions and home-working, to ensure they can effectively oversee the financial markets as the coronavirus closes in on the U.S. capital.

Headline: WHO urges countries to make containing coronavirus 'highest priority'
Article: All countries should make containing the outbreak of COVID-19 their top priority, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Friday, pointing to Iran "national action plan" to combat one of the world's worst outbreaks after a slow start.

Headline: Trump abruptly replaces acting chief of staff Mulvaney with North Carolina lawmaker
Article: President Donald Trump parted ways on Friday with acting White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney and replaced him with conservative lawmaker and close ally Mark Meadows, who was a strong Trump defender during the Democratic impeachment drive.

Headline: Twenty-one people test positive for coronavirus aboard cruise ship off San Francisco
Article: Twenty-one people tested positive for coronavirus on Friday aboard a ship that was denied entry to San Francisco Bay after a number of passengers and crew developed flu-like symptoms on the vessel, which had been linked to infections from an earlier voyage.

Headline: House panel seeks rehearing over White House counsel subpoena fight
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee on Friday asked a federal appeals court to reconsider a ruling that prevented the panel from compelling a former Senior White House lawyer to testify about his role in President Donald Trump's efforts to impede the Mueller investigation.

Headline: U.S. excludes Chinese face masks, medical gear from tariffs as coronavirus spreads
Article: The U.S. Trade Representative's office in recent days granted exclusions from import tariffs for dozens of medical products imported from China, including face masks, hand sanitizing wipes and examination gloves, filings with the agency showed on Friday.

Headline: SXSW canceled as tech and entertainment world faces coronavirus
Article: The South by Southwest music, technology and film festival in Austin, Texas, was canceled on Friday, adding to a growing list of events being suspended around the world over concerns about the spreading coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: N.Y. travel insurance to cover coronavirus in 'cancel for any reason' policies, Gov. Cuomo says
Article: Travel insurers and travel agents will offer New York residents and businesses the ability to buy coverage that would allow them to cancel a trip for any reason, including those related to coronavirus, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said on Friday.

Headline: U.S. raises travel alert levels for Azerbaijan, Turkmenistan over coronavirus
Article: The U.S. State Department on Friday raised its alert level for travel to Azerbaijan, warning Americans to reconsider travel there due to a coronavirus outbreak and response measures implemented by the country's government.

Headline: Trump campaign sues CNN for libel over Russia opinion piece
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's re-election campaign sued CNN for libel on Friday, over an opinion piece that said the campaign had left open the possibility of seeking Russia's help in the 2020 election.

Headline: Biden racks up endorsements as Sanders goes on the attack in U.S. presidential race
Article: Two former presidential rivals endorsed Joe Biden on Friday in the latest sign that the Democratic establishment is coalescing around the former vice president to stop the candidacy of Bernie Sanders, who ratcheted up attacks on his rival ahead of crucial contests next week.

Headline: Biden says his U.S. presidential campaign has raised about $22 million in five days
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said on Friday his campaign had raised about $22 million in five days, a figure that would represent continued momentum after his sweep of primary wins on Super Tuesday.

Headline: Trump 'dossier' author Christopher Steele rejects prosecutor's interview request
Article: The former British intelligence officer who produced a 'dossier' linking Donald Trump and his presidential campaign to Russia has declined to give an interview to a prosecutor assigned by U.S. Attorney General William Barr to investigate aspects of the 2016 U.S. campaign, three sources familiar with the matter said.

Headline: Washington state announces new coronavirus death, 15th in U.S.
Article: A hospital in Washington state said on Friday that a 12th person had died there from coronavirus, bringing to 15 the total deaths from the respiratory illness in the United States.

Headline: Union tells Trump administration to take coronavirus seriously for government workers
Article: A union representing U.S. government employees called on the Trump administration on Friday "to take the coronavirus seriously" for federal workers, especially those working in areas directly impacted by the outbreak.

Headline: After U.S. Congress and Fed's quick coronavirus response, next steps likely tougher for Washington
Article: The U.S. Federal Reserve and Congress moved swiftly to confront the growing coronavirus threat this week, as the central bank propped up the economy and the House and Senate approved $8.3 billion for vaccine development and other steps to contain the virus.

Headline: Michigan to sanitize voting booths, machines amid coronavirus fears
Article: Officials in Michigan are telling election clerks to repeatedly sanitize voting booths, touchscreen machines, pencils and other equipment ahead of Tuesday's Democratic primary, amid concerns about the impact of coronavirus on the 2020 presidential contest.

Headline: Romney to support subpoena in Senate probe of Hunter Biden
Article: U.S. Senator Mitt Romney will vote to allow a subpoena in a Senate Republican investigation of Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's businessman son, Hunter Biden, his office said on Friday.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in New York state increases to 33, governor says
Article: The number of people in New York state who have tested positive for the coronavirus has increased by 11 to 33, governor Andrew Cuomo said on Friday.

Headline: Coronavirus cases surge across U.S. as Americans face looming outbreak
Article: The coronavirus outbreak radiated across the United States on Thursday, surfacing in at least four new states and San Francisco as Congress quickly approved more than $8 billion to fight the outbreak.

Headline: U.S. CDC reports 213 coronavirus cases, including those under investigation
Article: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday reported 65 more cases of coronavirus in the country, which includes cases reported by individual states that were yet to be confirmed by the agency.

Headline: Trump signs $8.3 billion spending bill to boost coronavirus response
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday signed an emergency spending bill for $8.3 billion to ramp up the nation's response to the coronavirus, providing funds for state and local officials to combat the spread of infections as the number of cases grows in the United States.

Headline: Romney says U.S. Senate Republican probe of Biden appears political
Article: U.S. Senator Mitt Romney, the lone Republican to vote to convict President Donald Trump of abuse of power following his impeachment, said on Thursday a Senate Republican investigation of Democratic presidential front-runner Joe Biden appeared politically motivated.

Headline: Biden's comeback leaves Sanders little time to expand appeal
Article: After losing the momentum in the Democratic presidential race, Bernie Sanders has work to do - and little time to do it - to build the "multiracial, multigenerational movement" he says will propel him to victory over Republican President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: Facebook decides to take down Trump 2020 campaign's 'census' ads
Article: Facebook Inc on Thursday removed ads by President Donald Trump's re-election campaign that asked users to fill out an "Official 2020 Congressional District Census" because the ads violate the company's policy against misinformation on the government's census.

Headline: U.S. legislation targets online child sexual abuse; threatens encryption on Facebook, Google
Article: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators on the powerful judiciary committee on Thursday introduced a bill aimed at curbing online distribution of child sexual abuse material that technology and civil liberties groups said was an attack on strong encryption critical to billions of people.

Headline: U.S. Congress approves, sends to Trump $8.3 billion to fight coronavirus
Article: The U.S. Senate on Thursday passed and sent to President Donald Trump an $8.3 billion funding bill to help state and local governments combat the spreading coronavirus, as public health experts outlined efforts to rapidly accelerate testing for the disease.

Headline: Democratic U.S. Senator Schumer expresses regret for Supreme Court comments
Article: Chuck Schumer, the top U.S. Senate Democrat, expressed regret on Thursday for remarks he made a day earlier that two Supreme Court justices appointed by President Donald Trump would "pay the price" if they rule in favor of abortion restrictions.

Headline: Warren ends White House bid, leaving Biden and Sanders to fight for Democratic nod
Article: Elizabeth Warren ended her presidential campaign on Thursday after concluding she had no realistic path to the Democratic nomination, leaving behind a two-man battle between former Vice President Joe Biden and Senator Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Michael Bloomberg to fund independent group to boost Democrats this year
Article: Michael Bloomberg will form an independent group to help elect the Democratic presidential nominee in November, fulfilling a vow to put his $60 billion personal fortune to work even after abandoning his own White House bid on Wednesday.

Headline: Back on top: nationally, Democrats are again rallying around Biden: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Just days after Joe Biden's commanding wins in most of the Super Tuesday primaries, Democrats across the country are again rallying around the former vice president as their best hope for defeating Republican President Donald Trump in November, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national opinion poll.

Headline: Montana Governor Bullock looks at U.S. Senate run, lifting Democratic hopes: source
Article: Steve Bullock, the Democratic governor of Montana and a former 2020 presidential candidate, is seriously considering a U.S. Senate run, a decision that would give Democrats another competitive race in their bid to reclaim the chamber this November.

Headline: U.S. will be able to test 400,000 people for coronavirus by week's end: officials
Article: U.S. health officials said on Thursday they expect to be able to get enough coronavirus tests to public laboratories this week to test about 400,000 people, and acknowledged the challenge for doctors seeking to get patients screened for the disease.

Headline: Elizabeth Warren ends 2020 Democratic White House bid, says 'we will persist'
Article: Elizabeth Warren, the liberal firebrand who emerged as a top Democratic contender for the White House on the strength of an anti-corruption platform backed by a dizzying array of policy proposals, ended her campaign on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. CDC reports 149 coronavirus cases, including those under investigation
Article: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Thursday reported 149 cases of coronavirus in the country, which includes those reported by individual states that were yet to be confirmed by the agency.

Headline: Trump says he will block U.S. funds to 'sanctuary' jurisdictions
Article: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he would withhold money from so-called sanctuary jurisdictions after a U.S. court ruled that his administration could block federal law enforcement funds to states and cities that do not cooperate with federal immigration authorities.

Headline: Factbox: Three remain in hunt for U.S. Democratic presidential nomination
Article: The field of candidates seeking the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination shrank to three on Thursday as U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts ended her bid after failing to win her home state.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers to hold hearing on bill that fights child sexual abuse while threatening encryption
Article: The Senate Judiciary Committee said on Wednesday it would hold a hearing on March 11 to discuss legislation aimed at curbing the online distribution of child sexual abuse material and penalizing companies that offer encryption.

Headline: Biden's Super Tuesday surge reshapes Democratic race, Bloomberg drops out
Article: The search for a Democrat to challenge Republican President Donald Trump in the Nov. 3 election narrowed on Wednesday to a choice between Bernie Sanders and Joe Biden, who staged a comeback in Super Tuesday voting to become the undisputed standard-bearer of the party's moderate wing.

Headline: Biden has strong Super Tuesday showing, Sanders leads in California
Article: A resurgent Joe Biden rode a wave of momentum to win at least eight states on Super Tuesday and Bernie Sanders was leading in the biggest race in California, setting up a one-on-one battle for the Democratic presidential nomination.

Headline: U.S. House passes $8.3 billion bill to battle coronavirus; Senate vote due Thursday
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved on Wednesday an $8.3 billion bill to combat the spread of the new coronavirus and develop vaccines for the highly contagious disease, sending it to the Senate for final passage.

Headline: After Biden speech disrupted, U.S. lawmakers want Secret Service to protect candidates
Article: U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday sought Secret Service protection for Democratic presidential candidates after Joe Biden's wife and a senior staffer shielded the former vice president from protesters during a victory speech on Super Tuesday.

Headline: Airline executives tell Trump: planes getting cleaner amid coronavirus concerns
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump met on Wednesday with executives from some of the nation's top airlines who said they have stepped up procedures to keep planes "clean and disinfected" amid concerns about the coronavirus.

Headline: Biden's presidential campaign raised $7.1 million in online donation in two days
Article: Former Vice President Joe Biden's presidential campaign raised $7.1 million in online donations in 42 hours, his campaign said late on Wednesday, a boost in fundraising for a candidate who has struggled to keep pace with his rivals and has been vastly outspent by fellow frontrunner Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Washington Democrats cancel event as coronavirus starts to take toll on U.S. campaign season
Article: The highly contagious coronavirus currently making its way around the world had its first impact on the 2020 U.S. election campaign as Washington state Democrats canceled an upcoming weekend fundraiser just days before the party primary there.

Headline: Senate Republican sees next step in Biden probe as Democratic presidential race narrows
Article: A U.S. Senate Republican disclosed the next step in his probe of Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden's son on Wednesday, after the former vice president emerged as front-runner in the race for his party's nomination.

Headline: Biden's Super Tuesday surge reboots Democratic presidential race
Article: In the space of 24 hours, the Democratic presidential contest suddenly became a two-man race between former Vice President Joe Biden, whose campaign was floundering just a week ago, and U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders, the party's liberal champion.

Headline: Bloomberg bows out of presidential contest but his money will stay
Article: After a not-so-Super Tuesday, Michael Bloomberg is out of the presidential nomination contest. But the power of his $60 billion fortune is staying in.

Headline: At a glance: Super Tuesday states and delegate counts
Article: Former Vice President Joe Biden won ten states in a strong Super Tuesday showing while his main rival Bernie Sanders was on pace to pick up four, including California.

Headline: Factbox: Sessions faces runoff for Alabama Senate; Texas incumbents holding off challengers
Article: Republican Jeff Sessions, a former attorney general under President Donald Trump, was headed to a runoff in Alabama as he sought on Tuesday to advance his bid to return to the U.S. Senate in a wave of congressional primaries.

Headline: Defense Department weakens U.S. military housing bill after consulting industry
Article: A sweeping U.S. military housing reform plan, pitched as a way to protect service families from shoddy homes and unresponsive landlords, has been watered down to remove several protections tenants and Congress had sought.

Headline: Factbox: Four Democrats still seek the U.S. presidential nomination
Article: The field of candidates seeking the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination shrank to four on Wednesday after billionaire former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg ended his campaign and said he was backing Joe Biden.

Headline: Democrat Warren reassessing path forward after disappointing 'Super Tuesday,' campaign aide says
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren is "talking to her team to assess the path forward," a campaign aide said on Wednesday, after the U.S. senator from Massachusetts saw disappointing results across the board on Tuesday.

Headline: Bloomberg to reassess campaign as ad blitz fails to win Super Tuesday voters
Article: Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg will reassess the future of his Democratic presidential campaign after his disappointing showing on Super Tuesday, but a campaign official said that did not mean his candidacy would end on Wednesday.

Headline: Sanders asks court to keep Los Angeles County polls open after voting delays
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders' campaign requested an emergency injunction on Tuesday asking for polls in Los Angeles County to stay open for an extra two hours after reports of delays and long lines.

Headline: Super Tuesday voters largely split into two camps: Bernie versus Biden - Edison Research
Article: The race for the Democratic nomination is effectively down to a tight two-way race after almost a third of U.S. states cast ballots on Super Tuesday, with front-runners Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders drawing support from sharply divergent groups.

Headline: Biden boom slows Sanders' march on Super Tuesday
Article: With the dramatic winnowing of the Democratic presidential field, the 14 nominating contests held on Tuesday largely came down to a single question: Could former Vice President Joe Biden amass enough delegates to slow Senator Bernie Sandersâ€™ path to the nomination?

Headline: Trump campaign sues Washington Post over opinion pieces, after suing NY Times
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's re-election campaign sued the Washington Post for libel on Tuesday over two opinion pieces that it said suggested improper ties between the campaign and Russia, North Korea or both.

Headline: Latino voters in U.S. started changing outcomes in 2018 - they may do so again in 2020
Article: John Verdejo moved to North Carolina by way of the Bronx, with only basketball great Michael Jordan and the folksy humor of the Andy Griffith television show as references, neither particularly relevant to a Puerto Rican family in the mid-1990s.

Headline: Super Tuesday voting so far free of cyber meddling, U.S. officials say
Article: The Super Tuesday primary elections were so far free of any signs of interference, said national security professionals who gathered in Northern Virginia in an unprecedented monitoring effort to counter cyberattacks and foreign disinformation.

Headline: Tennessee to extend voting hours at all polling sites after storms
Article: Several Tennessee polling places will stay open at least an extra hour to allow Democratic primary voters on Super Tuesday to continue to cast ballots after the state was hit by deadly storms overnight, the state's Democratic Party announced on Twitter.

Headline: Voters in four big Super Tuesday states cite coronavirus as factor: Edison Research
Article: About three out of four Democratic primary voters in four big states - California, Texas, Virginia and North Carolina - said the new coronavirus was a factor in their vote on Tuesday, according to exit polls analyzed by Edison Research.

Headline: Sparks fly at budget hearing as Mnuchin grilled about Trump tax returns
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Tuesday denied he was breaking the law by refusing to turn over President Donald Trump's tax returns and took aim at a Democratic lawmaker who has continued to press for the documents.

Headline: Scared of Sanders presidency, Wall Street Dems double down on moderates
Article: Prominent Wall Street Democrats have been hatching strategies to ensure their presidential nominee will be a moderate, while also turning their attention to down-ticket candidates in congressional races as a "hedge" against that possibility, people involved with the efforts told Reuters.

Headline: 'Open season on journalists': U.S. lawmakers want information on Saudi Khashoggi's death
Article: Senior Republican and Democratic lawmakers renewed efforts this week to push President Donald Trump's administration to make public information about the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, which U.S. intelligence officials blame on Saudi Arabia's most senior leadership.

Headline: Coronavirus funding bill could be ready for Trump's signature by Friday -U.S. Senator
Article: U.S. Senator Patrick Leahy, the top Democrat on the Senate Appropriations Committee, said on Tuesday an emergency funding bill to fight the coronavirus could be completed and ready for President Donald Trump's signature by Friday evening.

Headline: In a Texas chicken joint, Biden and onetime rival Buttigieg unite to stop Sanders
Article: It was a scene that was hard to imagine just one week ago.

Headline: 'Refused/Angry/Republican': How 2020 text campaigns learn from voters' replies
Article: When Brian Durst got a text message from the campaign of U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders, the restaurant cook in Hawaii sent back a photo of himself wearing a 'Trump 2020' cap.

Headline: U.S. Senate leader says he hopes Trump intelligence nominee will get bipartisan vote
Article: (This March 2 story corrects spelling of Maguire in paragraph 9)

Headline: Wuhan closes makeshift hospital as new coronavirus cases in China drop sharply
Article: The Chinese city at the center of the coronavirus epidemic closed its first makeshift hospital, one of 16 hurriedly built to handle the epidemic, after it discharged the last recovered patients, state broadcaster CCTV reported on Monday.

Headline: Explainer: What's at stake on Super Tuesday for U.S. Democrats
Article: Fourteen states and one U.S. territory are hosting Super Tuesday primary elections, a flurry that could bring more clarity about which Democratic presidential contender voters prefer to challenge Republican President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: U.S. says to reduce employees at Chinese media; China hints of response
Article: The United States on Monday said it was slashing the number of Chinese nationals permitted to work at the U.S. offices of major Chinese state-owned media outlets to retaliate against Beijing's "long-standing intimidation and harassment of journalists."

Headline: China complains to U.S. embassy over restrictions on Chinese media
Article: China's foreign ministry said it lodged "stern representations" with the U.S. embassy on Tuesday over Washington's decision to reduce the number of Chinese nationals permitted to work at U.S. offices of Chinese media outlets.

Headline: Moderate Democrats close ranks as Buttigieg, Klobuchar endorse Biden
Article: Former rivals Pete Buttigieg and Amy Klobuchar endorsed Joe Biden's presidential candidacy on Monday on the eve of Super Tuesday voting, as moderate Democrats rallied around the former vice president to strengthen his challenge to front-runner Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Factbox: Five Democrats remain in fight for U.S. presidential nomination
Article: The field of candidates seeking the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination dropped to five with Monday's departure of U.S. Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota as the race now heads to voters in 14 states for Super Tuesday.

Headline: Democrat Beto O'Rourke endorses Joe Biden for president
Article: Former Texas Congressman Beto O'Rourke endorsed former Vice President Joe Biden for Democrats' presidential nomination, as moderate Democrats rallied around the former vice president to strengthen his challenge to front-runner Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Former U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke to endorse Joe Biden: NYT
Article: Former Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke was set to endorse Joe Biden's White House bid, according to the New York Times, joining dozens of current and former Democrats who rushed to endorse the former vice president on Monday.

Headline: U.S. Supreme Court takes up Democratic bid to defend Obamacare
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear a politically explosive case on whether Obamacare is lawful, taking up a bid by 20 Democratic-led states including California and New York to preserve the landmark healthcare law.

Headline: U.S. Republican seeks first subpoena in Hunter Biden probe
Article: Days after Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden scored a major win at his party's primary in South Carolina, a Republican U.S. senator is seeking the first subpoena in a probe of his son Hunter Biden's role at Ukraine gas company Burisma.

Headline: China's U.N. ambassador: inappropriate for U.S. to interfere with Chinese journalists
Article: The United States should not interfere with the work of Chinese journalists, the Chinese ambassador to the United Nations, Zhang Jun, said on Monday.

Headline: U.S. Supreme Court conservatives lean toward Trump over rapid deportation
Article: Conservative U.S. Supreme Court justices appeared sympathetic on Monday toward a bid by President Donald Trump's administration to buttress its power to quickly deport illegal immigrants without court interference in a politically charged election-year case concerning one of Trump's signature issues.

Headline: Bloombergâ€™s big bet: Can money beat Biden's momentum?
Article: In his brief three-month campaign for president, Michael Bloomberg poured nearly three-quarters of a billion dollars into building an advertising and data-mining juggernaut unlike anything the political world had ever seen.

Headline: Moderate Klobuchar's 'stealth campaign' for U.S. presidency comes to an end
Article: Amy Klobuchar, a U.S. senator from Minnesota whose wit and straightforward Midwestern style won key endorsements and bolstered her long-shot campaign, is ending her bid for the Democratic presidential nomination and endorsing fellow moderate Joe Biden, her campaign said on Monday.

Headline: Germany confirms at least 28 new coronavirus infections
Article: Germany on Monday confirmed at least 28 new coronavirus cases, bringing the number of infections in Europe's most populous country to 157 from 129 on Sunday, the Robert Koch Institute for disease control said, adding the risk was now "moderate".

Headline: Pete Buttigieg plans to endorse Joe Biden in Democratic primary
Article: Former South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg plans to endorse Joe Biden in the Democratic presidential nominating contest on Monday, shortly after ending his own bid for the White House, a top Buttigieg adviser told Reuters.

Headline: Louvre closes for second day as staff walk out over coronavirus risks
Article: The Louvre museum in Paris shut its doors to art lovers and tourists for a second day on Monday after staff walked out over health risks associated with the coronavirus.

Headline: India reports three more cases of coronavirus, including Italian national
Article: An Italian national tested positive for coronavirus in the western Indian state of Rajasthan, a major tourist destination, a hospital official said on Monday, taking the number of people who have tested positive in the country to six.

Headline: Washington state confirms second U.S. coronavirus death; New York reports first case
Article: Health officials in Washington state said late Sunday that a nursing home resident had died after contracting coronavirus, while New York's governor confirmed his state's first positive case, as the virus moved out of its West Coast foothold.

Headline: Factbox: Sports events hit by the coronavirus epidemic
Article: The following is a list of international sports events hit by the outbreak of the new coronavirus:

Headline: Iraq announces two new coronavirus cases - Health Ministry
Article: Iraq has detected two new coronavirus patients, both of whom had recently visited Iran, the Health Ministry said on Monday, bringing the total cases recorded so far to 21.

Headline: Nike temporarily closes European HQ in the Netherlands due to coronavirus case
Article: U.S. sportswear giant Nike said on Monday its European headquarters in the Netherlands would be closed until Wednesday after an employee was infected with the new coronavirus.

Headline: Iceland confirms first three cases of coronavirus, in patients returning from Italy
Article: The first three cases of people infected with coronavirus have been confirmed in Iceland, the country's Department of Civil Protection and Emergency Management said in a statement late on Sunday.

Headline: 'Moment of truth:' Buttigieg drops out of Democratic race two days before Super Tuesday
Article: Pete Buttigieg dropped out of the race for the Democratic presidential nomination on Sunday, saying he no longer saw a chance of winning, the day after fellow moderate Joe Biden won a big victory in South Carolina.

Headline: 'Mayor Pete' Buttigieg ends improbable U.S. presidential bid
Article: Pete Buttigieg, who entered the Democratic presidential race as a relative unknown and positioned himself as the future of the party during an improbable rise to the top tier of a crowded field, ended his White House bid on Sunday.

Headline: South Korea reports 123 new coronavirus cases, taking total to 4,335: Yonhap
Article: South Korea reported 123 new coronavirus cases, taking the country's total infections to 4,335, the Yonhap news agency said, citing health authorities.

Headline: Japan confirms five more cases of coronavirus in Hokkaido: NHK
Article: Japanese authorities have confirmed five more cases of coronavirus in Hokkaido, public broadcaster NHK said on Monday, days after the northern island declared a state of emergency.

Headline: U.S. still unsure how first American fatality contracted virus: Azar
Article: U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar said on Sunday it remained unclear how the first American to die of coronavirus contracted the disease, and that there was no evidence he had a connection to someone who had traveled to an outbreak area.

Headline: CERAWeek energy conference in Houston scrapped over coronavirus worries
Article: Coronavirus concerns prompted organizers on Sunday to cancel one of the world's most prestigious gatherings of oil ministers and top executives from the energy and financial industries scheduled for this month in Houston.

Headline: Australia confirms first community transmissions of coronavirus
Article: Australian health officials said on Monday that a woman and a male doctor have contracted coronavirus - becoming the first cases of community transmissions in the country.

Headline: Kuwait has 10 new cases of coronavirus, brings total to 56 - TV
Article: Kuwait's Health Ministry announced 10 new cases of coronavirus in the country on Monday bringing the total number to 56, a ministry official said.

Headline: Factbox: Six Democrats still in the fight for U.S. presidential nomination
Article: The field of candidates seeking the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination was set to drop to six on Sunday as former South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg prepared to end his candidacy, according to an aide.

Headline: U.S. investigating whistleblower allegations; vows to keep federal workers safe
Article: The U.S. government on Sunday said it was investigating complaints that federal workers were not given proper protective gear and training before greeting U.S. citizens evacuated from a cruise ship that had 691 people infected with the new coronavirus.

Headline: U.S. aims to expand number of diagnostic kits for coronavirus; expand surveillance testing
Article: The United States has 75,000 diagnostic kits for testing coronavirus available at the moment and will expand that number "radically" in coming weeks, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar told ABC's "This Week" on Sunday.

Headline: Sanders raised $46.5 million in February, Warren $29 million, Biden $18 million
Article: Democratic U.S. presidential front-runner Bernie Sanders raised $46.5 million in February, his campaign said on Sunday, and will launch new television ad buys in nine states with primaries later this month after this week's Super Tuesday contests.

Headline: Abortion rights face stern new test at conservative U.S. Supreme Court
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court this week gets its first chance to consider new curbs on abortion rights with President Donald Trump's two conservative appointees on the bench as it examines the legality of a Louisiana law that could force two of the state's three clinics that perform the procedure to shut down.

Headline: Democratic presidential hopeful Warren raised more than $29 million in February
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren pulled in more than $29 million in February, according to a campaign memo released on Sunday, more in a single month than the campaign had raised in any previous quarter.

Headline: Joe Biden got his South Carolina comeback. Will it be enough?
Article: MONTGOMERY, Ala. - Joe Biden got the win in South Carolina he desperately needed.

Headline: Big South Carolina win gives Joe Biden campaign new life; Super Tuesday looms
Article: An outpouring of black voter support propelled Joe Biden to a convincing victory in South Carolinaâ€™s Democratic primary on Saturday, resurrecting his faltering White House bid and giving the former vice president a chance to claim he is the moderate alternative to front-runner Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Environmentalist Tom Steyer ends 2020 Democratic presidential bid
Article: Billionaire environmentalist Tom Steyer, a fierce critic of President Donald Trump who had pushed early for his impeachment, abandoned his bid for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination on Saturday after trailing in third place in the South Carolina primary, a campaign source told Reuters.

Headline: Key black lawmaker's backing factors big in Biden's South Carolina win: poll
Article: Joe Biden bet his future as a Democratic presidential contender on South Carolina and its large pool of African-American voters, and the backing of a leading black congressman vaulted him to victory there on Saturday, according to exit polls by Edison Research.

Headline: Factbox: Seven Democrats still in the fight for U.S. presidential nomination
Article: Seven candidates remained in the U.S. Democratic presidential nominating contest after the first four states voted in the state-by-state selection process.

Headline: Biden projected to win South Carolina Democratic presidential primary
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden is projected to win the South Carolina Democratic presidential primary on Saturday and is expected to defeat rival Bernie Sanders decisively for his first victory of the 2020 election campaign, according an analysis of exit polls by Edison Research.

Headline: Sanders courts Massachusetts voters on Warren's home turf
Article: Bernie Sanders drew a massive crowd in Boston on Saturday, touting his grassroots-funded campaign in progressive rival Elizabeth Warrenâ€™s home state ahead of the Democratic primary in Massachusetts on Tuesday.

Headline: Bloomberg in South Carolina: Not on the ballot and not liked - poll
Article: Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg was not on the ballot in Saturday's Democratic presidential primary in South Carolina, but he was still on voters' minds - and not in a good way.

Headline: Trump again nominates Congressman Ratcliffe as his intelligence director
Article: President Donald Trump said on Friday he again was tapping Republican Representative John Ratcliffe to be the nation's top spy, a loyalist whose first nomination he dropped last year amid questions about a lack of experience and possible resume embellishment.

Headline: Trump to hold press conference on coronavirus on Saturday in White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump, who earlier this week described the risk from the new coronavirus as "very low" in the United States, said he will hold a White House press conference about the fast-spreading flu-like illness at 1:30 pm EST (18:30 GMT) on Saturday.

Headline: Afghanistan deal is political boost for Trump but pullout could take years
Article: President Donald Trump's quest for a second term received a boost on Saturday from the deal with the Taliban for a troop pullout from Afghanistan but it could take time - possibly years - before all U.S. forces come home from America's longest war.

Headline: Trump allies hope to ride anti-socialist rhetoric to election win
Article: Conservative activists are enthusiastically taking up Republican President Donald Trump's re-election rallying cry that his Democratic adversaries are pursuing a radical socialist ideology that will ruin the United States.

Headline: Trump wins bid to block McGahn testimony sought by House Democrats
Article: A divided U.S. appeals court handed President Donald Trump a major legal victory on Friday by dismissing a Democratic-led congressional panel's lawsuit seeking to enforce a subpoena for testimony from former White House Counsel Donald McGahn.

Headline: On the trail: Biden aims for 'significant' South Carolina win, Trump urges supporters to intervene
Article: Presidential contender Joe Biden told South Carolina's Democrats on Friday that they can take control of the White House if they pick "the right nominee" to face President Donald Trump.

Headline: House panel seeks to interview the four career prosecutors who quit Roger Stone case
Article: The Democrat-controlled U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee on Friday said it is seeking interviews with current and former federal prosecutors who may have knowledge of political meddling in criminal cases, including the four career officials who earlier this month quit the Roger Stone case.

Headline: SoftBank communications chief Gary Ginsberg takes leave to aid Bloomberg campaign: sources
Article: Gary Ginsberg, the global head of communications for SoftBank Group Corp , has taken an indefinite leave of absence to advise Michael Bloomberg's U.S. presidential campaign, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headline: 'Wall-to-wall campaign': Californians bombarded with Bloomberg ads
Article: Elizabeth Isabella, a homemaker in Burbank, California, was driving car pool when her 10-year-old son Lachlan started reciting YouTube ads by U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg.

Headline: Bloomberg says he would de-escalate trade tensions with China
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg on Friday pledged to de-escalate U.S.-China trade tensions, make it easier for farmers to hire foreign laborers and increase federal agricultural research.

Headline: Mulvaney alleges U.S. media is focusing on coronavirus to hurt Trump, advises turning off TV
Article: White House Acting Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney on Friday played down the deadly coronavirus that has caused U.S. stock markets to plummet, telling top conservatives that wall-to-wall news coverage of the disease is a ploy to hurt his boss, President Donald Trump.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers may vote on coronavirus response bill as soon as next week: source
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives could vote on an emergency bill aimed at providing funding for the country's coronavirus response as soon as next week, a congressional source said on Friday.

Headline: Super Tuesday contests offer big rewards, challenges in Democratic presidential race
Article: Fourteen states and one U.S. territory host Super Tuesday primaries next week, a flurry that could bring more clarity about which Democratic presidential contender voters prefer to challenge Republican President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: Bloomberg would not ban U.S. oil exports in climate plan, unlike rival Democrats
Article: Media billionaire Michael Bloomberg would allow the United States to keep exporting crude oil overseas if he is elected president, his campaign says, unlike his top Democratic rivals who have pledged to ban oil exports immediately to fight climate change.

Headline: U.S. judge mulls holding Russian firm linked to election meddling in contempt
Article: A federal judge is weighing civil contempt charges against a Russian company accused of funding a Russian troll farm's interference in the 2016 U.S. election to boost President Donald Trump's candidacy after prosecutors accused the St. Petersburg-based firm of defying subpoenas to hand over documents.

Headline: On the trail: Democrats slam Trump's coronavirus response
Article: Democratic presidential hopefuls spread out across South Carolina on Thursday as the clock ticked down to the state's Saturday primary, the first big test of their appeal with African-American voters.

Headline: Republicansâ€™ â€˜Operation Chaosâ€™ seeks to undermine South Carolina's Democratic primary
Article: Republican activists in South Carolina are urging party voters to do the seemingly unthinkable: support U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders' bid for the White House in the state's Democratic primary on Saturday.

Headline: How the Democratic nominating battle could end in a messy 'brokered convention'
Article: Seemingly every four years, political pundits speculate about a "brokered" U.S. presidential convention - only to see a nominee selected with little or no drama. But that may not be the case in 2020.

Headline: House Democrats to introduce bill clawing back border wall funds
Article: Democrats in the U.S. House of Representatives are working on new legislation that would "claw back" funds the White House took from the Pentagon's budget to fund construction of a wall on the U.S.-Mexico border, the chairman of the House Armed Services committee said on Thursday.

Headline: Sanders presidency could start with U.S. jobs program, then scale up
Article: A Bernie Sanders administration might logically start with a roughly $300 billion federal jobs guarantee, a cornerstone of worker protection, says a key adviser to the front-runner in the U.S. Democratic presidential nominating race.

Headline: Contested Democratic convention in the cards? Betting market thinks so
Article: Bernie Sanders has grabbed the early lead in the race to become the Democratic presidential nominee to challenge President Donald Trump in November, but one online political wagering market is showing an increase in bets on a different outcome: A contested party convention.

Headline: Democratic candidates' drilling ban would cost U.S. economy $7 trillion: oil group
Article: Banning hydraulic fracturing and halting new drilling on federal land would cost the U.S. economy $7 trillion in the next decade and kill millions of jobs, the U.S. oil industryâ€™s main lobby group said on Thursday in a report targeting the climate plans of top Democratic presidential candidates.

Headline: Coronavirus spreads faster outside China, stoking global fears
Article: The number of new coronavirus infections inside China - the source of the outbreak - was for the first time overtaken by fresh cases elsewhere on Wednesday, with Italy and Iran emerging as epicenters of the rapidly spreading illness.

Headline: Trump campaign says it is suing New York Times over Russia opinion piece
Article: President Donald Trump's re-election campaign said on Wednesday it was filing a libel suit accusing the New York Times of intentionally publishing a false opinion article that suggested Russia and the campaign had an overarching deal in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Trump promises more lawsuits against New York Times
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday more lawsuits would be filed against the New York Times after his re-election campaign said it was filing a libel suit over what it said was a false opinion article that suggested Russia and the campaign had an overarching deal in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Biden lands key endorsement three days before South Carolina presidential contest
Article: Democratic presidential contender Joe Biden won the endorsement of an influential black congressman from South Carolina on Wednesday, three days before the state's primary where he is competing with national front-runner Bernie Sanders for the crucial African-American vote.

Headline: Court allows Trump to withhold funds from 'sanctuary' jurisdictions
Article: President Donald Trump's administration can withhold millions of dollars in law enforcement funds from states and cities that refuse to cooperate with federal immigration authorities, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump campaign plans information centers for black voters in battleground states
Article: President Donald Trump's campaign said on Wednesday it plans to open information centers for black voters in 15 cities in battleground states in hopes of increasing support for the Republican president's re-election bid among a key Democratic constituency.

Headline: Can Sanders beat Trump? A growing number of Democratic voters say yes
Article: Bernie Sanders' Democratic presidential rivals warn that nominating the self-described democratic socialist will ensure President Donald Trump's re-election, but a growing number of the party's voters see the senator as their best chance of winning in November.

Headline: Israel's Netanyahu pulls his punches after Sanders calls him a racist
Article: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday Bernie Sanders was wrong to call him a racist during a debate among contenders for the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination, but shied away from attacking the senator in return.

Headline: Lawmakers criticize Pentagon for shifting money to Mexico border wall
Article: U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday criticized the Pentagon's decision to shift nearly $4 billion from the defense budget to pay for a wall on the border with Mexico, saying that it circumvented Congress' authority and could affect the military's ability to reprogram funds in the future.

Headline: Vietnam completes F1 track amid coronavirus concern
Article: The track for Vietnam's first Formula One Grand Prix in Hanoi on April 5 has been completed, organisers said on Wednesday amid continuing concern about the coronavirus epidemic that has caused the cancellation of China's race.

Headline: Senior House Democrat Clyburn endorses Biden for president
Article: James Clyburn, the No. 3 Democrat in the House of Representatives and an influential black legislator from the early voting state of South Carolina, said on Wednesday he would endorse former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden's bid for president.

Headline: Presidential hopeful Warren latest to press BlackRock on climate
Article: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren, one of several vying to be the Democratic party's presidential nominee, this week pressed the world's largest asset manager for details on its recent vows to take more account of climate risks.

Headline: U.S. Supreme Court bars lawsuit over cross-border shooting of Mexican teen
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday barred a lawsuit against a Border Patrol agent for fatally shooting a 15-year-old Mexican boy on Mexican soil from across the border in Texas, refusing to open the door for foreign nationals to pursue civil rights cases in American courts in such incidents.

Headline: 'Chaos ... coming our way' - Top quotes from the Democratic presidential debate
Article: Democratic presidential front-runner Bernie Sanders came under attack from his rivals on Tuesday as seven candidates competing to take on U.S. President Donald Trump in November debated in Charleston, South Carolina.

Headline: Raucous Democratic debate yields no clear challenger to Sanders
Article: The stakes could not have been higher at the Democratic presidential debate on Tuesday, with the South Carolina primary and Super Tuesday contests looming in the week ahead.

Headline: What are 'sanctuary' cities and why is Trump targeting them?
Article: U.S. Republican President Donald Trump has intensified his administration's fight in recent weeks against Democratic-led "sanctuary" jurisdictions that limit cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.

Headline: At rowdy debate, Democratic rivals warn Sanders nomination would be 'catastrophe'
Article: Democratic presidential candidates unleashed withering attacks on Bernie Sanders in a boisterous debate in South Carolina on Tuesday, assailing his ambitious economic agenda and warning his nomination would be a "catastrophe" that would cost Democrats the White House and control of Congress.

Headline: Mother of Mexican teen shot at border fears for others after U.S. ruling
Article: A Mexican mother whose teenage son, Sergio Adrian Hernandez Guereca, was shot dead by a U.S. Border Patrol agent from the other side of the border 10 years ago fears a U.S. Supreme Court ruling on Tuesday that barred her lawsuit could endanger others.

Headline: U.S. judge seems skeptical about giving Trump adviser Stone a new trial
Article: A U.S. judge on Tuesday signaled skepticism toward a bid by Roger Stone, a longtime adviser to President Donald Trump, to win a new trial based on claims that the jury forewoman was biased, even as Trump assailed her again on Twitter.

Headline: Sanders surpasses Biden among African American voters: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders has widened his lead for the Democratic presidential nomination and overtaken Joe Biden in support among African Americans - a voting bloc that until now has largely favored the former vice president, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national poll released on Tuesday.

Headline: Republicans look to drop domestic spying on U.S. phones, texts
Article: U.S. Senate Republicans on Tuesday reacted skeptically to the Trump administration's request to continue a controversial but inactive domestic surveillance program that collects data on U.S. phone calls and text messages.

Headline: Massive changes to California voting spark fears of Iowa-style primary chaos
Article: As he looks ahead to California's March 3 Democratic primary, Neal Kelley is having sleepless nights.

Headline: U.S. Supreme Court skeptical of law against encouraging illegal immigration
Article: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Tuesday signaled skepticism toward a federal law that made it a felony to encourage illegal immigrants to come or stay in the United States as they heard a bid by President Donald Trump's administration to revive the measure after it was struck down by a lower court.

Headline: Trump administration opens new legal front in battle against 'sanctuary' jurisdictions
Article: The Trump administration is turning to federal courts to force state and local officials to turn over records about immigrants in custody in a novel effort to circumvent so-called "sanctuary" policies.

Headline: UK court told Assange tried to call White House, Hillary Clinton over data dump
Article: Julian Assange tried to contact Hillary Clinton and the White House when he realised that unredacted U.S. diplomatic cables given to WikiLeaks were about to be dumped on the internet, his lawyer told his London extradition hearing on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. Senate Republicans overwhelmingly support Barr: McConnell
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's Attorney General William Barr still had the support of Republicans in the Senate, who control the upper chamber of Congress, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said at a news conference on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump says liberal Supreme Court Justices Ginsburg, Sotomayor should recuse
Article: President Donald Trump on Tuesday turned his ire on liberal U.S. Supreme Court Justices Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Sonia Sotomayor, making a highly unusual call for them to recuse themselves from any cases involving him or his administration.

Headline: Senator Rubio confident Trump administration will extend Florida offshore drilling ban
Article: U.S. Senator Marco Rubio on Tuesday said he was confident the administration of President Donald Trump will extend a ban on oil and gas drilling off Florida, despite its enthusiasm for opening much of the country's coasts to petroleum development.

Headline: Republicans see echoes of Trump's improbable rise in Sanders' surge
Article: Bernie Sanders' surge to the front of the Democratic presidential contest has echoes of Donald Trump's improbable 2016 nomination, according to Republican strategists who tried and failed to stop the man who later won the presidency.

Headline: U.S. Senate Democrats seeking at least $3.1 bln to battle coronavirus
Article: The U.S. Congress must pass legislation providing at least $3.1 billion in new funding to respond to concerns over the coronavirus, far beyond the Trump administration's request, Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer said on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump: No election help wanted or received from any country
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that no country was trying to help him win the November election, after a top intelligence official told lawmakers Russia was interfering in the 2020 presidential vote to help Trump win a second term.

Headline: Buttigieg wins endorsement from South Carolina newspaper
Article: The State newspaper in Columbia, South Carolina, has endorsed Pete Buttigieg for the Democratic Party presidential nomination ahead of Saturday's primary contest there, calling him the best candidate to unite Americans.

Headline: Trump says stock markets will crash if he loses election
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the U.S. stock market will crash if he loses the election this year.

Headline: Buttigieg courts South Carolina black voters with his veteran status
Article: Pete Buttigieg, the only veteran in the top tier of candidates seeking the Democratic presidential nomination, is turning to South Carolina's large military community to help shore up his nagging lack of support among black voters.

Headline: New U.S. rule targeting poor immigrants sows fear, confusion, advocates say
Article: The Trump administration rolled out a new immigration policy on Monday that bars people deemed likely to require government benefits such as housing and food assistance from obtaining permanent residency in the United States.

Headline: U.S. Democrats want Russia sanctions over 2020 election interference
Article: Senior U.S. Democrats said on Monday that President Donald Trump's administration should immediately impose sanctions on Russia after U.S. intelligence officials told members of Congress that Russia appeared to be trying to influence this year's U.S. election.

Headline: On the trail: Buttigieg heckled, Bloomberg and Sanders tussle on vandalism, guns
Article: Democratic presidential hopeful Michael Bloomberg on Monday clashed with front-runner Bernie Sanders over vandalism at Bloomberg's Chicago office and their gun control stances, while centrist rival Pete Buttigieg was heckled at a labor march.

Headline: Turnout for 2020 Nevada Democratic caucuses at 105,195: state party
Article: Turnout for the Nevada Democratic caucuses was 105,195, the Nevada State Democratic Party said on Monday, surpassing the 84,000 voters who participated in the 2016 Nevada caucuses.

Headline: Republicans raise U.S. drug supply concerns after coronavirus outbreak
Article: Republicans raised concerns this week about the security of the U.S. drug supply chain in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak in China, where a significant portion of the ingredients used to make prescription drugs is manufactured.

Headline: Sanders' big Nevada win narrows rivals' path to Democratic nomination
Article: Bernie Sanders' convincing win in the Nevada caucuses signaled his campaign is gathering strength and reaching voters who had previously eluded him, putting him on a path â€“ for now â€“ toward the Democratic presidential nomination.

Headline: Warren Buffett says 'I'm a Democrat,' and would have 'no trouble' voting for Bloomberg
Article: Warren Buffett, the chairman of Berkshire Hathaway Inc and one of the world's most admired investors, said on Monday he is a Democrat, and would have "no trouble" voting for fellow billionaire Michael Bloomberg for U.S. president.

Headline: With $1.5 trillion childcare plan, Sanders floats another big campaign pledge
Article: U.S. presidential candidate Bernie Sanders on Monday proposed spending $1.5 trillion over 10 years to create a universal child care and early education system, to be funded by taxing the wealthiest Americans.

Headline: Sanders' Democratic rivals seek to slow his momentum after his big win in Nevada caucuses
Article: As Bernie Sanders looked to cement his front-runner status in the U.S. Democratic presidential race after his dominant win in Nevada, his rivals sought in rallies on Sunday to blunt his momentum ahead of 15 nominating contests in the next 10 days.

Headline: No. 3 House Democrat Clyburn of South Carolina to back Biden for president - Politico
Article: Jim Clyburn, the No. 3 Democrat in the House of Representatives and an influential black lawmaker from the early voting state of South Carolina, is expected on Wednesday to endorse Joe Biden's presidential bid, according to a Politico report on Sunday.

Headline: Former 2020 Democratic candidate Williamson endorses Sanders' presidential bid
Article: Marianne Williamson, who made an unsuccessful bid for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination, has thrown her support behind former rival Bernie Sanders, appearing at a rally in Texas with the progressive senator.

Headline: U.S. judge rejects Roger Stone's request she be kicked off his case
Article: A U.S. federal judge on Sunday denied a request by Roger Stone's lawyers that she be removed from the case in which she last week sentenced the long-time adviser to President Donald Trump to three years and four months in prison.

Headline: Trump accuses Schiff of leaking intelligence about Russia to hurt Sanders
Article: President Donald Trump on Sunday accused Representative Adam Schiff of leaking classified information on Russian interference in the 2020 U.S. election to hurt Democratic presidential front-runner Bernie Sanders.

Headline: Despite attacks, Sanders' Medicare for All boosts early-state triumphs
Article: In the days leading up to Saturday's Democratic presidential caucuses in Nevada, Bernie Sanders withstood one attack after another over his Medicare for All plan â€“ both from his rivals and the state's powerful hotel and casino workers' union.

Headline: U.S. national security adviser denies Russia boosting Trump reelection
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's national security adviser denied that U.S. intelligence officials have warned that Russia has been interfering in the U.S. presidential campaign to boost Trump's re-election chances.

Headline: As Grenell moves to spy post, Trump looks for new ambassador to Germany
Article: President Donald Trump said on Sunday he is looking for a new ambassador to Germany after tapping current diplomat Richard Grenell to serve as acting U.S. intelligence chief.

Headline: Sanders wins decisively in Nevada, Biden headed for second-place finish
Article: Bernie Sanders strengthened his front-runner position for the Democratic presidential nomination with a decisive victory in the Nevada caucuses on Saturday, while Joe Biden was on track for a second-place finish that would give his struggling campaign new hope.

Headline: Slow results, confusion and complaints at Nevada caucus sites
Article: Nevada caucus officials and voters at multiple sites on Saturday reported voting rules confusion, calculation glitches and delays in reporting tallies - despite efforts to avoid the issues that plagued Iowa's caucuses earlier this month.

Headline: From fringe candidate to front-runner: Sanders wins Nevada with diverse backers - Edison Research Poll
Article: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders, often maligned by opponents as a liberal outsider who cannot unify the Democratic Party, won the party's Nevada caucuses by a comfortable margin thanks to a diverse coalition of supporters, according to polling agency Edison Research.

Headline: Twitter suspends group of pro-Bloomberg accounts over 'platform manipulation'
Article: Twitter Inc on Friday said it had started suspending and restricting dozens of accounts posting content promoting U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg.

Headline: 'Not good enough,' Warren says of Bloomberg's non-disclosure agreement pledge
Article: Democratic U.S. presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg said on Friday that his company has identified three women bound by non-disclosure agreements regarding his past conduct and that they would be released from their accords if they choose.

Headline: Sanders blasts Russia for reportedly trying to boost his presidential campaign
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders warned Russia on Friday to stay out of 2020 White House elections after U.S. officials had told him Moscow was trying to aid his campaign.

Headline: Twitter tests labels, community moderation for lies by public figures
Article: Twitter Inc said on Thursday that it was testing a new community moderation approach that would enable users to identify misleading information posted by politicians and public figures and add brightly colored labels under those tweets.

Headline: Nevada caucuses present new test to Democrats after chaotic Iowa contest
Article: Nevada Democrats will host hundreds of caucuses on Saturday, the third contest in the state-by-state presidential nominating process, almost three weeks after the Iowa caucuses caused mayhem when a technical meltdown delayed results.

Headline: Weinstein jury deadlocked on most serious sexual assault charges
Article: The jury in Harvey Weinstein's sexual assault trial in New York said on Friday they were deadlocked on the most serious criminal charges and suggested they were unanimous on the others leveled against the former Hollywood mogul.

Headline: Bloomberg campaign builds out digital arm Hawkfish ahead of 2020 election
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg's campaign has pumped $25.7 million into his little-known tech company Hawkfish since the billionaire entered the race last November, according to disclosures to the Federal Election Commission.

Headline: U.S. officials tell Democrat Sanders Russia is trying to help his campaign: Washington Post
Article: U.S. officials have told Democratic presidential contender Bernie Sanders that Russia is trying to help his campaign, the Washington Post reported on Friday.

Headline: Trump says he is eyeing four candidates for intelligence chief
Article: President Donald Trump said on Friday he had four candidates under consideration to be the next U.S. intelligence chief and that a decision would be made soon, even as one potential candidate said he was not interested in the job.

Headline: Sanders' 'Trump-like rhetoric' encouraged vandals, Bloomberg camp says
Article: Michael Bloombergâ€™s presidential campaign on Friday alleged that rival Bernie Sandersâ€™ â€œTrump-like rhetoricâ€ encouraged supporters to vandalize a Bloomberg campaign office in Tennessee and others across the country.

Headline: Nevada Democrats report high early caucus participation
Article: LAS VEGAS, Nevada - Nearly 75,000 Nevadans participated early in the state's Democratic U.S. presidential nominating contest, the party said on Friday, a sign of a potentially large turnout in the first test for the candidates in the diverse western United States.

Headline: â€˜Tamales for TÃ­o Bernieâ€™: Sandersâ€™ outreach to Latino voters pays off
Article: Violeta Alvarez is so passionate about Bernie Sanders that she becomes emotional talking about the white, 78-year-old senator from Vermont, a state 3,000 miles from this sun-drenched California enclave.

Headline: Trump says four candidates being considered for U.S. intelligence chief
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said on Twitter that four candidates are under consideration for the job of U.S. intelligence chief and that a decision would come in the next few weeks.

Headline: Trump says Russia supporting his reelection 'another misinformation campaign'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said on Twitter that the idea that Russia wants him to win re-election was "another misinformation campaign" launched by Democrats.

Headline: Stone sentenced to 3-1/3 years, Trump signals no immediate pardon for adviser
Article: A federal judge on Thursday sentenced President Donald Trump's long-time adviser Roger Stone to three years and four months in prison and said his lies to lawmakers investigating Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election posed a threat to American democracy.

Headline: Kremlin says U.S. allegations Russia is working to re-elect Trump are false
Article: The Kremlin said on Friday that allegations from U.S. intelligence officials that Russia is interfering in the 2020 election campaign and trying to boost President Donald Trump's re-election chances are false and the result of paranoia.

Headline: Democrat Warren, worried campaign will run out of cash, taps $3 million loan
Article: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren raised more money than most of her Democratic presidential rivals in the weeks before the Iowa caucuses, but spent so heavily that her campaign took out a $3 million loan fearing she would run out of cash.

Headline: Trump's acting intelligence chief Grenell says won't be tapped for permanent post
Article: Richard Grenell, U.S. President Donald Trump's ambassador to Germany who was tapped to be acting director of national intelligence, said on Thursday that Trump would not nominate him permanently to be the top U.S. spy.

Headline: Businessman Steyer pumps $64.7 million of own funds into U.S. presidential bid in January
Article: Businessman Tom Steyer poured $64.7 million of his own wealth in January into his bid to win the Democratic presidential nomination, for a total spend of $267 million, a campaign finance disclosure showed on Thursday.

Headline: Elizabeth Warren's presidential campaign raised $11 million in January
Article: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren raised $11 million in January for her presidential bid, but spent nearly all the money her campaign had amassed and ended the month with only $2.3 million in cash, a campaign finance disclosure showed on Thursday.

Headline: Trump blasts best-picture Oscar for South Korean film 'Parasite'
Article: President Donald Trump on Thursday ridiculed the historic best-picture Oscar win for South Korean film "Parasite," telling a campaign rally he wished for the return of Hollywood classics like 1939's "Gone with the Wind."

Headline: Joe Biden's campaign raised $8.9 million in January, ended month with $7.1 million cash
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden raised $8.9 million in January, ending the month with $7.1 million in cash, an improvement after he struggled at times last year to raise money.

Headline: U.S. Democrat Klobuchar's campaign raised $5.5 million in January
Article: U.S. Senator Amy Klobuchar's presidential campaign raised $5.5 million in January, leaving her with $2.9 million at the end of the month, according to disclosures her campaign filed on Thursday.

Headline: Elizabeth Warren appears to drop opposition to unlimited-money group backing her campaign
Article: Democratic presidential hopeful Elizabeth Warren on Thursday declined to disavow a new super PAC that has earmarked $1 million to back her candidacy, an apparent reversal from her vigorous opposition to the outside spending groups that have become central to American politics.

Headline: Factbox: Stone is one of dozens ensnared in Trump-Russia probe
Article: A federal judge on Thursday sentenced Roger Stone, President Donald Trump's longtime friend and adviser, to three years and four months in prison for his conviction on charges including lying to a congressional committee investigating Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Democratic presidential candidate Warren gets super PAC help despite past opposition
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren will get help in the final days before Nevada's caucuses from a super PAC, despite her outspoken opposition to such fundraising efforts.

Headline: Bloomberg comes under scathing attack at first Democratic presidential debate in Nevada
Article: Michael Bloomberg faced a barrage of attacks at his first Democratic presidential debate on Wednesday, as his rivals assailed the free-spending and fast-rising billionaire over his record on race, history of sexist comments and the use of his massive fortune to muscle his way into the contest.

Headline: Warren doubles down on criticizing Bloomberg as U.S Democrats sprint to Super Tuesday
Article: A debate-stage scrap between Michael Bloomberg and Elizabeth Warren spilled onto the Democratic campaign trail on Thursday as the former New York mayor sought to move past his rocky debate debut and the senator dug in on attacking her billionaire rival.

Headline: After Trump attacks, judge handling Stone case responds sternly
Article: U.S. District Judge Amy Berman Jackson remained silent last week when President Donald Trump attacked the prosecutors, the jurors and her personally for their roles in the trial of his long-time friend and adviser Roger Stone.

Headline: Pete Buttigieg's campaign raised $6 million in January
Article: Former South Bend, Indiana Mayor Pete Buttigieg raised $6 million in January, but has seen his campaign's fundraising rise in the wake of strong performances in early primary contests.

Headline: Bloomberg bash at debate may give Democratic rivals new life
Article: Most of the fire at the Democratic presidential debate in Nevada on Wednesday was aimed at the newcomer on the stage, former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg.

Headline: Bloomberg presidential campaign reports $409 million in total spending so far
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg's campaign spent $409 million through January, with most of the money funding a TV advertising blitz, according to campaign disclosures filed on Thursday.

Headline: Bloomberg gets a lashing from Democrats: Key quotes from a fiery debate
Article: The top six candidates competing for the Democratic nomination to take on U.S. President Donald Trump in November participated in the ninth presidential debate on Wednesday, with one quickly becoming the focus: Michael Bloomberg.

Headline: Democratic presidential debate snags record 20 million viewers: NBC
Article: The Democratic presidential debate on Wednesday night averaged a record 20 million viewers on NBC and MSNBC, along with another 13.5 million viewers streaming online, the networks announced on Thursday.

Headline: Trump's deputy national security adviser Victoria Coates leaving White House
Article: Victoria Coates, one of President Donald Trump's longest-serving national security aides, is leaving the White House soon to become a senior adviser at the Energy Department, the White House said on Thursday.

Headline: Long-time Trump adviser Stone to be sentenced by judge he antagonized
Article: Since his January 2019 arrest, President Donald Trump's longtime adviser Roger Stone has repeatedly tested the patience of the federal judge who presided over his trial. On Thursday, that judge will tell the self-described "dirty trickster" how long he will serve in prison.

Headline: Trump names U.S. envoy to Germany acting director of national intelligence
Article: President Donald Trump on Wednesday named U.S. ambassador to Germany Richard Grenell, a strong supporter of his policies, to be acting director of national intelligence.

Headline: Bloomberg's transaction tax sets stage for clash with Wall Street clients
Article: Presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg's decision to back a tax on trades marks a blow for Wall Street lobbyists which had seen the moderate Democrat as a potential ally, said analysts and lobbyists.

Headline: Explainer: Who is Roger Stone and why does he face prison?
Article: A federal judge on Thursday is scheduled to sentence Roger Stone, a long-time adviser to U.S. President Donald Trump, in a criminal case that has roiled the Justice Department and drawn the Republican president's ire.

Headline: U.S. Attorney General Barr considers quitting over Trump tweets: source
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr is considering resigning over President Donald Trump's tweets about Justice Department investigations, a source familiar with the situation told Reuters, while the department said he was not leaving.

Headline: Key Pentagon official to resign at Trump's request amid Huawei trade spat
Article: A key Pentagon official said on Wednesday he would leave his post at President Donald Trump's request, according to a copy of his resignation letter seen by Reuters, after a battle between government agencies over a bid to crack down on exports to China's Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.
