Headline: Former Democratic presidential hopeful Yang joins CNN as commentator
Article: Former Democratic presidential contender Andrew Yang is joining CNN as a political commentator, the cable network said on Wednesday.

Headline: Exclusive: Ahead of 2020 election, a 'Blue Wave' is rising in the cities, polling analysis shows
Article: As Republican President Donald Trump seeks a second term in November, Americans' interest in voting is growing faster in large cities dominated by Democrats than in conservative rural areas, according to an analysis of Reuters/Ipsos national opinion polls.

Headline: Presidential hopeful Bloomberg proposes new taxes, protections to rein in Wall Street
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg on Tuesday outlined a sweeping financial services policy proposal to rein in Wall Street trading, boost consumer protections, increase Americans' access to banking services and crack down on financial crime.

Headline: Bloomberg to sell his company if elected president: campaign
Article: Democratic presidential contender Michael Bloomberg will sell Bloomberg LP, the financial information company that made him a billionaire, if he is elected to the White House in November, his campaign confirmed on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump aims to be distraction for Democrats on Western U.S. swing
Article: President Donald Trump began a four-day Western swing on Tuesday with a fundraiser in Los Angeles, the first stop on a trip aimed at making himself a distraction as Democratic presidential candidates focus on the Nevada caucuses.

Headline: Stone sentencing to go ahead amid pardon speculation
Article: Roger Stone, a longtime friend of President Donald Trump, on Tuesday lost his bid to delay his sentencing amid speculation that Trump might pardon him.

Headline: North Carolina court blocks voter ID law as discriminatory
Article: A North Carolina appeals court on Tuesday blocked the state's voter identification law from going into effect, finding it was a discriminatory attempt to suppress the black vote, in a victory for Democrats and voting rights advocates.

Headline: Bloomberg moves into second behind Sanders among Democrats, Biden third: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Michael Bloomberg, a late entry into the Democratic presidential race, has moved into second place ahead of onetime front-runner Joe Biden, according to a Reuters/Ipsos national poll released on Tuesday that showed Bernie Sanders widening his lead over the field.

Headline: Trump says he knows identity of author known as 'Anonymous'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he knew the identity of an anonymous Trump administration official who wrote an essay for the New York Times and later a book about efforts from within to thwart parts of the president's agenda to protect the country from his worst impulses.

Headline: Factbox: Bloomberg's plan to rein in Wall Street borrows from Warren's playbook
Article: On Tuesday, U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg unveiled a sweeping, left-leaning financial services agenda.

Headline: Bloomberg qualifies for next debate after poll boost
Article: Former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg on Tuesday qualified for this week's Democratic presidential debate in Nevada, putting him on the same stage as his rivals for the first time in the race for the party's nomination.

Headline: Explainer: Nevada caucuses present new test to Democrats after chaotic Iowa contest
Article: Nevada Democrats will host hundreds of caucuses on Saturday, the third contest in the state-by-state presidential nominating process, almost three weeks after the Iowa caucuses caused mayhem when a technical meltdown delayed results.

Headline: Trump calls for all cases stemming from Mueller probe to be 'thrown out'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday called for all cases stemming from Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election to be "thrown out" and suggested he could bring a lawsuit over the matter.

Headline: Bloomberg has barbs at the ready for his first 2020 debate
Article: When Michael Bloomberg steps onto the Democratic debate stage for the first time on Wednesday, he will be ready to dismiss rivals like Joe Biden, who as vice president made "speeches that somebody writes for him," and Pete Buttigieg, "mayor of a town."

Headline: Democratic White House candidates face high-pressure Nevada debate
Article: At least six Democratic presidential contenders will meet in a pivotal debate in Nevada on Wednesday, three days before the state's voters make their picks in an unsettled and tight nominating race for the White House.

Headline: Sanders, Bloomberg trade insults as Democratic White House race heats up
Article: Democratic White House contenders Bernie Sanders and Michael Bloomberg stepped up their attacks on each other on Monday, with Sanders accusing the media mogul of trying to buy the election and Bloomberg saying the senator and his fervent supporters were hurting the party.

Headline: Democratic rivals tell billionaire Bloomberg: Let's debate
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidates said on Sunday billionaire Michael Bloomberg should face the same rigorous scrutiny as his rivals and they would welcome the chance to square off with him in a 2020 presidential debate.

Headline: More than 26,000 Democrats show up for first two days of Nevada early voting
Article: More than 26,000 people took part over the weekend in early voting in Nevada, the state with the next nominating contest in the Democratic White House race, and more than half on the first day were first-time caucus-goers, the state party said.

Headline: Trump kicks off Daytona 500 race with limo loop, Air Force One flyby
Article: President Donald Trump took a loop around the Daytona 500 racetrack on Sunday in his presidential limousine, drawing cheers from fans at NASCAR's most prestigious race not long after completing a dramatic flyby on Air Force One.

Headline: Former DOJ officials call on Attorney General Barr to resign
Article: More than 1,000 former U.S. Justice Department officials on Sunday called for Attorney General William Barr to resign over his handling of the trial of a longtime adviser of President Donald Trump.

Headline: Sanders says presidential rival Bloomberg will not excite voters
Article: LAS VEGAS - Democratic U.S. presidential candidate Bernie Sanders said on Saturday that Mike Bloomberg would not generate the "excitement and energy" needed to win the White House, focusing on a rival still not fully participating in the race.

Headline: Treat us like something between a telco and a newspaper, says Facebook's Zuckerberg
Article: Online content should be regulated with a system somewhere between the existing rules used for the telecoms and media industries, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told global leaders and security chiefs on Saturday.

Headline: 'Disown them:' Biden criticizes Sanders for supporters' online attacks
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden on Saturday criticized the conduct of online supporters of Senator Bernie Sanders, saying his rival for the Democratic nomination for president has "some accountability."

Headline: Attorney General Barr taps outside prosecutor to review case against ex-Trump adviser Michael Flynn
Article: U.S. Attorney William Barr has tapped the top federal prosecutor in St. Louis to review the Justice Department's politically-charged case against President Donald Trump's former national security adviser Michael Flynn, a department official said on Friday.

Headline: U.S. Border Patrol to send Tactical Unit officers to 'sanctuary cities'
Article: The Trump administration is deploying highly trained officers to boost arrests of unauthorized immigrants in a number of cities, including Los Angeles, Chicago and New York, the latest move in a battle against localities that adopt "sanctuary" policies to protect them from deportation.

Headline: Philippines' Duterte says Trump deserves to be re-elected
Article: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said on Saturday that Donald Trump deserved to be re-elected, praising the U.S. president's reaction to his decision to end a decades-old military agreement with the United States.

Headline: U.S. accuses Huawei of stealing trade secrets, assisting Iran
Article: U.S. prosecutors on Thursday accused Huawei of stealing trade secrets and helping Iran track protesters in its latest indictment against the Chinese company, escalating the U.S. battle with the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker.

Headline: Huawei cyber security chief says no operator gives it access to intercept equipment
Article: Huawei's cyber security chief said on Friday that he was not aware of any mobile operator ever having given the Chinese company access to the equipment used to intercept calls when required to do so by security services.

Headline: Alaska high court OKs recall petition drive for campaign to oust governor
Article: The Alaska Supreme Court on Friday cleared the way for a campaign seeking to oust the state's embattled governor to proceed with plans to collect enough signatures to place a recall initiative on the 2020 ballot.

Headline: New York Mayor de Blasio endorses Sanders in 2020 Democratic race
Article: New York Mayor Bill de Blasio endorsed U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders in the 2020 Democratic presidential race on Friday, the Sanders campaign said.

Headline: Emboldened, Trump defends right to interfere in criminal cases
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he has "the legal right" to interfere in criminal cases, capping a tumultuous week that raised questions about whether he is eroding the independence of the U.S. legal system.

Headline: Justice Dept. drops probe of ex-FBI official McCabe, a top Trump target
Article: The U.S. Justice Department on Friday dropped its criminal investigation of a top target of President Donald Trump, former No. 2 FBI official Andrew McCabe, at the tail end of a week in which the U.S. law-enforcement agency has come under extraordinary pressure from the president.

Headline: Celebrity lawyer Michael Avenatti is found guilty in Nike extortion case
Article: A U.S. jury on Friday found Michael Avenatti guilty in a criminal trial accusing the celebrity lawyer of trying to extort Nike Inc out of millions of dollars and defraud a youth basketball coach he represented.

Headline: No investigations of ousted White House aide Vindman: U.S. Army secretary
Article: U.S. Army Secretary Ryan McCarthy said on Friday there were no investigations into Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Vindman, the former National Security Council aide who testified in President Donald Trump's impeachment trial and was fired by the White House along with his twin brother.

Headline: Trump administration taking $3.8 billion more from military for Mexico border wall
Article: The U.S. Defense Department sent Congress a request to shift nearly $4 billion from the military budget to pay for a wall on the border with Mexico, a central promise of President Donald Trump's campaign for the White House four years ago and bid this year for a second term.

Headline: Let's move on from impeachment, visiting U.S. Senators tell Ukraine's leader
Article: A group of three U.S. Senators visited Kiev on Friday to convey a message of continued bipartisan support for Ukraine after it got entangled last year in President Donald Trump's impeachment trial.

Headline: Barr: Won't be 'bullied' by Trump on Stone case; jurors appalled
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Thursday that President Donald Trump's attacks on prosecutors, the judge and jurors in the trial of a longtime adviser undermined the Justice Department's work, adding he would not be "bullied" by anyone.

Headline: China's 'cowboy capitalism' must be curtailed: Senator Romney
Article: U.S. Senator Mitt Romney, who last week voted to convict Donald Trump for abuse of power, said on Friday that the U.S. president was right to challenge China over its trade policies and that Washington and its allies had to act against Beijing.

Headline: China urges U.S. to stop suppressing Chinese companies after Huawei indictment
Article: China's foreign ministry said on Friday it urges the United States to immediately stop suppressing Chinese companies without reason, after U.S. prosecutors unveiled a new indictment against Huawei Technologies.

Headline: On the trail: Bloomberg targeted by Democratic rivals, Biden raises money for crucial states
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidates took aim on Thursday at a rival whose name has not yet appeared on the ballot in the early voting states but whose television ads have blanketed the airwaves: billionaire former New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg.

Headline: As Warren aims for Super Tuesday rebound, will she alter her plan?
Article: Hours before polls closed in New Hampshire, Democratic presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren's campaign manager cautioned supporters that her expansive organizing operation would steadily collect delegates as the race proceeded no matter what happened in the state's primary.

Headline: Judge grants Amazon motion for pause in Microsoft's Pentagon contract work
Article: A U.S. judge on Thursday granted Amazon.com Inc's request to temporarily halt the U.S. Department of Defense and Microsoft Corp from moving forward on an up-to-$10 billion cloud computing deal that Amazon says reflected undue influence by President Donald Trump.

Headline: Senate rebukes Trump, votes to limit Iran war making ability
Article: The U.S. Senate passed legislation on Thursday to limit President Donald Trump's ability to wage war against Iran, rebuking him weeks after a strike against an Iranian military commander and Tehran's retaliation raised fears of broader regional conflict.

Headline: Trump taps new director of grants office that gave awards to Hookers for Jesus
Article: President Donald Trump on Thursday appointed one of Republican Senator Ted Cruz's former staffers to lead a Justice Department office at the heart of a recent whistleblower complaint over anti-human trafficking grants awarded in 2019.

Headline: Bernie Sanders to online trolls: Stop 'ugly personal attacks'
Article: Democratic presidential contender Bernie Sanders on Thursday urged an end to online "bullying or ugly personal attacks" after a powerful hospitality-industry union in Nevada accused his supporters of harassment.

Headline: Trump had 'productive' meeting with Cuomo over NY immigrant policies: official
Article: A White House meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and New York Governor Andrew Cuomo over New York's pro-immigrant policies was "productive," according to Trump's top homeland official.

Headline: Senior U.S. judge defends sentencing decisions after Trump tweet on Stone case
Article: The top judge on the U.S. District Court in Washington said in an unusual public statement on Thursday that public criticism "is not a factor" in sentencing decisions, after President Donald Trump took aim at a judge from her court who is overseeing longtime Trump adviser Roger Stone's criminal trial.

Headline: U.S. gives Huawei another 45 days to buy from American suppliers
Article: The Trump administration said Thursday it was issuing a 45-day extension allowing U.S. companies to continue doing some business with Chinaâ€™s Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headline: Bloomberg campaign pays social media accounts for memes
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg's campaign is paying popular Instagram meme accounts to post content about the billionaire as part of its social media offensive ahead of the 2020 election.

Headline: Trump, New York's Cuomo will continue talks on immigration, traveler program: official
Article: A meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on immigration policies and a travel program was productive, with discussions set to continue, the acting Department of Homeland Security chief said on Thursday.

Headline: Former Trump aide Hicks to return to White House as election nears
Article: Hope Hicks, a one-time close aide and communications director to President Donald Trump, will return to the White House next month after two years away to work closely with key advisors, administration officials said on Thursday.

Headline: Pelosi says Trump's comments on Stone case are 'an abuse of power'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's comments this week weighing in on the trial of his longtime associate Roger Stone amount to political interference in the judiciary and are "an abuse of power," House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told reporters on Thursday.

Headline: Trump, Republican committee raised more than $60 million during January impeachment trial: campaign
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's re-election campaign and his Republican Party raised more than $60 million in January, against the backdrop of impeachment that threatened Trump's presidency.

Headline: U.S. Senate advances resolution limiting Trump's ability to wage war
Article: The U.S. Senate advanced legislation on Wednesday intended to limit President Donald Trump's ability to wage war against Iran, paving the way for a final vote as eight Republicans joined Democrats in supporting the war powers resolution.

Headline: Joe Biden seeks reboot after fresh stumble in New Hampshire
Article: NASHUA, New Hampshire - Joe Biden's campaign held a victory party in a New Hampshire hotel ballroom on Tuesday evening. But there was no victory. And there was no Joe Biden.

Headline: Nine U.S. lawmakers who were once on food stamps ask Trump not to shrink program
Article: A handful of U.S. lawmakers have a unique argument for asking President Donald Trump not to slash the food stamp program - they themselves once relied on it.

Headline: U.S. judge denied Trump adviser Stone's request for a new trial: filing
Article: A federal judge has rejected a request by U.S. President Donald Trump ally Roger Stone for a new trial, according to a court filing released on Wednesday, a day after a Justice Department reversal over sentencing prompted prosecutors to resign from the case.

Headline: Plant a trillion trees: U.S. Republicans offer fossil fuel-friendly climate fix
Article: Republican lawmakers on Wednesday proposed legislation setting a goal for the United States to plant a trillion trees by 2050 to fight global warming, a plan intended to address climate change by sucking carbon out of the air instead of by cutting emissions.

Headline: Democrats turn focus to Nevada and South Carolina after Sanders' narrow win in New Hampshire
Article: Democrats vying for the right to challenge U.S. President Donald Trump turned their focus on Wednesday to Nevada and South Carolina after Bernie Sanders solidified his front-runner status by narrowly beating Pete Buttigieg in New Hampshire.

Headline: U.S. election: Klobuchar up, three men out
Article: Democratic presidential hopeful Amy Klobuchar raised $2.5 million in the hours after her third-place finish in the New Hampshire primary, her campaign said on Wednesday, a boost as she tries to beef up her operations for the upcoming contests in Nevada and South Carolina.

Headline: Factbox: Eight Democrats still in the fight for U.S. presidential nomination
Article: Eight candidates remained in the U.S. Democratic presidential nominating contest after Iowa and New Hampshire voters kicked off the state-by-state selection process.

Headline: After Iowa meltdown, Nevada Democrats will use scannable early voting ballots
Article: Nevada Democrats will use scannable paper ballots for early voting in their caucuses after problems with an app plunged Iowa's nominating contest into chaos last week, according to a state party memo sent to presidential campaigns.

Headline: Mnuchin and Blankfein say Bernie Sanders would 'ruin' U.S. economy
Article: Former Goldman Sachs head Lloyd Blankfein and U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin both said that Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders would destroy the U.S. economy if he wins.

Headline: Democrat Sanders, Nevada union in escalating feud ahead of state nominating contest
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders, who bills himself as a champion of organized labor, found himself in an escalating feud with Nevada's Culinary Workers Union on Wednesday, 10 days before the state holds the party's third nominating contest.

Headline: In wake of impeachment, U.S. senators to visit Ukraine
Article: Three U.S. senators will meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in Kiev on Friday, seeking to reinforce the importance of his country as a strategic U.S. ally after he found himself at the center of President Donald Trump's acrimonious impeachment trial.

Headline: Pentagon expected to back additional Huawei restrictions: source
Article: The Pentagon is likely to back new U.S. restrictions on Huawei Technologies, reversing earlier opposition to a proposal meant to further crack down on exports to the blacklisted Chinese company, a person briefed on the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.

Headline: Iowa Democratic Party chair resigns after chaotic vote count
Article: Iowa Democratic Party chair Troy Price resigned on Wednesday after the failure of a vote-counting app and a backup phone system caused several days of delay in determining the results of the state's influential presidential nominating caucuses.

Headline: Democrats demand probe of Trump role in Stone case; Republicans unmoved
Article: Republicans in Congress on Wednesday brushed aside calls to investigate possible political interference at the U.S. Justice Department after the agency asked for a lighter prison term for President Donald Trump's longtime adviser Roger Stone.

Headline: U.S. presidential candidate Bloomberg endorsed by three black lawmakers
Article: U.S. presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg on Wednesday won endorsements from three Congressional Black Caucus members, a positive sign for his campaign, which has drawn scrutiny lately over his past support for a controversial policing tactic.

Headline: Klobuchar's dark-horse campaign gets fundraising boost, but new tests await
Article: Democratic presidential hopeful Amy Klobuchar raised $2.5 million in four hours after her third-place finish in the New Hampshire primary, her campaign said on Wednesday, a boost as she prepares for upcoming contests in Nevada and South Carolina.

Headline: Trump declines to say if he is considering pardoning Stone
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday declined to say whether he is considering pardoning longtime adviser Roger Stone, who was found guilty last year of lying to Congress, obstruction and witness tampering.

Headline: In wake of impeachment, Trump allies boycott House Intelligence tech hearing
Article: Republican members of the U.S. House of Representatives Intelligence Committee refused to attend a subcommittee hearing on technology and national security on Wednesday, boycotting the panel's first public hearing since the acrimonious impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump.

Headline: Trump warns Senate not to approve war powers resolution on Iran
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday warned the Senate against adopting a resolution that would curb his ability to wage war against Iran, saying it would send "a very bad signal" and allow Tehran to act with impunity.

Headline: Former Governor Deval Patrick withdraws from Democratic presidential race
Article: Former Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick withdrew from the race for the 2020 Democratic U.S. presidential nomination on Wednesday, failing to win enough support after a late entry into the crowded field.

Headline: Biden shows tenderness and temper on 2020 presidential trail
Article: Joe Biden had spent much of the weekend ahead of New Hampshire's primary on Tuesday attacking his top Democratic presidential rivals when a young woman asked why voters should believe he could win a national election after his poor showing in Iowa.

Headline: Prosecutors quit as Justice Department seeks shorter sentence for Trump ally
Article: (This February 11 story corrects spelling of Lynn Neils, paragraph 21)

Headline: Sanders just beats Buttigieg in New Hampshire Democratic primary, Biden in fifth
Article: MANCHESTER, N.H. - Bernie Sanders narrowly won New Hampshire's Democratic presidential primary on Tuesday, solidifying his front-runner status in the race to take on Donald Trump and dealing a setback to moderate rival Joe Biden, who finished a disappointing fifth.

Headline: New Hampshire result clogs up moderate lane for Democrats
Article: NASHUA, N.H. - Bernie Sanders may have established himself as the standard-bearer for the Democratic Party's leftist wing with his strong showing in Iowa and New Hampshire, but for moderates looking to rally around a candidate to fend him off, the picture just got even murkier.

Headline: What's next for Democratic presidential candidates after New Hampshire
Article: If there's one thing Tuesday's New Hampshire primary made clear, it's that Democrats are no closer to agreeing on the right candidate to beat Republican President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: Businessman Andrew Yang ends eclectic presidential bid
Article: Andrew Yang, an entrepreneur whose unlikely White House bid evolved into a serious campaign thanks to grassroots enthusiasm, pulled out of the Democratic presidential race on Tuesday after New Hampshire delivered him a second straight poor showing.

Headline: Angry with Trump, most New Hampshire Democratic primary voters will back party's nominee 'regardless': Edison Research
Article: Most voters taking part in New Hampshire's Democratic primary on Tuesday expressed deep dissatisfaction with President Donald Trump and said they would vote for the party's nominee "regardless of who it is," according to an Edison Research exit poll.

Headline: Sanders projected to win the New Hampshire Democratic primary: NBC News
Article: Bernie Sanders is projected to win New Hampshire's Democratic presidential primary on Tuesday, edging out rival Pete Buttigieg, solidifying his front-runner status in the nominating race, according to NBC News.

Headline: Former Massachusetts Governor Patrick to end 2020 presidential bid: CBS
Article: Former Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick planned to end his bid for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination on Wednesday, CBS News reported, citing a source familiar with the announcement.

Headline: Klobuchar surge in New Hampshire could reshuffle Democratic White House race
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Amy Klobuchar's poll numbers are rising, her crowds are building and she says it is finally her time.

Headline: Trump wins Republican presidential primary in New Hampshire: Edison Research
Article: President Donald Trump was the projected winner of the Republican presidential primary in New Hampshire on Tuesday, according to early exit polling compiled by Edison Research.

Headline: Senator Bennet drops out of 2020 Democratic presidential race
Article: Senator Michael Bennet of Colorado, a moderate who has stressed improving education for Americans, abandoned his bid on Tuesday for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination.

Headline: Trump says military may consider discipline for ousted aide Vindman
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday the military may consider disciplining former National Security Council aide Alexander Vindman, who testified in Trump's impeachment trial and was fired by the White House along with his twin brother.

Headline: Biden heading to South Carolina; Sanders steady as New Hampshire votes
Article: MANCHESTER, N.H. - Democratic U.S. presidential hopeful Joe Biden told reporters in New Hampshire on Tuesday he was headed to South Carolina later in the day - before the results of the nominating primary vote underway in the New England state are even released.

Headline: Exit polls: Sanders, Buttigieg, Klobuchar locked in tight race for New Hampshire
Article: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders, former South Bend, Indiana, Mayor Pete Buttigieg and U.S. Senator Amy Klobuchar appear to be locked in a close race for the lead in the New Hampshire Democratic primary, according to early exit polling from Edison Research.

Headline: Bloomberg buffeted by recording of him discussing crime, minorities
Article: U.S. presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg, rising in public opinion polls in recent weeks, found himself on the defensive on Tuesday over newly surfaced remarks from 2015 in which he said 95% of murderers and murder victims were minorities.

Headline: U.S. Justice Department declines to offer court sentencing guidance on Trump adviser Stone
Article: The U.S. Justice Department on Tuesday backed away from its earlier recommendation of sentencing President Donald Trump's adviser Roger Stone to between 7 and 9 years in prison, and declined to offer the court an alternative sentencing range.

Headline: Trump says he did not intervene in Justice Department's handling of Roger Stone case
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he did not intervene to ask the Justice Department to seek a shorter prison sentence for his former adviser Roger Stone, but Trump said he would be allowed to do so.

Headline: Tsitsipas progresses in Rotterdam, Fognini out
Article: Second seed Stefanos Tsitsipas clawed his way back from a set and a break down to beat Poland's Hubert Hurkacz 6-7(2) 6-3 6-1 and reach the last-16 of the Rotterdam Open on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. Senate probably can't reach a budget agreement with House: McConnell
Article: U.S. Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday he does not think the Republican-led Senate can reach a budget agreement with the Democrat-dominated House of Representatives this year.

Headline: Trump slashes foreign aid, cuts safety net programs in new budget proposal
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will propose on Monday a 21% cut in foreign aid and slashes to social safety-net programs in his $4.8 trillion budget proposal for fiscal 2021, according to senior administration officials.

Headline: Bloomberg turns heads with write-in win in New Hampshire hamlet
Article: Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's shadow over the Democratic presidential race grew a bit longer on Tuesday after his surprise write-in win in a hamlet that traditionally kicks off voting in New Hampshire's closely watched primary election.

Headline: Former TV journalist to challenge Ocasio-Cortez in New York Democratic primary
Article: Former television news journalist Michelle Caruso-Cabrera plans to wage a Democratic primary challenge against freshman U.S. Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, who has emerged as a leading voice of the party's left wing over the past year.

Headline: Explainer: How the path to the Democratic presidential nomination is different in 2020
Article: The Democratic Party will officially nominate a 2020 presidential candidate at its convention in July, a process that began with the Iowa caucuses, continues on Tuesday in New Hampshire and ends with the Puerto Rico primary in June.

Headline: 11 Democrats still in U.S. presidential race as New Hampshire votes
Article: The presidential nominating contest for both the Democratic and Republican parties continues Tuesday in New Hampshire.

Headline: Trump says call for 7-9 years prison term for adviser Stone is 'horrible'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump described a demand by prosecutors on Monday for a federal judge to sentence his longtime adviser Roger Stone to 7-9 years in prison as "horrible and very unfair" and said such a "miscarriage of justice" should not be allowed.

Headline: On eve of New Hampshire Democratic vote, Klobuchar gains ground on Sanders and Buttigieg
Article: A day before New Hampshire votes in its Democratic presidential primary, Bernie Sanders and Pete Buttigieg sought on Monday to build on their strength as front-runners in an up-for-grabs race as an energized Senator Amy Klobuchar gained ground.

Headline: Barr: U.S. scrutinizing information ahead of 2020 election, including from Giuliani
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr on Monday confirmed that the Justice Department has received information from President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani ahead of the November election, but that anything originating from Ukraine should not be taken "at face value."

Headline: U.S. Justice Department files new lawsuits in renewed push to pressure 'sanctuary cities'
Article: The U.S. Department of Justice ramped up its fight against states and municipalities that adopt "sanctuary" policies to protect unauthorized immigrants from deportation, with new lawsuits against the state of New Jersey and King County, Washington.

Headline: Trump's $4.8 trillion budget gets chilly reception from Congress
Article: President Donald Trump's $4.8 trillion budget plan for the coming fiscal year drew a prompt rejection on Monday from congressional Democrats, who said it betrayed his promise to protect popular health and safety-net programs.

Headline: Trump budget proposes $150 million for creation of uranium reserve
Article: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget proposed $150 million for the creation of a U.S. uranium reserve as the administration seeks to help struggling producers of the fuel for nuclear power reactors.

Headline: New York sues Trump administration over 'punitive' ban from traveler programs
Article: New York state sued President Donald Trump's administration on Monday to void a policy barring hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers from federal programs that help travelers speed through airport security lines and borders, calling the ban political punishment.

Headline: Buttigieg, Sanders campaigns request Iowa recanvass: Iowa Democrats
Article: The two Democrats who lead the Iowa caucuses - Senator Bernie Sanders and former Mayor Pete Buttigieg - both requested a recanvass of some caucus results on Monday, the Iowa Democratic Party said.

Headline: Paid social media influencers dip toes in U.S. 2020 election
Article: Last week, food and travel blogger Alycia Chrosniak got an unusual alert on her phone: Michael Bloomberg's presidential campaign was inviting her to earn $150 by making content about why she supported the billionaire Democratic candidate in the U.S. election.

Headline: How a New Hampshire family spent Andrew Yang's 'Freedom Dividend'
Article: A New Hampshire family that received a $1,000-a-month "freedom dividend" for a year from the campaign of Democratic presidential contender Andrew Yang spent most of the money on college bills - but also on an improv class for the unemployed dad.

Headline: Biden's support slumps to lowest on record, Bloomberg surges nationally as Democratic race heats up: poll
Article: Support for Joe Biden's U.S. Democratic presidential bid has tumbled nationally to the lowest on record since his lackluster finish in the Iowa caucuses, while interest is surging in the upstart candidacy of billionaire media mogul Michael Bloomberg, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Monday.

Headline: Trump's budget proposes sale from emergency oil reserve
Article: President Donald Trump's 2021 budget released on Monday proposed a sale of 15 million barrels of oil from the emergency petroleum reserve to help pay for projects overseen by the Department of Energy.

Headline: White House calls for biggest NASA budget in decades to reach the moon, Mars
Article: The White House on Monday asked Congress for $25.2 billion for NASA in 2021, the agency's biggest budget in decades, calling for steady increases over five years to meet President Donald Trump's goal of landing astronauts on the moon and Mars.

Headline: Buttigieg, Sanders campaigns request Iowa recanvass: Iowa Democrats
Article: The two Democrats who lead the Iowa caucuses - U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders and former Mayor Pete Buttigieg - both requested a recanvass of some caucus results on Monday, the Iowa Democratic Party said.

Headline: Democrats in disarray in New Hampshire as Sanders surges and Trump provokes
Article: For the past year, Democratic voters have been anxious to settle on a savior capable of defeating President Donald Trump.

Headline: Trump's Pentagon budget bolsters nuclear weapons, weapons research
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's $740.5 billion defense budget request sent to Congress on Monday includes more money for nuclear weapons and a big boost to research and development spending to prepare for future warfare.

Headline: Exclusive: Justice Department anti-human trafficking grants prompt whistleblower complaint
Article: A U.S. Justice Department anti-human trafficking grant program is facing internal complaints, after two nonprofits were denied funding in favor of two less established groups whose applications were not recommended by career DOJ officials.

Headline: Texas Democrats weighing ballots, bullets in 2020 campaigns
Article: Texas Democrats are pulling out a new playbook in this year's congressional races, loudly backing gun control in a bet a strategy that paid off in Virginia can also win elections in a conservative-leaning state long associated with gun rights.

Headline: Justice Department receiving information on Bidens from Giuliani: Senator
Article: The U.S. Justice Department is receiving information on former Vice President Joe Biden and his businessman son, Hunter Biden, from President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani, a top Trump ally in the Senate said on Sunday.

Headline: On the 2020 trail: Sanders blasts Buttigieg for taking billionaire bucks
Article: Democratic presidential contenders Pete Buttigieg and Bernie Sanders traded jabs over money and message on Sunday, two days before New Hampshire voters pick their choice to take on Republican President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: Buttigieg edges past Sanders in Iowa's national delegate race: state party
Article: Democratic presidential contender Pete Buttigieg narrowly beat rival Bernie Sanders in Iowa in the race for delegates, according to projected national delegate allocations released by the Iowa Democratic Party on Sunday.

Headline: Exclusive: Trump proposes 21% cut in U.S. foreign aid in budget proposal - officials
Article: President Donald Trump will propose cutting billions of dollars in U.S. foreign aid in his fiscal 2021 budget while seeking an increase in funds to counter developing economic threats from China and Russia, senior administration officials told Reuters.

Headline: How Bernie Sandersâ€™ passionate base revitalized his campaign
Article: When Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders suffered a heart attack in October, what upset his long-time supporter Craig Althof the most was the way it was covered by the media.

Headline: Masked white nationalists march in Washington with police escort
Article: Police escorted masked members of a white nationalist group on a march through Washington's National Mall on Saturday that Metropolitan Police said occurred without incident or arrests.

Headline: On the campaign trail: Biden slams Buttigieg, "Guess what? He was a mayor"
Article: Democrats scrambled to gain an edge with voters on Saturday on the last weekend before the party's next presidential nominating contest in New Hampshire, where Pete Buttigieg began drawing fire as the candidate on the rise.

Headline: 'OUT': Trump says he was right to remove 'insubordinate' NSC aide
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday defended the ouster of impeachment witness Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Vindman from the White House National Security Council, calling him "insubordinate" and saying he had incorrectly reported the contents of Trump's "perfect" telephone calls.

Headline: Two days after his acquittal, Trump ousts two star impeachment witnesses
Article: President Donald Trump's administration on Friday ousted the two witnesses who provided the most damaging testimony during his impeachment investigation: Army Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Vindman and Ambassador Gordon Sondland.

Headline: How they fared: Democrats fight for survival in New Hampshire debate
Article: With Democratic presidential candidates fighting for their political lives ahead of New Hampshire's primary to choose who will face Republican Donald Trump in November, rivals debating on Friday took shots at one another and tried to separate themselves from the pack.

Headline: Iowa wins put Buttigieg, Sanders at center of criticism at Democratic debate
Article: MANCHESTER, N.H. - Democratic presidential contenders Bernie Sanders and Pete Buttigieg, the top finishers in Iowa's first nominating contest, faced a barrage of criticism on Friday from rivals who said they did not have what it takes to beat Republican Donald Trump in November.

Headline: New York threatens to sue Trump administration over access to traveler programs
Article: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Friday threatened to sue the Trump administration over its decision to restrict New Yorkers' access to some programs that allow faster security checks at ports of entry, part of a dispute about the state's limits on cooperation with current U.S. immigration policy.

Headline: Trump 'a symptom of a disease' - quotes from the Democratic presidential debate
Article: Seven candidates vying for the Democratic nomination to take on President Donald Trump in November participated in the eighth presidential debate on Friday.

Headline: Coach who hired Michael Avenatti says he wanted to expose Nike, not in press conference
Article: The government's star witness in Michael Avenatti's extortion trial conceded on Friday he wanted to expose Nike Inc's alleged illegal payments to families of college basketball recruits long before he hired the celebrity lawyer.

Headline: White House dismisses idea of U.S. buying Nokia, Ericsson to challenge Huawei
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence on Friday and the top White House economic adviser dismissed an unusual suggestion from U.S. Attorney General William Barr that the United States consider taking control of two major foreign rivals of China-based Huawei Technologies Co Ltd.

Headline: In another Trump win, court tosses Democrats' suit over his businesses
Article: A federal appeals court on Friday threw out a lawsuit brought by Democratic lawmakers that accused Donald Trump of violating anti-corruption provisions in the U.S. Constitution with his business dealings, capping a week of political victories for the Republican president.

Headline: U.S. Ambassador to EU Sondland says Trump intends to recall him from his post
Article: U.S. Ambassador to the European Union Gordon Sondland, who testified in President Donald Trump's impeachment inquiry, said on Friday that Trump intends to recall him from his post.

Headline: Iowa Democratic Party will assign delegates over weekend
Article: The Iowa Democratic Party will allocate national delegates over the weekend based on the results of the Midwestern state's presidential nomination contest held earlier this week, a state party leader said.

Headline: Trump administration to propose big jump in funding for AI, Quantum R&D: sources
Article: The White House on Monday will propose a big jump in U.S. government spending on artificial intelligence (AI) and quantum information sciences research and development in its 2021 budget proposal, two people briefed on the plan said.

Headline: House panel to hold hearing on future of self-driving cars
Article: A U.S. House panel will hold a hearing Tuesday on autonomous vehicles as lawmakers try to hammer out legislation to advance self-driving cars.

Headline: White House aide Vindman, who testified in Trump impeachment probe, fired: lawyer
Article: National Security Council staffer Lieutenant Colonel Alexander Vindman, a key witness in President Donald Trump's impeachment inquiry, was fired on Friday from his White House job, Vindman's lawyer said in a statement.

Headline: Former Trump Navy Secretary backs Bloomberg for president
Article: Former Secretary of the Navy Richard V. Spencer on Friday endorsed Democratic presidential candidate Michael Bloomberg, making him the first high-level former Trump administration official to back a Democratic hopeful in the 2020 election.

Headline: Trump says will keep Mulvaney as chief of staff, will decide on Vindman
Article: President Donald Trump on Friday said he is keeping Mick Mulvaney as his acting chief of staff, but there will be a decision in the future on what to do with Alexander Vindman, the aide who testified in Trump's impeachment inquiry.

Headline: Ex-Republican lawmaker Walsh ends bid to challenge Trump for White House
Article: Joe Walsh, a conservative former U.S. congressman-turned-radio show host, has ended a long-shot bid to challenge President Donald Trump for the Republican Party's presidential nomination.

Headline: Buttigieg narrowly wins Iowa caucuses: state party results
Article: Pete Buttigieg narrowly won Iowa's Democratic presidential caucuses, the state party said on Thursday, after a long delay in releasing the results of the first contest in the race to pick a challenger to Republican President Donald Trump.

Headline: To counter Huawei, U.S. could take 'controlling stake' in Ericsson, Nokia: attorney general
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Thursday the United States and its allies should consider the highly unusual step of taking a "controlling stake" in Finland's Nokia and Sweden's Ericsson to counter China-based Huawei's dominance in next-generation 5G wireless technology.

Headline: Courts are the next front in Trump's battle over presidential powers
Article: In federal court and on the Senate floor, lawyers for President Donald Trump have argued that the U.S. Constitution confers on a president broad protection from scrutiny by Congress, prosecutors and the judiciary for his actions.

Headline: Buttigieg narrowly defeats Sanders in Iowa caucus: Iowa Democratic Party
Article: Pete Buttigieg, a former mayor of South Bend, Indiana, narrowly defeated Senator Bernie Sanders in the Iowa caucuses with all precincts counted, the Iowa Democratic Party said on Thursday, after technical glitches hindered the counting of votes in the fist contest for the Democratic presidential nomination.

Headline: Senate report criticizes Obama administration handing of Russia election meddling
Article: A bipartisan Senate report released on Thursday criticized the Obama administration for failing to react quickly or thoroughly enough to counter Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election

Headline: Trump exults over acquittal in U.S. Senate impeachment trial
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump celebrated his acquittal on impeachment charges with a pair of caustic, freewheeling speeches on Thursday that drew on White House pomp and the solemnity of an annual prayer breakfast to underscore the fact that he remained in office.

Headline: Trump unbound at White House celebration of his acquittal
Article: Cheered on by loyalists, President Donald Trump did not hold back as he celebrated the end of his impeachment saga on Thursday with a mix of expletives and insults for his opponents and praise for the supporters who stuck with him.

Headline: Sanders raises $25 million in January, campaign announces Super Tuesday ad buy
Article: Bernie Sanders raised $25 million in January toward his run for president, his campaign said on Thursday as it announced it was sending more staff to the 14 states that vote on March 3 in the Democratic Party's nominating contest.

Headline: Senate Democrats ask Fed's Powell about repo market ahead of hearing
Article: U.S. Senate Democrats sent a letter this week to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell asking about the steps the central bank is taking to calm money markets after a bout of volatility last fall.

Headline: Forty-three percent of Americans back Trump acquittal, 41 percent opposed: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Americans are evenly split, mostly along party lines, over the U.S. Senate's acquittal of President Donald Trump at his impeachment trial, even though more respondents than not think he probably did something wrong, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Thursday.

Headline: Trump launches veiled attack on Romney and Pelosi at prayer breakfast
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday accused some of those who supported his impeachment of hypocritically cloaking themselves in their faith, in a thinly veiled attack on Democratic House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senator Mitt Romney, the sole Republican to vote to convict him in his trial.

Headline: Pelosi says she prays hard for Trump because he is so 'off the track'
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday she prays hard for President Donald Trump because he is "off the track" in terms of the U.S. Constitution and American values.

Headline: New Hampshire living rooms essential stop on the campaign trail
Article: The road to victory in New Hampshireâ€™s critical Democratic primary on Tuesday may run through the living rooms of people like Gerri and Ron King.

Headline: Biden wins support of large electrical workers union
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden clinched the support of the 775,000-member International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) on Wednesday, deepening his union backing in a competitive race for his party's presidential nomination.

Headline: Biden says he is 'not going anywhere' after poor showing in Iowa
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden vowed on Wednesday to go on fighting for the Democratic presidential nomination despite what he called the "gut punch" he took in Iowa, where he lagged in fourth place.

Headline: Senate acquits Trump in historic vote as re-election campaign looms
Article: By David Morgan, Susan Cornwell, Richard Cowan and Patricia Zengerle

Headline: Freed from impeachment drama, Trump to press ahead with re-election campaign
Article: President Donald Trump emerged confident and ready to press on with his re-election effort on Wednesday after the Democratic-led impeachment drive that he denounced as illegitimate crashed to a halt in the Republican-led Senate.

Headline: Factbox: Trump impeachment - What happens next?
Article: The U.S. Senate impeachment trial of President Donald Trump enters its final stage on Wednesday, with senators poised to vote on whether to acquit or convict Trump on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress after laying out their positions in a final flurry of speeches.

Headline: Explainer: Why will Republicans vote to acquit Trump in his impeachment trial?
Article: The Republican-led U.S. Senate is expected to acquit President Donald Trump on Wednesday at the end of his impeachment trial on charges that he abused his power in dealings with Ukraine and obstructed efforts to uncover the alleged misconduct.

Headline: The long road to Trump's impeachment and trial
Article: The U.S. Senate was poised on Wednesday to acquit President Donald Trump on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

Headline: Trump's trial is over but the final verdict is not yet in
Article: By Susan Cornwell, Steve Holland, Richard Cowan and James Oliphant

Headline: Factbox: 'A giant asterisk' - quotes from Trump's impeachment trial
Article: The U.S. Senate on Wednesday acquitted President Donald Trump on impeachment charges of abusing his office and obstructing Congress, despite Republican Mitt Romney becoming the first senator in history to vote for the conviction of a president from his own party.

Headline: In Trump's impeachment, four months, 28,000 pages and one loose end
Article: When it was over, the impeachment of U.S. President Donald Trump produced 135 days of partisan rancor, 17 witness accounts, more than 28,000 pages of documents and testimony, and one big loose end.

Headline: White House calls Trump impeachment acquittal 'full vindication and exoneration'
Article: The White House welcomed the U.S. Senate vote to acquit Republican President Donald Trump on Wednesday, calling the impeachment process a "witch hunt ... based on a series of lies."

Headline: Selfies and polite applause greet acquittal vote at Trump Hotel bar in U.S. capital
Article: A smattering of applause briefly interrupted the chatter in the bar of the Trump International Hotel in Washington when the U.S. Senate voted against the first article of impeachment against President Donald Trump.

Headline: Breaking with Republicans, Romney votes 'guilty' in Trump impeachment trial
Article: Republican Senator Mitt Romney issued a scathing criticism of Donald Trump on Wednesday as he broke with his party and voted to convict the U.S. president for abuse of power in his impeachment trial.

Headline: U.S. Speaker Pelosi says she ripped up Trump speech because it 'shredded the truth'
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi had not planned to tear up President Donald Trump's State of the Union speech but decided to do so after she could not find a page "that didn't have a lie on it," she told fellow Democratic lawmakers on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump says he will speak about impeachment acquittal on Thursday
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that he will deliver a public statement at noon EST (1700 GMT) on Thursday on his acquittal on impeachment charges in the Senate.

Headline: U.S Senate acquits Trump of impeachment charges
Article: The U.S. Senate on Wednesday acquitted President Donald Trump of both charges in his impeachment trial as it found him not guilty of obstructing Congress, as had been charged by the House of Representatives.

Headline: U.S. Senate acquits Trump of abuse of power impeachment charge
Article: The U.S. Senate on Wednesday found President Donald Trump not guilty of abusing his powers, as had been charged by the House of Representatives.

Headline: Enough senators find Trump not guilty to acquit Trump of second impeachment charge
Article: Thirty-four U.S. senators on Wednesday voted to find President Donald Trump not guilty of obstruction of Congress as had been charged in articles of impeachment by the House of Representatives, enough to guarantee acquittal.

Headline: Enough senators find Trump not guilty for acquittal on first impeachment charge
Article: Thirty-four U.S. senators on Wednesday voted to find President Donald Trump not guilty of abusing his powers as had been charged in articles of impeachment by the House of Representatives, enough to guarantee acquittal on the charge.

Headline: Buttigieg holds lead over Sanders in latest Iowa caucus results
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg held his lead over U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders in the Iowa caucuses in updated results released by the Iowa Democratic Party on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump-Pelosi feud erupts during speech to Congress as impeachment trial nears end
Article: A bitter feud between U.S. President Donald Trump and top Democrat Nancy Pelosi boiled over at his State of the Union speech on Tuesday, with Trump denying her a handshake and Pelosi ripping apart a copy of his remarks behind his back.

Headline: Trump spurns Pelosi handshake, she tears up his speech
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump snubbed U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi on Tuesday, declining to shake her hand as he handed her a paper copy of his State of the Union speech.

Headline: With made-for-TV flourish, Trump makes case for bringing troops home
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump displayed reality TV flair on Tuesday to underscore his pledge to wind down the war in Afghanistan, engineering the return of an Army sergeant who surprised his wife and two young children in the House of Representatives as a national broadcast audience looked on.

Headline: Trump the showman honors provocative talk-show host Limbaugh
Article: Donald Trump on Tuesday used his State of the Union speech to award the highest U.S. civilian honor to polarizing radio show host Rush Limbaugh in one of several attention-grabbing moments staged by the former reality TV star-turned-president.

Headline: In political speech to Congress, Trump pokes at Democrats' divide on healthcare
Article: Democrats campaigned on healthcare when they won control of the U.S. House of Representatives in 2018. President Donald Trump made plain on Tuesday that he would try to use the issue to his advantage in the 2020 presidential election.

Headline: Highlights: Republican Romney, citing faith, breaks with party on Trump impeachment
Article: Republican Senator Mitt Romney, breaking with his party, said on Wednesday he would vote to convict U.S. President Donald Trump of the impeachment charge of abusing his power, accusing the president of an "abusive and destructive violation" of his oath of office.

Headline: For Democrats, Iowa leaves a muddled path forward
Article: WASHINGTON - The first-in-the-nation Democratic nominating contest in Iowa will go down in infamy after technological snafus resulted in results not being reported for nearly a day, costing the candidates who performed well their moment in the media spotlight and allowing others to question the legitimacy of the outcome.

Headline: U.S. House Judiciary chief: Democrats likely to subpoena Bolton, continue Trump probe - CNN
Article: U.S. House of Representatives' Democrats are likely to subpoena President Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton and continue their investigation into the Republican president, the head of the House Judiciary panel told CNN on Wednesday.

Headline: Rosy polls but few yard signs: How Joe Biden stumbled in Iowa
Article: In the end, Joe Biden, who bills himself as the most electable candidate in the 2020 U.S. Democratic presidential field, could not convince nearly enough Iowans that he is the best person to take on President Donald Trump in November.

Headline: A newly emboldened Trump gives Democrats a reason to fret
Article: President Donald Trump took the stage for his State of the Union speech in an unfamiliar position: With the wind at his back.

Headline: In political speech to Congress, Trump pokes at Democrats' divide on healthcare
Article: Democrats campaigned on healthcare when they won control of the U.S. House of Representatives in 2018. President Donald Trump made plain on Tuesday that he would try to use the issue to his advantage in the 2020 presidential election.

Headline: Buttigieg has narrow Iowa lead on Sanders, Biden lags in Democratic race
Article: Pete Buttigieg held a narrow lead over Bernie Sanders on Tuesday in long-delayed results from the chaotic Iowa Democratic Party caucuses, and former Vice President Joe Biden trailed badly in fourth place with about 71% of precincts reporting.

Headline: Explainer: Election meltdown: What went wrong at the Iowa caucuses
Article: A technology meltdown triggered chaos in the hours after the Iowa caucuses were held on Monday night, upending a highly-anticipated first contest in the U.S. Democratic presidential nomination race.

Headline: Nevada Democrats will not use reporting app that led to Iowa's delayed caucus results
Article: The Nevada Democratic Party said on Tuesday it will not use the same app that led to delayed reporting of Iowa's Monday presidential caucus results for Nevada's caucuses on Feb. 22.

Headline: 'Disorganized mess': Iowans angry over Democratic presidential caucus
Article: From excitement to embarrassment to full-on rage, Iowa Democrats who took part in the first of the state-by-state nominating contests in this year's U.S. presidential race ran the gamut of emotions as their quadrennial moment in the spotlight descended into chaos.

Headline: Bloomberg to double TV spending, expand staff after Democrats' Iowa caucus chaos
Article: Democratic presidential contender Michael Bloomberg on Tuesday said he will immediately double his already massive nationwide television ad spending and expand his staff after the debacle of Iowa's failure to promptly announce its caucuses results.

Headline: Buttigieg holds narrow lead in Iowa, Biden lags in Democrats' updated results
Article: Pete Buttigieg held on to a narrow lead on Tuesday as Iowa Democrats released additional results from their chaotic caucuses, as former Vice President Joe Biden trailed badly in fourth place with about 71% of precincts reporting.

Headline: Partisan rancor on display as senators argue their positions in Trump impeachment trial
Article: The U.S. Senate's top Republican exhorted fellow senators on Tuesday to acquit President Donald Trump in his impeachment trial, warning the fate of the country depended on it, even as his Democratic counterpart called Trump a threat to democracy.

Headline: Buttigieg leads delegate count in initial Iowa caucus results, Biden in fourth
Article: Pete Buttigieg led in Iowa's initial caucus results with 62% of precincts reporting, with U.S. Senators Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren in second and third place and former Vice President Joe Biden trailing in fourth, the Iowa Democratic Party reported on Tuesday.

Headline: 'Wishful thinking': Chief justice no savior for liberals at Trump trial

Article: The Democratic-led U.S. House of Representatives voted Wednesday to send formal impeachment charges against President Donald Trump to the Senate, where Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has said he would help acquit his fellow Republican at a trial.

Headline: With pomp and circumstance, House Democrats deliver impeachment articles to the Senate
Article: After weeks of rhetorical fire and fury, a handful of U.S. House members walked quietly across a hushed Capitol on Wednesday to deliver articles of impeachment to the Senate, paving the way for the trial of President Donald Trump.

Headline: U.S. Democrat Buttigieg campaign's top cybersecurity official quits over differences
Article: The top cybersecurity official with the presidential campaign of South Bend, Indiana Mayor Pete Buttigieg told Reuters on Wednesday that he has resigned, citing philosophical differences with the campaign over information security.

Headline: Schiff to lead prosecution of Trump in Senate impeachment: Pelosi
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Intelligence Committee Chairman Adam Schiff will lead a team of seven Democratic lawmakers who will prosecute the impeachment case against President Donald Trump in the Senate, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Wednesday.

Headline: Naming of impeachment managers 'does not change a single thing': White House
Article: The White House on Wednesday dismissed the naming of seven U.S. House of Representatives members to present the case that President Donald Trump should be removed from office in an upcoming Senate trial.

Headline: Democrats add last-minute evidence to Trump impeachment case before Senate trial
Article: Democrats in the U.S. House of Representatives said on Tuesday they would include new evidence when they send formal impeachment charges against President Donald Trump to the Senate on Wednesday, seeking to expand the scope of a trial that will dominate Washington for the next several weeks.

Headline: Democratic senators seek to force vote to block Trump border wall funding plan
Article: Senior Democratic senators said on Wednesday that they would try to force another vote to stop U.S. President Donald Trump from taking billions of dollars from the Department of Defense budget to pay for a wall on the border with Mexico.

Headline: Sanders, Warren spar over disputed remark about chances of a woman candidate defeating Trump
Article: Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders disagreed in a Democratic presidential debate on Tuesday over whether he once told her a woman could not win the White House in 2020, underlining an emerging rift between the progressive contenders as the first voting nears.

Headline: Trump takes Sanders' side in tiff with Warren over prospect of female U.S. president
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump threw his support, welcome or not, behind Democratic presidential contender Bernie Sanders in his back-and-forth with rival Elizabeth Warren, saying he did not believe Sanders would suggest a woman could not win the 2020 election.

Headline: Highlights: War, trade and a woman in the White House - Democrats spar in Iowa debate
Article: Six Democrats squared off in a televised debate on Tuesday in Iowa, their last chance to make the case for their candidacies to a national audience before the party's presidential nominating process kicks off in the state on Feb. 3.

Headline: In Democratic debate, Sanders-Warren flap makes a winner out of Biden
Article: Six Democratic U.S. presidential candidates sparred over war and trade, gender and health care, in a pressure-packed debate in Des Moines, Iowa, on Tuesday, with the first nominating contest in the state less than three weeks away.

Headline: Trump ex-adviser Flynn seeks to withdraw guilty plea
Article: Lawyers for Michael Flynn, U.S. President Donald Trumpâ€™s former national security adviser, on Tuesday said in a court filing that he would seek to withdraw his guilty plea in former Special Counsel Robert Muellerâ€™s investigation into alleged Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election.

Headline: U.S. judge puts on hold House lawsuit seeking Trump tax returns
Article: A federal judge put on hold a bid by a U.S. House of Representatives committee to obtain President Donald Trump's tax returns, saying on Tuesday that he would wait for a much-anticipated appeals court decision relating to congressional subpoenas before issuing a ruling.

Headline: Wisconsin court temporarily halts removal of more than 200,000 names from voter rolls
Article: A Wisconsin appeals court intervened on Tuesday to stop as many as 209,000 names from being scrubbed from the state's voter registration rolls, in a case voting rights advocates say could impact access to the polls in a key 2020 election state.

Headline: Trump impeachment opening arguments likely Tuesday - McConnell
Article: The impeachment trial of President Donald Trump is likely to begin next Tuesday, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said.

Headline: Judge rules in favor of Trump administration in family separation case
Article: A U.S. federal judge has ruled that the Trump administration's ongoing separations of families at the U.S.-Mexico border based on parents' criminal history or health exclusions are being carried out with proper discretion.

Headline: White House contender Warren sees path to cancel student loan debt without Congress
Article: Democrat Elizabeth Warren outlined on Tuesday how, if elected to the White House, she would on the first day of her presidency cancel federal student loan debt by using the Department of Education's pre-existing authority.

Headline: Democrats say measure to rein in Trump on Iran will pass Senate
Article: U.S. Senate Democrats said on Tuesday they had enough votes in the Republican-controlled Senate to pass a resolution curbing President Donald Trump's ability to wage war on Iran without congressional approval, which would be a rebuke of the president after he ordered a strike that killed an Iranian commander in Iraq.

Headline: Schumer says believes majority of U.S. Senate backs Iran war powers resolution
Article: U.S. Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer said on Tuesday he believed a majority of 51 U.S. senators will approve a war powers resolution to block President Donald Trump from further military action, which would be a rebuke of the president's policy in the Republican-controlled chamber.

Headline: Bloomberg taps fortune, now has 1,000 workers for U.S. Democratic presidential campaign
Article: Billionaire U.S. presidential candidate Mike Bloomberg has vastly expanded his campaign staff, which now boasts a battalion of over 1,000 workers, his campaign said on Tuesday, giving him significant force as he tries to unseat Republican President Donald Trump.

Headline: Republican senators say they will not vote to dismiss charges against Trump ahead of trial
Article: Republican members of the U.S Senate, poised to begin an impeachment trial against President Donald Trump in the coming days, voiced opposition on Monday to any attempt to dismiss the charges against him without a trial.

Headline: Factbox: Trump impeachment - what happens next?
Article: The Democratic-led U.S. House of Representatives is expected to vote on Wednesday to send formal impeachment charges against President Donald Trump to the Senate, where Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has said he would help acquit his fellow Republican at a trial.

Headline: House to vote Wednesday to send impeachment articles to Senate
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives will vote on Wednesday on a resolution to send articles of impeachment against President Donald Trump to the Senate, according to a Democratic lawmaker and a Democratic aide.

Headline: Democrat Klobuchar on diversity and taking on Trump in the 2020 presidential race
Article: Democratic presidential contender Amy Klobuchar is banking on a strong showing in Iowa's first-in-the-nation nominating contest on Feb. 3 to jump-start her path to the party's nomination.

Headline: Seattle passes campaign finance curbs on 'foreign-influenced' firms
Article: The Seattle City Council voted unanimously on Monday to approve campaign finance legislation banning political donations in local elections from companies with at least 5% foreign ownership.

Headline: Trump impeachment trial fight for Bolton testimony echoes Monica Lewinsky
Article: Twenty-one years ago former White House intern Lewinsky was at the center of a tug-of-war over whether she would testify in the U.S. Senate impeachment trial of President Bill Clinton, a Democrat.

Headline: Warren: Sanders said in 2018 meeting a woman could not win the White House
Article: Elizabeth Warren took the unusual step on Monday of confirming a report that fellow Democratic White House contender Bernie Sanders told her during a 2018 meeting that he did not believe a woman could win the 2020 presidential race.

Headline: In tight race, new polls show Biden on top in Iowa, New Hampshire
Article: Two opinion polls from the states holding the first presidential nominating contests brought good news on Monday for former Vice President Joe Biden in his bid to be the 2020 Democratic nominee.

Headline: U.S. presidential campaign probes to require top officials' approval: Barr
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Monday that he would raise the threshold needed to open counterintelligence investigations of presidential campaigns, a move that follows complaints by President Donald Trump about government surveillance of his 2016 election campaign.

Headline: Ex-U.S. Treasury employee pleads guilty to leaks linked to Russia probe
Article: A former U.S. Treasury Department employee on Monday pleaded guilty to leaking confidential documents relating to former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort and others to a reporter from digital media company BuzzFeed.

Headline: Trump: Timing of threat from Soleimani 'doesn't really matter'
