Article: Democrat Beto O'Rourke has called for investment in a â€œworld-class public school system" and says teachers make up the single biggest professional group contributing to his 2020 presidential campaign.

Headline: Facebook, Google accused of anti-conservative bias at U.S. Senate hearing
Article: Republican senators on Wednesday said Alphabet Inc's Google, Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc discriminate against conservative viewpoints and suppress free speech, suggesting anti-trust action could be a solution.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers propose bill to fight bias in tech companies' algorithms
Article: U.S. lawmakers proposed a bill on Wednesday that would require major tech companies to detect and remove any discriminatory biases embedded in their computer models, underscoring Washington's growing interest in regulating Silicon Valley.

Headline: Explainer: Did he or didn't he? What might an obstruction case against Trump look like?
Article: A key element of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's inquiry into Russia's role in the 2016 U.S. election was whether President Donald Trump unlawfully acted to impede the investigation, a crime known as obstruction of justice.

Headline: Trump says he will have to call up more military at U.S.-Mexico border
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he would have to mobilize more of the military at the U.S. border with Mexico after listening to stories about migrants crossing the border from people attending a Republican fundraiser.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers grill bank CEOs on social issues
Article: Chief executives of some of the largest U.S. banks faced off with the House Financial Services committee for the first time since the financial crisis on Wednesday armed with the healthy balance sheets, but lawmakers grilled executives more on social issues than business fundamentals.

Headline: Trump signs orders targeting states' power to slow energy projects
Article: President Donald Trump signed two executive orders in the heart of the Texas energy hub on Wednesday targeting the power of states to delay natural gas, coal and oil projects as he looks to build support ahead of next year's election.

Headline: No sign yet of Trump's tax returns, increasing likelihood of court fight
Article: The likelihood of a court fight over President Donald Trump's tax returns grew on Wednesday when the U.S. Treasury Department said it would not meet a deadline set by Democratic legislators to provide them and Trump himself stuck to his refusal to publicly release the documents.

Headline: Mnuchin says he needs more time to decide on releasing Trump's taxes
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said his department needs more time to decide whether to release President Donald Trump's tax returns, missing a Wednesday deadline set by a House of Representatives committee.

Headline: U.S. Senate bill mandates review of nuclear power cooperation with other nations
Article: A bipartisan group of U.S. senators introduced legislation on Wednesday mandating that the executive branch disclose details about authorizations it gives companies on sharing sensitive nuclear energy information with countries looking to build reactors.

Headline: Bernie Sanders puts focus on healthcare with Medicare for All bill
Article: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders unveiled the latest version of his ambitious "Medicare-for-All" plan on Wednesday, moving the healthcare debate among Democratic presidential contenders to center stage in the 2020 race.

Headline: Pelosi: Attorney General Barr 'off the rails' on Mueller report
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi castigated Attorney General William Barr on Wednesday for comments he made during congressional hearings this week about the federal probe of Russian interference in the 2016 election.

Headline: Top U.S. Senate Democrat says Barr should retract spying statement
Article: Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer called on Attorney General William Barr on Wednesday to retract his statement that U.S. agencies spied on President Donald Trump's presidential campaign.

Headline: Northrop Grumman wins $3.2 billion U.S. defense contract: Pentagon
Article: Northrop Grumman Corp has been awarded a $3.2 billion U.S. defense contract for E-2D Advanced Hawkeye tactical airborne early warning aircraft, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

Headline: Factbox: Big bank CEOs face the heat over pay disparity at Capitol Hill
Article: Chief executive officers of some of America's largest banks, including JPMorgan Chase & Co, Bank of America Corp and Citigroup Inc, on Wednesday testified before Congress, where they were grilled on a wide range topics.

Headline: U.S. House approves net neutrality bill but legislation faces long odds
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives on Wednesday approved a bill on a 232 to 190 vote to reinstate landmark net neutrality protections adopted in 2015, but the effort faces an uphill battle to become law.

Headline: Senator Warren lags 2020 Democratic hopefuls in fundraising haul
Article: U.S. Senator Elizabeth Warren's presidential campaign raised $6 million in the first quarter of 2019, lagging behind Democratic rivals after swearing off expensive fundraising events, her campaign said on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump 'will continue to ratchet up pressure' on Iran: Pompeo
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will increase pressure on Iran, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday, but he declined specific comment on whether the administration would continue sanctions waivers for countries that import Iranian oil.

Headline: Pentagon to find places to potentially house up to 5,000 unaccompanied migrant children
Article: Acting U.S. Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan has approved a request to identify places to potentially house up to 5,000 unaccompanied migrant children, the Pentagon said on Wednesday.

Headline: Mexico government slams U.S. border slowdown as 'very bad idea'
Article: Mexico's foreign minister on Wednesday criticized hold-ups in the flow of goods and people at the U.S-Mexico border, and said he planned to discuss the matter with U.S. Department of Homeland Security officials later in the day.

Headline: U.S. Senate confirms Abizaid as ambassador to Saudi Arabia
Article: The U.S. Senate voted overwhelmingly on Wednesday to confirm retired General John Abizaid as the U.S. ambassador to Saudi Arabia, filling a vital position vacant since President Donald Trump took office more than two years ago.

Headline: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen leaving position: Trump
Article: U.S. Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen will be leaving her position, President Donald Trump said on Twitter on Sunday.

Headline: Moore 'superbly underqualified' for Fed, vice chair of joint congressional committee says
Article: Stephen Moore, the economic commentator whom President Donald Trump plans to nominate to the Federal Reserve Board, lacks the expertise and political independence needed to help set interest rates for the U.S. economy, a top Congressional Democrat said on Tuesday.

Headline: Mueller report out next week: Attorney General Barr
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Wednesday that a redacted version of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report on Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. election will be released next week.

Headline: Exclusive: U.S. bill to boost electric car tax credits could rev GM, Tesla
Article: A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers introduced legislation on Wednesday to expand the electric vehicle tax credit by 400,000 vehicles per manufacturer, a provision that would give a boost to Tesla Inc and General Motors Co before the existing credit comes to an end for them.

Headline: Trump says he has not seen or read Mueller's Russia probe report
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he had not seen or read a report into Russian election meddling by Special Counsel Robert Mueller, a day after his attorney general would not say whether he had briefed the White House or shared the report.

Headline: After U.S. court strikes down policy, what happens to migrants Trump sent back to Mexico?
Article: On Tuesday, seven Central American families living temporarily in Mexico appeared in a San Diego immigration court to plead for asylum in the United States.

Headline: More Trump firings of senior U.S. immigration officials seen likely
Article: President Donald Trump's administration stepped up pressure on the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) on Tuesday, raising the likelihood that he might fire more senior officials as the agency struggles with a surge of immigrants on the U.S.-Mexico border.

Headline: White House will appeal ruling against returning asylum seekers to Mexico
Article: The White House said on Tuesday it would appeal a court ruling that halted a Trump administration policy requiring some asylum seekers to return to Mexico and wait for their legal cases to proceed.

Headline: Facebook, Google defend efforts to remove hate speech before Congress
Article: Facebook Inc and Alphabet Inc's Google unit on Tuesday defended their efforts to remove hate speech from social media sites amid questions from lawmakers in an appearance before the U.S. House Judiciary Committee.

Headline: Homeland Security's acting deputy secretary offered resignation to Trump: Nielsen
Article: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen said on Tuesday that Claire Grady, the acting deputy secretary of the department, had offered her resignation to President Donald Trump, potentially further destabilizing the agency tasked with managing immigration and the country's borders.

Headline: U.S. judge halts Trump policy of returning asylum seekers to Mexico
Article: A U.S. judge on Monday halted the Trump administration's policy of sending some asylum seekers back across the southern border to wait out their cases in Mexico, stopping a program the government planned to expand to stem a recent flood of migrants.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers introduce bill to protect Native American site from drilling
Article: New Mexico lawmakers on Tuesday introduced a bill to protect federal lands around the Chaco Canyon from drilling and mining, attempting to permanently shield the Native American cultural site from recurring attempts at oil and gas leasing.

Headline: Trump seen leaning hard on new Homeland Security chief over border
Article: President Donald Trump's new acting chief of Homeland Security will be under pressure to implement legally dubious solutions to an influx of migrants at the U.S.-Mexico border - policies that his predecessor either could not, or would not, deliver.

Headline: McConnell: Trump has legitimate concerns about border
Article: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he believed President Donald Trump has legitimate concerns about what is happening at the southern U.S. border and urged Republicans and Democrats to work together on a legislative solution.

Headline: Mueller report will be released within a week: U.S. attorney general
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr told lawmakers on Tuesday that he intends to release "within a week" a redacted version of the long-awaited report on Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election from Special Counsel Robert Mueller.

Headline: Trump says he is not reviving U.S. immigration policy that separated children from parents
Article: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he was not reviving a policy of separating children from parents who had illegally crossed the U.S.-Mexico border, one day after media reports that his administration was considering putting it back in place.

Headline: Trump's Fed picks draw political fire as they angle for the job
Article: A political feud over President Donald Trumpâ€™s picks for the U.S. Federal Reserve Board broke into an open brawl on Tuesday even before the nominations of Herman Cain, a former restaurant chain executive, and Stephen Moore, a conservative economic commentator, have been formally submitted to the Senate.

Headline: Trump praises Egypt's Sisi despite concerns about human rights, Russian arms
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump praised his Egyptian counterpart, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, as a "great president" on Tuesday, even as a bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers raised concerns about Sisi's record on human rights, efforts to keep him in office for many years and planned Russian arms purchases.

Headline: U.S. House Democrats call off budget vote after liberal revolt
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Democrats on Tuesday canceled a planned floor vote on legislation to set federal spending levels for next year after the party's left wing demanded more money for domestic programs.

Headline: U.S. senators introduce bill to sanction Turkish officials over detentions
Article: Two U.S. senators on Tuesday introduced a bipartisan bill requiring the imposition of sanctions on Turkish officials responsible for the detentions of U.S. citizens and local consulate staff in Turkey, a statement on the legislation said.

Headline: Senate panel chair rejects Trump request for State Department budget cut
Article: Republican U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham flatly rejected on Tuesday President Donald Trump's request to slash the budget for the U.S. State Department by more than 23 percent.

Headline: U.S. Senate Republican leader calls net neutrality bill 'dead on arrival'
Article: U.S. Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday a Democratic bid to restore the 2015 net neutrality rules is "dead on arrival in the Senate."

Headline: Factbox: Guilty pleas, indictments abound in Trump-Russia probe
Article: Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russia's role in the 2016 U.S. election has ensnared dozens of people, including several advisers to President Donald Trump and a series of Russian nationals and companies.

Headline: Mnuchin says Treasury lawyers consulted White House on Trump tax returns
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Tuesday that Treasury Department lawyers had held "informational" discussions with the White House about an expected request from House Democrats for President Donald Trump's tax returns.

Headline: Trump wants debt ceiling hike passed quickly, will not link to wall funds: Mnuchin
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin told lawmakers on Tuesday that President Donald Trump is not interested in holding an increase of the debt ceiling "hostage" to force Congress to pass funding for a border wall with Mexico or any other legislation.

Headline: More than 100,000 migrants encountered at U.S. southern border in March: data
Article: U.S. officers arrested or denied entry to over 103,000 people along the border with Mexico in March, a 35 percent increase over the prior month and more than twice as many as the same period last year, according to data released by U.S. Customs and Border Protection on Tuesday.

Headline: Top U.S. Senate Democrat calls Trump's Fed picks unqualified
Article: The top Democrat in the U.S. Senate said on Tuesday that he did not think President Donald Trump's picks for seats on the Federal Reserve's board, Herman Cain and Stephen Moore, were qualified for the position.

Headline: U.S. congressional committee leaders warn Turkey on F-35, S-400
Article: The leaders of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations and Armed Services Committees warned Turkey on Tuesday that it risked tough sanctions if it pursued plans to purchase Russian S-400 missile defense systems, and they threatened further legislative action.

Headline: Trump decision to cut Central American aid won't be reversed soon: top official
Article: The top U.S. international aid official indicated on Tuesday the Trump administration has no immediate plan to roll back a decision to cut aid to Central American nations after thousands of their citizens sought asylum at the U.S. southern border, despite strong Congressional opposition.

Headline: U.S. Air Force General Hyten nominated to be next vice chairman of Joint Chiefs of Staff
Article: Air Force General John Hyten, currently the head of U.S. Strategic Command, has been nominated to be the next vice chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff, the Air Force secretary said on Tuesday.

Headline: Biotech crops among sticking points in U.S.-China trade deal: sources
Article: China's lengthy approval process for genetically modified crops remains a sticking point in talks to end the trade war between China and the United States, according to two sources with knowledge of the talks.

Headline: Putin, on Mueller report: 'We said from the start it would find nothing'
Article: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday commented for the first time on Special Counsel Robert Mueller's completed report into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election, saying Moscow had always said it would find nothing.

Headline: Democratic Congressman Swalwell joins White House race
Article: U.S. Representative Eric Swalwell said on Monday he would seek the Democratic nomination for president, joining a crowded field seeking to take on Republican Donald Trump in the 2020 election.

Headline: In second stint as U.S. attorney general, Barr faces toughest call on Mueller report
Article: On Aug. 29, 1991, William Barr had a decision to make.

Headline: Barr to release Mueller report 'within a week'
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said on Tuesday he expected to release next week the public version of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report on whether President Donald Trump's campaign worked with Moscow to influence the 2016 election.

Headline: U.S. aid agency plans 'framework' to counteract Russia influence globally
Article: The head of the U.S. Agency for International Development said on Tuesday the agency would soon unveil an effort to try to use U.S. assistance to counteract Russian influence around the world.

Headline: U.S. bank executives say Wall Street has reformed, though crisis scars linger
Article: (This April 8 story has been refilled to correct fourth paragraph to remove reference to Northern Trust's testimony appearing. Northern Trust is not testifying)

Headline: Trump's Fed picks pan liberals, praise Trump
Article: Herman Cain, the former pizza chain executive picked by President Donald Trump for a policy seat on the Federal Reserve, panned 'liberal lunatics' and socialism in Monday's installment of his eponymous show on Facebook.

Headline: Chinese woman arrested at Trump's Florida resort to remain in custody
Article: A Chinese woman charged with bluffing her way into President Donald Trump's Florida resort will remain in custody at least another week, a federal magistrate ruled on Monday.

Headline: U.S. advertising groups create privacy bill coalition
Article: Four U.S. advertising trade groups have banded together to lobby Congress to ensure federal online privacy legislation is less strict than a law scheduled to go into effect in California in 2020.

Headline: U.S. prosecutors seek leniency for political consultant tied to Russia probe
Article: A veteran political consultant who pleaded guilty in August in a case spun out of U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia probe should get a lenient sentence to account for his "substantial" assistance in other criminal investigations, U.S. prosecutors said on Monday.

Headline: Klobuchar raises more than $5 million for U.S. presidential run
Article: U.S. Senator Amy Klobuchar raised more than $5 million during the first seven weeks of her 2020 White House bid, with more than $3 million left over from her Senate campaign, leaving her with total cash on hand of about $7 million, her campaign said on Monday.

Headline: Factbox: Big Democratic field taking shape for 2020 U.S. presidential race
Article: The largest Democratic field in the modern political era is lining up to seek the party's 2020 presidential nomination - and is expected to keep growing.

Headline: Secret Service chief to leave in Trump security shake-up
Article: President Donald Trump has ordered a shake-up of the leadership of the Department of Homeland Security, the head of the U.S. Secret Service said on Monday, after the White House said the official would be soon be leaving his post.

Headline: Factbox: Trump administration departures, firings, reassignments
Article: The White House said on Monday that President Donald Trump would replace the head of the U.S. Secret Service, a day after Trump asked for the resignation of Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen.

Headline: U.S. House to vote on net neutrality bill on Tuesday
Article: The Democratic-led U.S. House of Representatives is set to vote on Tuesday on a bill to reinstate landmark net neutrality rules repealed by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) under President Donald Trump.

Headline: White House aides to recommend Trump veto net neutrality measure: document
Article: White House aides would recommend President Donald Trump veto a bill to restore landmark net neutrality protections if reinstated by Congress, according to a document sent to lawmakers Monday and seen by Reuters.

Headline: Outgoing Secret Service director says he was not fired
Article: The outgoing director of the U.S. Secret Service Randolph "Tex" Alles said on Monday that he was not fired, describing the shift as part of an "orderly transition in leadership" across the Department of Homeland Secretary.

Headline: U.S., Brazilian vice presidents discuss Venezuela pressure at White House
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence met with his Brazilian counterpart Hamilton Mourao at the White House on Monday to discuss sanctions and diplomatic efforts aimed at increasing the pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to exit.

Headline: Factbox: Possible successors to Homeland Security Secretary Nielsen
Article: Several names surfaced on Monday as possible successors to U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen, who resigned on Sunday after 16 months managing President Donald Trump's turbulent immigration agenda.

Headline: Trump picks career Secret Service agent to lead agency: White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump is replacing the U.S. Secret Service director with career agent James Murray, the White House said on Monday, in what media reports described as a top leadership shuffle at the Department of Homeland Security.

Headline: Republicans want census data on citizenship for redistricting
Article: John Murante, a conservative Nebraska senator, last year introduced a bill to prevent non-citizens from being counted when the state redraws its voting maps.

Headline: Homeland Security Secretary Nielsen resigns amid Trump anger over border
Article: U.S. Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen, who oversaw President Donald Trump's bitterly contested immigration policies during her tumultuous 16-month tenure, resigned on Sunday amid a surge in the number of migrants at the border with Mexico.

Headline: Baltimore city council urges mayor to resign amid probe into $500,000 book payment
Article: The Baltimore City Council on Monday called on Mayor Catherine Pugh to resign as the state probes a deal in which a hospital chain where she served as director paid her $500,000 for copies of her self-published children's book "Healthy Holly."

Headline: Democrats in Congress authorize subpoenas for Trump-Russia report, legal battle looms
Article: U.S. congressional Democrats on Wednesday authorized a powerful committee chairman to subpoena Special Counsel Robert Mueller's full report on Russia's role in the 2016 election, moving closer to a legal clash with President Donald Trump's administration.

Headline: Democratic-led House panel authorizes subpoenas for Mueller report, evidence
Article: The Democratic-led U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee voted on Wednesday to authorize subpoenas for Special Counsel Robert Mueller's full, unredacted report and underlying evidence from his investigation into Russia's role in the 2016 election.

Headline: Under pressure, U.S. Justice Department defends handling of Mueller report
Article: The U.S. Justice Department on Thursday defended its handling of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report examining contacts between President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign and Russia as it faced increased pressure to make the document public.

Headline: Factbox: Five things to look for in Mueller's Trump-Russia report
Article: Attorney General William Barr has provided only a glimpse of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report on the inquiry into Russia's role in the 2016 U.S. election, with many details expected to emerge when the document is finally released.

Headline: U.S. House judiciary chair seeks any Mueller summaries on Trump-Russia probe report
Article: U.S. House Judiciary Committee Jerrold Nadler called on Attorney General William Barr on Thursday to release any summaries of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Trump-Russia report that were prepared by Mueller's team.

Headline: Explainer: Can Democratic subpoenas force the release of Mueller's Trump-Russia report?
Article: Democrats in the House of Representatives are gearing up to issue subpoenas to try to obtain Special Counsel Robert Mueller's full report on Russia's role in the 2016 U.S. election and President Donald Trump's actions related to the inquiry.

Headline: White House to Democrats seeking Trump tax returns: 'Never'
Article: President Donald Trump's tax returns will never be handed over to Democratic lawmakers, White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney said on Sunday, defying an effort in Congress to learn more about the real estate mogul's personal finances.

Headline: Cory Booker raises more than $5 million for U.S. presidential run
Article: New Jersey Senator Cory Booker raised more than $5 million for his presidential election campaign in February and March, and has more than $6.1 million in cash on hand, his campaign said on Sunday.

Headline: Cain, Moore nominations for Federal Reserve seats on track: Kudlow
Article: Top White House officials on Sunday defended President Donald Trump's plan to name two political loyalists to the Federal Reserve board of governors, brushing aside controversies over their personal lives and qualifications to help run the world's most powerful central bank.

Headline: U.S. government says it could take two years to identify families separated at border
Article: It could take the U.S. government up to two years to identify potentially thousands of additional children separated from their parents by the authorities at the southern border, the government said in a court filing.

Headline: Herman Cain says he faces 'cumbersome' vetting for Fed board seat
Article: Former Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain said he will face a "cumbersome" process as he is vetted for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board.

Headline: President Trump says has not read Mueller report
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he had not read Special Counsel Robert Mueller's report investigating contacts between his 2016 campaign and Russia that his Democratic opponents say should be released in full.

Headline: Former South Carolina Senator Ernest 'Fritz' Hollings dies at 97
Article: Ernest "Fritz" Hollings, a sharp-tongued moderate Democrat with a booming voice and deep Southern drawl who advocated fiscal discipline in Washington during 38 years representing South Carolina in the U.S. Senate, died on Saturday at age 97.

Headline: Trump says he made Golan Heights decision after a quick history lesson
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Saturday he made the controversial decision to recognize Israel's 1981 annexation of the Golan Heights after getting a quick history lesson during a conversation on a different subject.

Headline: New York man charged with threatening to kill Muslim U.S. lawmaker Ilhan Omar
Article: A 55-year-old New York man has been arrested and charged with threatening to assault and murder Democratic Representative Ilhan Omar, a Muslim U.S. Congress member from Minnesota, federal prosecutors said.

Headline: U.S. ratchets up pressure on Venezuela, Cuban backers
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence on Friday stepped up efforts to force Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro from office by imposing new sanctions on its oil shipments, and promising "stronger action" against Cuba for helping to keep the regime afloat.

Headline: Courting black voters, Bernie Sanders draws personal contrast with Trump
Article: Democratic presidential contender Bernie Sanders, courting the black voters who did not support his 2016 White House run, drew a sharp personal contrast on Friday with what he called President Donald Trump's racist policies.

Headline: Fight begins over Trump's taxes, lawyer slams Democrats' request
Article: An attorney for President Donald Trump on Friday blasted U.S. House Democrats' request for six years of Trump's tax returns as "a misguided attempt" to politicize the tax laws, accusing lawmakers of harassment and interference in IRS audits.

Headline: U.S. attorney general orders probe into mistreatment of gay employees
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr said he was ordering certain Justice Department offices to investigate possible discrimination targeting gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender employees after an internal gay affinity group complained of low morale.

Headline: Trump touts rising U.S. border 'wall,' proposes economic penalty on Mexico
Article: President Donald Trump on Friday promised approximately 450 miles (725 km) of new "wall" along the southern U.S. border, after threatening to slap Mexico with an unspecified economic penalty to crack down on what he describes as a crisis of undocumented immigration and drug trafficking.

Headline: Pence to address U.N. Security Council on Venezuela next week
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence will address the United Nations Security Council next week on Venezuela, a White House official said on Friday, as the 15-member body remains deadlocked over how to deal with the country's political and humanitarian crisis.

Headline: U.S. targets Cuba's oil supply from Venezuela in new sanctions
Article: The United States on Friday targeted oil shipments from Venezuela to Cuba in its latest round of sanctions to pressure the government of President Nicolas Maduro, aiming to choke off a crucial supply of crude to the Communist island.

Headline: Liberal group squares off with U.S. Democratic leadership over challenging incumbents
Article: The grassroots group that helped propel U.S. Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez into Congress is taking on Democratic party leaders over what critics call an effort to deter liberal candidates from running against more moderate incumbents.

Headline: U.S. sanctions target Cuba's role in propping up Venezuela government: Mnuchin
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday that sanctions imposed by Washington on ships transporting Venezuelan crude to Cuba target Havana's role in propping the government of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

Headline: Amid complaints of unwanted touching, Biden jokes he got 'permission' to hug
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden, facing a growing swell of allegations that he has made women uncomfortable with his use of physical contact, made light of the controversy on Friday while continuing to lay the groundwork for a 2020 presidential run.

Headline: Twenty states file motion to block Trump border wall funding: N.Y. attorney general
Article: Twenty U.S. states have filed a motion to block President Donald Trump's method of funding a border wall by diverting federal funds through a national emergency declaration, the New York state attorney general said on Friday.

Headline: Pompeo hopes North Korea's Kim does 'right thing' on nuclear weapons in parliament speech
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Friday he hoped North Korean leader Kim Jong Un would use a meeting of the country's parliament next week to state publicly "it would be the right thing" for Pyongyang to give up its nuclear weapons.

Headline: Biden, mulling White House run, seeks to stem fallout from women's complaints
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden attempted on Wednesday to tamp down a controversy over allegations of unwanted physical contact with women, releasing a video in which he pledged to be â€œmore mindful" of respecting "personal space."

Headline: U.S. aid helped Guatemalan farmers stay rooted to their lands
Article: After a U.S.-funded program gave Guatemalan farmer Rigoberto Leon and his neighbors tools to plant new crops like tomatoes and chili peppers, many of them stayed to live off their drought-prone lands even as droves of villagers left for the United States.

Headline: Trump: looking at economic penalty for drugs coming from Mexico
Article: President Donald Trump said on Friday he is considering an economic penalty apart from tariffs to counter the smuggling of drugs from Mexico across the southern U.S. border.

Headline: Trump says he will skip White House correspondents dinner
Article: President Donald Trump said on Friday he will once again not attend the annual dinner of the White House Correspondents Association, calling the event too negative.

Headline: As Trump eyed Cain for Fed, Cain raised money for Trump
Article: Former pizza chain executive Herman Cain, U.S. President Donald Trump's pick for a position on the Federal Reserve's interest-rate setting panel, runs a political fundraising group that has spent more than half its money supporting Trump's reelection.

Headline: Exclusive: Only 6 percent of those subject to Trump travel ban granted U.S. waivers
Article: The U.S. government granted waivers to just 6 percent of visa applicants subject to its travel ban on a handful of countries during the first 11 months of the ban, new data reviewed by Reuters shows.

Headline: Trump says U.S.-China trade deal may be reached in four weeks
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the United States and China were close to a trade deal that could be announced within four weeks, while warning Beijing that it would be difficult to allow trade to continue without a pact.

Headline: FBI investigating Chinese woman's Trump resort visit: sources
Article: The FBI is examining whether a Chinese woman who bluffed her way into President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort last weekend had any links to Chinese intelligence or political influence operations, two U.S. government sources said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. revokes ICC prosecutor's entry visa over Afghanistan investigation
Article: The United States has revoked the entry visa of the prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, Fatou Bensouda, her office said on Thursday, a response to her inquiry into possible war crimes by U.S. forces in Afghanistan.

Headline: U.S. Senate confirms housing regulator overseeing Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac
Article: The U.S. Senate on Thursday confirmed President Donald Trump's pick to lead the Federal Housing Finance Agency, which oversees Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

Headline: Trump names new Small Business Administration chief
Article: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he will nominate U.S. Treasurer Jovita Carranza to lead the Small Business Administration.

Headline: Trump picks former presidential candidate Cain for Fed board
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump plans to nominate former pizza chain executive and Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board, where he will help set interest rates for the world's biggest economy.

Headline: Former Trump lawyer Cohen says assisting with more probes
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen has received requests for information from at least six government entities since late February, according to a letter from Cohen's attorney to Democratic lawmakers, a sign of ongoing interest in evidence Cohen may have on his former boss.

Headline: Trump says trade deal with China could be reached in about four weeks
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday a trade deal with China was getting very close and could be reached in about four weeks.

Headline: U.S. House committee seeks Trump tax returns from IRS
Article: The Democratic head of a powerful U.S. House committee asked the Internal Revenue Service for six years of President Donald Trump's personal and business tax returns on Wednesday, in a long-awaited move widely expected to lead to a long court battle with the White House.

Headline: Trump threatens car import tariffs in new warning to Mexico
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to impose tariffs on car imports from Mexico unless it does more to stop illegal migrants and drug trafficking, his latest warning to America's southern neighbor to tighten border security.

Headline: Trump says he recommended Cain for seat on Fed board
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he recommended former pizza chain executive and Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board.

Headline: Trump says if he decides to set tariffs on Mexico cars, rate would be 25 percent
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that if he decides to apply tariffs on car imports from Mexico, the rate would be set at 25 percent.

Headline: Congress to sue to block Trump border wall funding action: Pelosi
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives will sue to block President Donald Trump's transfer of money to pay for a border wall along the border with Mexico, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Thursday.

Headline: Democrat Buttigieg says he no longer uses phrase 'all lives matter'
Article: Democratic presidential contender Pete Buttigieg said on Thursday that when he used the phrase "all lives matter" in a 2015 speech he did not understand it had been adopted by critics to devalue the Black Lives Matter movement.

Headline: Mexican official says auto trade pact with U.S., Canada not under threat
Article: A top Mexican trade official said on Thursday that the trade agreement between Mexico, Canada and the United States was firm on the car industry and not under threat.

Headline: Congressman Tim Ryan of Ohio joins crowded Democratic field in 2020 White House race
Article: U.S. Representative Tim Ryan, a moderate Ohio Democrat from a blue-collar district who touts his appeal to the working-class voters who fled the party in 2016, said on Thursday he will enter the 2020 White House race.

Headline: Factbox: Big Democratic field taking shape for 2020 U.S. presidential race
Article: The largest Democratic field in the modern political era is lining up to seek the party's 2020 presidential nomination - and is expected to keep growing.

Headline: FBI head says agency has no desire to move its headquarters
Article: FBI Director Chris Wray on Thursday defended the Trump administration's decision to abandon plans to relocate the bureau's crumbling and outdated headquarters to Virginia or Maryland, saying he prefers to build a new state-of-the-art facility at its current location in downtown Washington, D.C.

Headline: U.S. House rebukes Trump on Saudi Arabia, backs measure to end Yemen involvement
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives approved a resolution on Thursday that would end all U.S. involvement with the Saudi Arabia-led coalition in the war in Yemen, rebuffing President Donald Trump's policy of continued support for the kingdom.

Headline: Trump says China trade talks going well, will only accept 'great' deal
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that trade talks with China were going well and he would only accept a "great" deal as negotiators hammered out differences ahead of a meeting between Trump and China's vice premier later in the day.

Headline: Trump says China will be buying a lot of product from U.S.
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that China will be buying a lot of product from the United States as the world's two largest economies try to sort out a trade dispute.

Headline: Senate panel approves Trump's pick for Interior Dept.
Article: A key Senate committee approved U.S. President Donald Trump's pick to lead the Department of Interior on Thursday, putting former energy lobbyist David Bernhardt closer to becoming the permanent head of the agency that oversees public lands.

Headline: Facebook's Zuckerberg confident of stopping interference in 2020 campaign
Article: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg is confident the world's biggest social network will do better in 2020 at stopping "bad actors" from manipulating the U.S. presidential election.

Headline: San Diego County sues Trump administration over immigration policy
Article: San Diego County has filed a federal lawsuit against the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump, accusing it of leaving thousands of asylum seekers stranded without help and straining county resources, officials said on Wednesday.

Headline: Senator Michael Bennet says has cancer, will have surgery
Article: United States Senator Michael Bennet of Colorado, previously mentioned as a possible contender for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2020, said on Wednesday that he will undergo surgery for prostate cancer during the upcoming legislative break.

Headline: U.S. Senate Republicans change procedures to speed up Trump confirmations
Article: The Republican-led U.S. Senate on Wednesday changed its procedures to speed up the confirmation of President Donald Trump's nominees for some lower court judgeships and sub-Cabinet level positions.

Headline: U.S. Democrats question Mar-a-Lago security after Chinese intruder
Article: Congressional Democrats raised questions on Wednesday about security at President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida after a Chinese woman carrying electronic devices bluffed her way through security checks last weekend.

Headline: Trump says not concerned about China spying at his Florida resort
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he was not worried about Chinese espionage at Mar-a-Lago, after the Secret Service arrested a Chinese woman who had passed security checkpoints at the Florida resort carrying a thumb drive with malicious software.

Headline: Wilbur Ross refuses to testify on U.S. Commerce Department's 2020 budget
Article: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross refused to testify about his department's 2020 budget before a congressional panel on Wednesday, an act its chairman called one of "stunning disrespect" that left lawmakers facing an empty chair.

Headline: Trump to sign order seeking to clear gas pipeline hurdles: Kudlow
Article: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Wednesday said the Trump administration would soon issue an executive order that would open the door for more natural gas pipelines and exports of liquefied natural gas, or LNG.

Headline: U.S. senators want stiff sanctions to deter Russia election meddling
Article: U.S. Republican and Democratic senators introduced legislation on Wednesday seeking to deter Russia from meddling in U.S. elections by threatening stiff sanctions on its banking, energy and defense industries and sovereign debt.

Headline: U.S. House condemns Trump's courtroom efforts to end Obamacare
Article: Calling it an effort to take away Americans' healthcare, the U.S. House of Representatives voted Wednesday to condemn the Trump administration's courtroom bid to eliminate Obamacare.

Headline: Trump will meet with Chinese vice premier on Thursday: White House
Article: President Donald Trump will meet on Thursday with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He, who is in Washington for trade talks, according to Trump's schedule released by the White House on Wednesday night.

Headline: Some in Mueller's team see report as more damaging to Trump than Barr summary: NY Times
Article: Some of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigators have told associates that the findings of their probe are more damaging for President Donald Trump than Attorney General William Barr indicated in his four-page summary, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Wall-weary U.S. Republicans pivot toward immigrant deportations
Article: The Trump administration and Republicans in the U.S. Congress, unable to fully fund a U.S.-Mexico border wall, are refocusing their immigration agenda on a proposal for simpler, faster deportations of undocumented children and families from Central America.

Headline: USDA has stressed importance of U.S.- Mexico trade flows to White House: official
Article: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has been making sure to bring information to the White House on the importance of two-way trade between the United States and Mexico, an official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Truckers, stores on U.S.-Mexico border struggle as Trump closure threat looms
Article: Trucks inched through traffic and some stores reported fewer customers in U.S.-Mexico border towns on Wednesday as staffing shortages tied to a surge in asylum seekers slowed checkpoints and threats of the border closing scared away shoppers.

Headline: Colorado lawmakers pass law overhauling oil and gas drilling regulations
Article: Colorado lawmakers approved a bill on Wednesday overhauling regulations governing the state's robust oil and gas industry to prioritize public health and safety, over opposition by Republicans and industry groups.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers urge sanctions over China's treatment of Muslim minority
Article: A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday faulted the Trump administration for failing so far to impose sanctions over Chinaâ€™s alleged human rights abuses against its Muslim minority and called for punitive measures against a senior Communist Party official and Chinese companies.

Headline: U.S. senators propose more aid, international sanctions for Venezuela
Article: Keeping up pressure for political change in Venezuela, 15 U.S. senators introduced bipartisan legislation on Wednesday to provide $400 million in new aid, internationalize sanctions and ease penalties on officials who recognize a new government.

Headline: U.S. VP Pence warns Turkey against buying Russian air defenses
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence warned Turkey on Wednesday against buying a Russian S-400 anti-missile system, keeping up the pressure on its NATO ally to abandon the purchase that Washington considers a threat to U.S. military equipment.

Headline: NATO chief warns of Russia threat, urges unity in U.S. address
Article: The head of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization warned the U.S. Congress on Wednesday of the threat posed by "a more assertive Russia," including a massive military buildup, threats to sovereign states, the use of nerve agents and cyberattacks.

Headline: U.S. Democrat O'Rourke raised $9.4 million in first weeks of campaign
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential hopeful Beto O'Rourke raised $9.4 million in the first 18 days of his bid for the presidency, his campaign announced on Wednesday.

Headline: U.S. states sue to undo Trump rollback of healthy school lunch rules
Article: Several U.S. states sued the Trump administration on Wednesday to undo its recent decision that allowed fewer whole grains and more sodium in school breakfasts and lunches.

Headline: O'Rourke backs reparations study as 2020 Democrats appeal to black activists
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential contender Beto O'Rourke told a conference of black activists on Wednesday that he would back a study of reparations for descendants of slaves, as 2020 White House candidates began to make their pitch for African-American support.

Headline: Democrat-led House panel subpoenas ex-White House security chief in security clearance probe
Article: A Democratic-led congressional committee voted on Tuesday to subpoena a former White House security clearance chief over whistleblower allegations that the Trump administration inappropriately reversed career officials' decisions to deny security clearances to some of the president's advisers.

Headline: Kudlow says working on rescue, restructuring plan for Venezuela
Article: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Wednesday said the United States has plans to rapidly revitalize the Venezuelan economy, including financial and food planning as well as getting cash to people in the country.

Headline: White House's Kudlow: Any border closing must balance trade, security
Article: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow on Wednesday said both trade and security were essential as the Trump administration considers how it might make good on U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to shutter the U.S. border with Mexico.

Headline: Newcomer Mayor Lori Lightfoot takes on Chicago establishment and 'political machine'
Article: Chicago, known for its machine politics and corruption, woke up Wednesday to voters choosing an anti-establishment candidate who may shake up a city that made history by electing its first African-American woman for mayor.

Headline: Trump takes shot at Biden over kiss complaint
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump took a shot on Tuesday at former Vice President Joe Biden, a possible Democratic rival in the 2020 race for the White House, mocking him over allegations of unwanted physical contact with women.

Headline: Chicago makes history electing Lori Lightfoot as first black woman mayor
Article: Lori Lightfoot, a political newcomer, was elected the first black female mayor of Chicago on Tuesday, defeating opponent Toni Preckwinkle by a landslide in a runoff to take over a city struggling with crime and weak finances.

Headline: Trump steps back from Mexico border threat as companies warn of economic fallout
Article: President Donald Trump took a step back on Tuesday from his threat to close the U.S. southern border to fight illegal immigration, as pressure mounted from companies worried that a shutdown would cause chaos to supply chains.

Headline: Truckers gridlocked at U.S.-Mexico line as border agents moved
Article: Trucks delivering goods from Mexico to the United States are facing up to 12 hours of gridlock, drivers said, after a transfer of U.S. border agents to immigration duties slowed the flow of commercial traffic at several border crossings.

Headline: Democrats mock Trump over healthcare delay ahead of 2020 election battle
Article: Democrats mocked President Donald Trump on Tuesday for pushing back his promise of sweeping healthcare reform until after the 2020 election, and said they were happy to make it a central campaign issue.

Headline: North Carolina Republican Party chairman charged in bribery case
Article: The U.S. Justice Department said on Tuesday it had charged the chairman of the North Carolina Republican Party, Robert "Robin" Hayes, and a major political donor in a corruption scheme that targeted a state official.

Headline: Former intelligence officials sue to end pre-publication review of writings
Article: Two civil liberties groups on Tuesday sued three U.S. intelligence chiefs and the acting defense secretary, seeking to have declared unconstitutional their agencies' pre-publication reviews of former officials' writings and speeches.

Headline: Trump says he's prepared to close Mexico border if necessary
Article: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he was prepared to close the U.S. southern border if necessary but that Mexico has apprehended thousands of people in recent days and its actions have made a big difference in the immigration situation.

Headline: U.S. senators seek details on nuclear power cooperation with Saudi Arabia
Article: U.S. senators from both parties on Tuesday asked Energy Secretary Rick Perry for details about recent approvals for companies to share nuclear energy information with Saudi Arabia, with the lawmakers expressing concern about possible development of atomic weapons.

Headline: U.S. expects to resolve spat with Turkey over purchase of Russian air defenses
Article: Acting U.S. Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan on Tuesday said he expected to resolve a dispute with Turkey over its planned purchase of Russia's S-400 air defense system, a day after the Pentagon halted delivery of equipment related to F-35 fighter jets to Ankara.

Headline: Whistleblower says Ivanka, Jared got security clearance over experts' advice
Article: A White House whistleblower has said the Trump administration overruled security experts to give questionable security clearances to more than two dozen people, including the president's daughter Ivanka and son-in-law Jared Kushner.

Headline: Trump administration stands behind Fed nominee Moore: aide
Article: The Trump administration is maintaining support for prospective Federal Reserve nominee Stephen Moore following reports the conservative commentator has had legal problems, a White House adviser said on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. State Department engaging with Congress on Trump's Central American aid cutoff
Article: The U.S. State Department is engaging with Congress over President Donald Trump's order to end aid payments to three Central American countries, State Department spokesman Robert Palladino said on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. Senate Republican leader says closing Mexico border could be catastrophic
Article: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said closing the U.S. border with Mexico could have devastating economic consequences, and joined his Democratic colleagues in warning President Donald Trump against such a move.

Headline: McConnell told Trump: Senate won't do comprehensive healthcare bill
Article: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday he told President Donald Trump the Senate would not be doing a comprehensive healthcare bill, even as Trump has sought to revive healthcare as an issue for the 2020 campaign.

Headline: Second woman says ex-VP Biden touched her inappropriately
Article: A Connecticut woman said Joe Biden touched her inappropriately and rubbed noses with her at a 2009 political fundraiser, becoming the second person in three days to accuse the former vice president of unwanted physical contact as he considers a White House run.

Headline: Bernie Sanders raises $18.2 million for White House run, takes fundraising lead
Article: Presidential contender Bernie Sanders raised $18.2 million in the first three months of the year for his 2020 White House bid, his campaign said on Tuesday, giving him an early fundraising lead in a crowded Democratic primary field.

Headline: Trump says vote on healthcare can wait until after 2020 election
Article: (This April 1 story was refiled to add dropped word in paragraph 6)

Headline: Top House Democrat cites labor, enforcement concerns on new NAFTA
Article: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Tuesday lawmakers could not take up the replacement for the North American Free Trade Agreement unless Mexico passes legislation protecting workers' rights.

Headline: Avenatti proclaims innocence in 'David versus Goliaths' court fight
Article: Attorney Michael Avenatti made a brief appearance in federal court in California on Monday, proclaiming his innocence on the courthouse steps as he was jeered by onlookers.

Headline: U.S. disaster aid won't cover crops drowned by Midwest floods
Article: The Black Hawk military helicopter flew over Iowa, giving a senior U.S. agriculture official and U.S. senator an eyeful of the flood damage below, where yellow corn from ruptured metal silos spilled out into the muddy water.

Headline: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders against increasing number of Supreme Court justices
Article: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders is against expanding the nine-member Supreme Court, a proposal some liberal activists have advocated to effectively reverse President Donald Trump's appointment of conservative judges.

Headline: Disaster aid bill stalls in U.S. Congress over Puerto Rico
Article: A major disaster relief bill stalled on Monday in the U.S. Congress amid a political debate over aid for Puerto Rico, with President Donald Trump and his fellow Republicans resisting Democrats' insistence the island receive additional assistance.

Headline: Two Republican attorneys general urge court to uphold Obamacare
Article: Two Republican state attorneys general on Monday urged a federal appeals court to uphold the Obamacare federal healthcare law, saying that striking it down would be disruptive for patients, doctors, insurers and employers.

Headline: Senior U.S. House Republican questions Trump plan to cut Central American aid
Article: The top Republican on the U.S. House of Representatives Foreign Affairs Committee said on Monday that cutting aid to El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras would make the situation there worse, not better, a sign that President Donald Trump will face bipartisan objections in Congress as he pursues the plan.

Headline: Trump administration steps up effort to return asylum seekers to Mexico
Article: The Trump administration is intensifying measures to curb the flow of Central American asylum seekers crossing into the United States from Mexico, officials said on Monday, including sending more people back to Mexico to wait for their asylum claims to be heard by U.S. courts.

Headline: Democratic hopeful Harris raises $12 million, Buttigieg pulls in $7 million
Article: Candidates vying for the Democratic nomination to be U.S. president began on Monday to disclose how much cash they were able to raise in the first quarter of the year - an early test of their ability to organize and build support.

Headline: Chicago police call for state's attorney to resign in Smollett controversy
Article: Protesting Chicago police officers on Monday called for Cook County Stateâ€™s Attorney Kim Foxx to resign after her office dropped felony charges against actor Jussie Smollett last week related to allegations that he staged a phony hate crime.

Headline: U.S. lawmaker invites Mexico president to Congress after migration talks
Article: U.S. Representative Eliot Engel invited Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Monday to visit the House Foreign Affairs Committee in Washington, following a meeting with him and other lawmakers in Mexico City.

Headline: Officials puzzle over U.S. aid cuts to Central America
Article: People inside and outside the Trump administration scrambled on Monday to figure out what aid it plans to cut from three Central American nations and how that is a good idea given that much of the money aims to curb migration.

Headline: U.S. House Judiciary Committee poised to subpoena full Mueller report
Article: The Democratic-led U.S. House Judiciary Committee said it will vote on Wednesday on whether to authorize subpoenas to obtain Special Counsel Robert Mueller's full report investigating Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election.

Headline: Trump declares U.S. census 'meaningless' without citizenship question
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday injected himself into one of the most consequential cases of the current Supreme Court term, saying the nation's 2020 census would be "meaningless" without adding a citizenship question to the questionnaire.

Headline: May 23, 2018, story based on BBC report about Ukrainian president and Trump lawyer Cohen is withdrawn
Article: A May 23, 2018, story headlined, â€œUkraine paid Trump lawyer Cohen to arrange White House talks -BBC,â€ is being withdrawn after the BBC said its report was incorrect.

Headline: Ex-U.S. Vice President Biden denies inappropriate conduct over alleged kiss
Article: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden said on Sunday he believed he had never acted inappropriately following allegations by a female activist that he made her feel uncomfortable by kissing her at a campaign event in 2014.

Headline: Trump cuts aid to Central American countries as migrant crisis deepens
Article: The U.S. government cut aid to El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras on Saturday after President Donald Trump blasted the Central American countries for sending migrants to the United States and threatened to shutter the U.S.-Mexico border.

Headline: O'Rourke holds rally near Mexican border that Trump threatens to shut
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke held a major rally in El Paso, Texas, on Saturday, a city thrust to the center of America's immigration debate by President Donald Trump and the U.S government this week.

Headline: U.S. ending aid to El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras over migrants
Article: The United States is cutting off aid to El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras, known collectively as the "Northern Triangle," the State Department said on Saturday, a day after President Donald Trump blasted the Central American countries for sending migrants to the United States.

Headline: Ex-vice president Biden doesn't recall inappropriate kiss alleged by activist: spokesman
Article: A spokesman for Joe Biden said the former vice president does not recall an incident in 2014 when a female activist said he inappropriately kissed her, but some of his potential rivals for the Democratic nomination said on Saturday they believe his accuser.

Headline: Exclusive: More than 1 million acres of U.S. cropland ravaged by floods
Article: At least 1 million acres (405,000 hectares) of U.S. farmland were flooded after the "bomb cyclone" storm left wide swaths of nine major grain producing states under water this month, satellite data analyzed by Gro Intelligence for Reuters showed.

Headline: U.S. Rep. Ocasio-Cortez 'encouraged' despite Senate rejecting 'Green New Deal'
Article: U.S. Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez said on Friday she was "very encouraged" by the Senate vote this week on the "Green New Deal," the sweeping climate policy resolution she introduced last month, even though the Senate defeated it.

Headline: Exclusive: With a piece of paper, Trump called on Kim to hand over nuclear weapons
Article: On the day that their talks in Hanoi collapsed last month, U.S. President Donald Trump handed North Korean leader Kim Jong Un a piece of paper that included a blunt call for the transfer of Pyongyang's nuclear weapons and bomb fuel to the United States, according to the document seen by Reuters.

Headline: Mueller report on Trump and Russia to be made public by mid-April: Barr
Article: U.S. Attorney General William Barr plans to make public a redacted copy of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's nearly 400-page investigative report into Russian interference in the 2016 election by mid-April, "if not sooner," he said in a letter to lawmakers on Friday.

Headline: U.S. House Republican says it would be illegal to release full Mueller report
Article: The top Republican on the U.S. House Judiciary Committee said on Friday that Attorney General William Barr would "break the law" if he released Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia report without redactions, as Democrats are demanding.

Headline: Trump threatens closure of U.S.-Mexico border next week to stem asylum surge
Article: President Donald Trump threatened on Friday to close the U.S. border with Mexico next week, potentially disrupting millions of legal border crossings and billions of dollars in trade, if Mexico does not stop immigrants from reaching the United States.

Headline: Georgia lawmakers pass heartbeat abortion ban, joining four other U.S. states
Article: Georgia's Republican-controlled legislature on Friday passed one of the most restrictive abortion laws in the United States, outlawing abortion if a doctor is able to detect a heartbeat.

Headline: Republicans push easing U.S. Senate rules to help Trump nominations
Article: Republicans in the U.S. Senate will attempt to alter its rules next week in order to accelerate the confirmation of President Donald Trump's nominees for some judgeships and sub-Cabinet level positions in his administration.

Headline: Nadler says Mueller report should be released to Congress without redactions
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Judiciary Committee Chairman Jerry Nadler said on Friday that Attorney General William Barr should send Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia report to Congress without redactions.

Headline: Exclusive: Trump eager for trade deal with post-Brexit Britain - Bolton to Reuters TV
Article: White House national security adviser John Bolton said on Friday that President Donald Trump is eager for a U.S. trade deal with Britain once it breaks away from the European Union.

Headline: Exclusive: Trump eyeing stepped-up Venezuela sanctions for foreign companies - Bolton
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump is considering imposing sanctions on companies from other countries that do business with Venezuela to cut off revenues to President Nicolas Maduro, Trump's national security adviser John Bolton told Reuters TV on Friday.

Headline: Small Business Administration chief McMahon to join Trump 2020 campaign
Article: Linda McMahon is resigning her post as director of the Small Business Administration and will join U.S. President Donald Trump's 2020 re-election campaign, the Republican president said on Friday.

Headline: Trump says it is very likely he'll close border with Mexico
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday there was a very good chance he would close the border with Mexico next week as he seeks to stem a tide of illegal immigration into the United States.

Headline: After Trump border threat, Mexico says doesn't act on threats
Article: Mexican Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard said on Twitter on Friday that Mexico does not act on the basis of threats after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to close the U.S.-Mexico border if Mexico does not stop illegal immigration.

Headline: Trump says he could close border with Mexico to trade
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he could close the border with Mexico to trade if Mexico did not stop migrant caravans from reaching the United States and that he would keep the border closed for a long time.

Headline: Trump to host Egypt's Sisi on April 9: White House
Article: President Donald Trump will host Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi at the White House on April 9 for talks on strengthening their strategic partnership and working on shared priorities in the Middle East, the White House said on Friday.

Headline: O'Rourke to rally in his native Texas, where tough 2020 presidential primary awaits
Article: Democratic presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke will hold campaign rallies on Saturday in his home state of Texas, where he faces far different challenges in the 2020 race from those of his underdog U.S. Senate run in 2018.

Headline: At rally, Trump says Russia probe backers tried to steal power illegally
Article: At his first political rally since the end of the Russia collusion probe, President Donald Trump on Thursday accused backers of the investigation of trying to overturn the 2016 election and attempting "illegally" to claim power.

Headline: Trump overrides advisers, backs funding for Special Olympics after uproar
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump overrode his budget team and backed funding for the Special Olympics on Thursday after his proposed cuts to the athletic program drew heavy fire from both Republicans and Democrats.

Headline: Southeast Asia should be aware of Iran's tactics to evade oil sanctions: U.S.
Article: The United States is keen to see that Malaysia, Singapore and others are fully aware of illicit Iranian oil shipments and the tactics Iran uses to evade sanctions, a top U.S. sanctions official said on Friday.

Headline: Trump changes mind and extends Liberians' immigration protections in U.S
Article: President Donald Trump on Thursday extended an immigration designation granting protected status to Liberians in the United States for an additional year, just three days before it was to expire, a rare move from a president who has taken a hardline stance on immigration.

Headline: Two California Supreme Court justices decry death penalty as 'dysfunctional'
Article: Two members of California's highest court issued a scathing critique of capital punishment on Thursday, branding it an "expensive and dysfunctional system" that fails to deliver timely justice.

Headline: Trump, South Korea's Moon to meet on April 10 in Washington: Yonhap
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump and South Korean President Moon Jae-in will meet in Washington on April 10, Yonhap news agency said on Friday, citing the South Korean presidential office.

Headline: 'Hoarder' pleads guilty in one of biggest breaches of U.S. secrets
Article: A former U.S. National Security Agency contractor, portrayed as an eccentric hoarder by his lawyers, pleaded guilty in a Baltimore, Maryland court on Thursday to stealing classified documents in a deal likely to put him in prison for nine years.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers grill Trump's Interior Dept pick on oil drilling, ethics
Article: President Donald Trump's pick to run the U.S. Department of Interior, a former energy lobbyist, faced tough questions during his Senate confirmation hearing on Thursday about potential conflicts of interest and the administration's unpopular plan to expand offshore oil drilling.

Headline: Trump weighs in on Smollett case as Chicago demands reimbursement
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday the Department of Justice would "review" the uproar surrounding actor Jussie Smollett, who was charged with staging a fake hate-crime attack on himself in Chicago before prosecutors abruptly dropped the case this week.

Headline: Trump's pick for No. 3 Justice Department post withdraws after Republican objects
Article: President Donald Trump's pick to serve as the third-ranking official in the U.S. Justice Department, Jessie Liu, withdrew from consideration on Thursday after at least one Republican lawmaker objected to her past involvement with a women's legal group, a spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. energy secretary unsure if Saudi nuclear approvals came after Khashoggi killing
Article: U.S. Energy Secretary Rick Perry told lawmakers on Thursday he did not know whether any of the approvals he authorized for U.S. companies to sell nuclear power technology to Saudi Arabia were made after the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in October last year.

Headline: Trump, allies tangle with key Democrat; Mueller report is 300 pages
Article: President Donald Trump's Republican allies tangled with one of Trump's most prominent Democratic critics during a chaotic congressional hearing on Thursday and the U.S. attorney general revealed that Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia inquiry report is more than 300 pages long.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers introduce bill to stop NSA's mass data collection
Article: Republican and Democratic U.S. lawmakers introduced a bill on Thursday that would end the collection of Americans' phone records by the National Security Agency in an effort to undo a widely criticized security measure passed in the wake of the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks.

Headline: U.S. senators introduce bill to stop transfer of F-35 fighters to Turkey
Article: Four U.S. senators on Thursday introduced a bipartisan bill to prohibit the transfer of F-35 fighter aircraft to Turkey until the U.S. government certifies that Ankara will not take delivery of a Russian S-400 air defense system, a statement on the move said.

Headline: U.S. Supreme Court rebuffs bid to block Trump's gun 'bump stock' ban
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday handed President Donald Trump a victory by rejecting for the second time in three days a bid by gun rights activists to block his new ban on "bump stock" attachments that enable semi-automatic weapons to fire rapidly.

Headline: Trump's Fed pick advocates return to a 'rule' that may never have existed
Article: In the op-ed column that may vault think tank analyst Stephen Moore to a spot on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, he argues the Fed could have skirted recent rate hikes and dodged a wave of criticism by tying monetary policy to commodity prices.

Headline: Trump adviser Jared Kushner meets Senate intelligence panel for second time: sources
Article: President Donald Trump's son-in-law and adviser Jared Kushner on Thursday appeared at a closed door meeting of the U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee for the second time, four congressional sources said.

Headline: U.S. offshore drilling proposal not complete, timing unclear: Acting Interior Secretary
Article: The Interior Department's final proposal to expand offshore oil drilling is not yet complete, and the timing for its release is unclear, Acting Interior Secretary David Bernhardt told a panel of lawmakers on Thursday.

Headline: Factbox: Big Democratic field taking shape for 2020 U.S. presidential race
Article: A crowded field of fresh faces and veteran U.S. lawmakers has lined up to seek the Democratic Party's 2020 presidential nomination.

Headline: Suburban Florida mayor announces Democratic bid for U.S. presidency
Article: A little-known mayor of a Miami suburb announced his bid to become president of the United States on Thursday, joining an already crowded field of Democratic candidates vying to become the party's nominee in 2020.

Headline: Bill to let banks work with cannabis companies advances in U.S. House
Article: A U.S. congressional panel advanced legislation Thursday that would allow banks to provide services to cannabis companies in states where it is legal.

Headline: U.S. presidential candidate Klobuchar calls for trillion-dollar infrastructure plan
Article: U.S. Democratic presidential contender Amy Klobuchar presented a trillion-dollar plan on Thursday to fix the country's roads, bridges and other public works that she said would be her top budget priority if elected.

Headline: Exclusive: Fearful of fake news blitz, U.S. Census enlists help of tech giants
Article: The U.S. Census Bureau has asked tech giants Google, Facebook and Twitter to help it fend off â€œfake news" campaigns it fears could disrupt the upcoming 2020 count, according to Census officials and multiple sources briefed on the matter.

Headline: Trump discusses China, 'political fairness' with Google CEO
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he met with the chief executive of Alphabet Inc's Google on Wednesday and discussed "political fairness" and the company's business in China.

Headline: Trump-Russia probe is over, but prosecutor says grand jury lives on
Article: Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. election has ended, but the grand jury that he convened to examine the issue is still alive and well, a federal prosecutor said in court on Wednesday.

Headline: U.S. judge blocks Medicaid work requirements in Kentucky, Arkansas
Article: A federal judge on Wednesday overturned the Trump administration's approval of plans by Kentucky and Arkansas to impose work requirements on people seeking Medicaid health insurance benefits.

Headline: Trump requests reform plans for Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac
Article: President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Wednesday directing federal agencies to develop a plan to overhaul the U.S. housing finance system, the White House said.

Headline: U.S. isolated at U.N. Security Council over Golan decision
Article: The United States was isolated at the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday over President Donald Trump's decision to recognize Israel's sovereignty over the Golan Heights as the other countries on the council opposed the move.

Headline: Democrats pounce as Trump administration ratchets up attack on Obamacare
Article: Top congressional Democrats on Tuesday attacked a legal move by the Trump administration to step up its assault on the Obamacare healthcare law, saying last November's elections showed Americans want them to protect the Affordable Care Act.

Headline: Nadler says Barr may miss Democrats' April 2 deadline for Mueller report
Article: U.S. House Judiciary Committee Chairman Jerry Nadler said on Wednesday he was very concerned that Attorney General William Barr might not submit Special Counsel Robert Mueller's Russia report to Congress by April 2 as Democrats have demanded.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers squabble over demand for Trump financial records
Article: A request by a leading Democrat for records of Donald Trump's financial dealings before he became president set off a partisan squabble in the U.S. House of Representatives on Wednesday.

Headline: Despite Congress' ire, Pentagon to transfer $1 billion for Trump wall
Article: Acting U.S. Defense Secretary Patrick Shanahan said on Wednesday he would push ahead with plans to transfer $1 billion to help fund President Donald Trump's wall on the U.S. border with Mexico, even as he acknowledged a likely backlash from Congress.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers blast Trump's plan for diplomatic, foreign aid cuts
Article: Democrats and Republicans in the U.S. Congress rejected President Donald Trump's proposed cuts to diplomacy and foreign aid budgets as dangerous to national security on Wednesday, setting the stage for a budget battle with the White House.

Headline: U.S. recognition of Golan Heights as Israeli will help peace process: Pompeo
Article: The Trump administration's decision to recognize Israel's sovereignty over the Golan Heights will help resolve the Israeli-Palestinian conflict by removing uncertainty, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump says he can produce a better healthcare plan than Obamacare
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump pledged on Wednesday to deliver a better healthcare system than Obamacare if the Supreme Court tosses out his predecessor's signature domestic achievement, a potentially hazardous claim as he seeks re-election.

Headline: Pompeo: sees joint action with NATO allies next week on Ukraine
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday he hoped to announce with NATO allies visiting Washington next week additional steps to push back on Russia over its aggression in Ukraine.

Headline: U.S. Senate Republicans defeat Green New Deal resolution
Article: Senate Republicans on Tuesday defeated the "Green New Deal" resolution that called for tackling climate change by moving the United States off fossil fuels, while Democrats said the vote was a political stunt on an issue that will rise in importance.

Headline: Republicans defeat Green New Deal in U.S. Senate vote Democrats call a stunt
Article: U.S. Senate Republicans on Tuesday defeated the "Green New Deal" resolution that called for tackling climate change by moving the United States off fossil fuels, while Democrats said the vote was a political stunt on an issue that will not die.

Headline: Democratic presidential candidate Gillibrand releases tax returns in challenge to rivals
Article: Democratic U.S. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand's presidential campaign on Wednesday released her tax returns for the years 2007 through 2018, offering the most comprehensive look to date at the finances of a 2020 White House candidate's finances, as she called on her rivals to do the same.

Headline: Democratic White House contender Warren targets corporate agriculture
Article: Democratic presidential contender Elizabeth Warren took aim on Wednesday at agricultural conglomerates, promising her administration would break up big agribusiness mergers that she said have hurt family farmers.

Headline: The Mueller interview that wasn't: how Trump's legal strategy paid off
