Article: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Thursday said he had called on two key Senate panels to recommend additional action aimed at preventing future election meddling by Russia as well as hold hearings on Russia sanctions law.

Headline: Putin accuses U.S. forces of trying to ruin Trump summit outcome
Article: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday accused forces in the United States of trying to undermine the success of his first summit with U.S. President Donald Trump, but said the two leaders had begun to improve U.S.-Russia ties anyway.

Headline: White House struggles to contain political outcry over Trump-Putin summit
Article: The White House struggled on Wednesday to contain a political outcry and confusion over U.S. President Donald Trump's summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin, denying Trump ever meant to say that Moscow was no longer targeting the United States.

Headline: Putin warns that U.S.-Russia nuclear treaty will expire unless action taken
Article: President Vladimir Putin warned of the dangers of Moscow and Washington failing to mend ties on Thursday, saying the START strategic arms reduction treaty would expire in a year and a half unless work on extending it started now.

Headline: U.S. judge orders accused Russian agent jailed pending trial
Article: A judge on Wednesday ordered an accused Russian agent jailed until her trial after U.S. prosecutors argued she has ties to Russian intelligence and could flee the United States.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 18): Putin, NATO
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: White House weighs Putin proposal on questioning U.S. officials
Article: The White House on Wednesday declined to rule out accepting a Russian proposal for the questioning in the United States of Americans sought by the Kremlin for "illegal activities," including a former U.S. ambassador to Moscow.

Headline: U.S. Interior watchdog probes Zinke over real estate deal
Article: The U.S. Interior Department's watchdog said in a letter to lawmakers on Wednesday that it was investigating a Montana real estate deal involving a foundation set up by Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke and a development group backed by the chairman of oil service company Halliburton.

Headline: California high court orders proposal to split up state removed from November ballot
Article: The California Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered the November ballot purged of an initiative that seeks to split California into three states, citing significant questions raised about the proposal's validity.

Headline: Trump says he accepts DNI Coats' view that Russia meddling continues
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a television interview on Wednesday he accepted Director of National Intelligence Dan Coats' assessment that Russia continues to be a threat to U.S. elections.

Headline: Judge denies Manafort's request to suppress evidence
Article: A federal judge on Wednesday denied a request by President Donald Trump's former campaign manager Paul Manafort to suppress evidence seized by the FBI from his home as part of Special Counsel Robert Mueller's ongoing probe into whether Trump's 2016 presidential campaign colluded with Russia.

Headline: New York governor opens door to criminal case against Trump Foundation
Article: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on Wednesday opened the door to a possible criminal case against the Donald J. Trump Foundation, but the state attorney general's office said it had not determined that a criminal referral was warranted.

Headline: Trump says he holds Putin personally responsible for election meddling
Article: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he holds Russian President Vladimir Putin personally responsible for Russia's meddling in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: Senate, after Helsinki, eyes swift sanctions in case of more election meddling
Article: Sanctions targeting key Russian economic sectors would kick in swiftly if U.S. authorities determined the Kremlin had meddled again in a U.S. election, under a bill gaining momentum in the Senate on Wednesday.

Headline: States sue U.S. over policy tying funds to immigration compliance
Article: New York and five other states filed a lawsuit on Wednesday seeking to block the Trump administration from making cooperation with federal immigration authorities a condition for receiving millions of dollars in federal funding for law enforcement.

Headline: U.S. judge orders accused Russian agent Butina jailed
Article: A U.S. judge ordered accused Russian agent Maria Butina jailed on Wednesday pending trial after federal prosecutors warned that she has ties to Russian intelligence and was a flight risk.

Headline: White House denies Trump said Russia no longer targeting U.S.
Article: The White House denied that U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Russia was no longer targeting the United States, saying his answer "no" was about taking questions not about potential interference in U.S. elections.

Headline: Cuomo widens poll lead over Nixon in New York governor race
Article: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo widened his lead over Cynthia Nixon, an actress and activist running to his left in the Democratic gubernatorial primary election in September, according to a Quinnipiac University poll released on Wednesday.

Headline: Senate Democrats warn of 'gigantic loopholes' in Trump tax cuts
Article: U.S. Senate Democrats on Wednesday lashed out at Republican President Donald Trump's tax overhaul of December 2017, warning that it contains "gigantic loopholes" that could encourage companies to move plants and jobs abroad.

Headline: Trump expects 'big results,' including North Korea, after Putin summit
Article: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday his meeting with Vladimir Putin would lead to "big results," in a continuing bid to calm a storm over his failure to criticize the Russian leader for Moscow's actions to undermine the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Trump says Russia is no longer targeting U.S.
Article: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he does not believe Russia is still targeting the United States, contradicting U.S. intelligence assessments that Moscow was continuing its attempts to meddle in American elections.

Headline: Former FBI Director Comey on Twitter: vote Democratic
Article: Former FBI Director James Comey, a longtime Republican who has clashed with President Donald Trump over the federal Russia probe, urged Americans to vote for Democrats in November congressional elections.

Headline: Trump, seeking to calm political storm over Putin summit, says he misspoke
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump tried on Tuesday to calm a storm over his failure to hold Russian President Vladimir Putin accountable for meddling in the 2016 U.S. election, saying he misspoke in a joint news conference in Helsinki.

Headline: Russia says no grounds for arrest in U.S. of suspected Russian agent: RIA
Article: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday the arrest in the United States of a 29-year-old woman accused of being a Russian agent was carried out to spoil the positive impact of Monday's Russia-U.S. summit in Helsinki, RIA news agency reported.

Headline: Alabama Republican who once spurned Trump wins runoff election
Article: U.S. Representative Martha Roby, an Alabama Republican who spurned Donald Trump in the 2016 presidential race, has decisively won a runoff election against a former Democrat-turned-Trump supporter.

Headline: Germany on Helsinki summit: Dialogue is best way to solve problems
Article: Germany welcomed this week's summit in Finland between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, with a government spokesman saying talking is the best way to overcome differences.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 17): NATO, Putin
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: House passes bipartisan package on easing capital markets rule
Article: The House of Representatives voted 406-4 on Tuesday to pass legislation easing rules for small businesses and entrepreneurs in an overwhelmingly bipartisan vote that could boost support for the package among Democrats in the Senate.

Headline: Judge denies motion by Trump ex-campaign chief to move Virginia trial
Article: A federal judge in Virginia on Tuesday denied a motion by former Trump campaign manager Paul Manafort to move a trial set to start next week from the Washington suburb of Alexandria to the city of Roanoke, Virginia.

Headline: Exclusive: Trump's defense chief open to first talks with Russian counterpart - sources
Article: U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis is open to the possibility of the first talks since 2015 between the defense chiefs of the United States and Russia, a move that would deepen communication between Washington and Moscow, U.S. officials said.

Headline: Trump says he, Putin discussed North Korea, curbing global nuclear weapons
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he discussed North Korea's nuclear weapons program with Russian President Vladimir Putin in their meeting on Monday, and that the two leaders also discussed reducing nuclear weapons worldwide.

Headline: Rebuking Trump's embrace of Putin, U.S. lawmakers look to punish Russia
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump faced outrage on Tuesday for his failure to hold Russia accountable for meddling in the 2016 U.S. election, and some U.S. lawmakers threatened action in Congress to punish Moscow and show support for U.S. intelligence agencies.

Headline: Senate Republican leader warns Russia not to meddle in 2018 elections
Article: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday the chamber could consider new sanctions against Russia and warned Russia not to meddle in the U.S. mid-term elections in November.

Headline: Trump, House Republicans discuss further tax cuts at White House
Article: President Donald Trump and Republican U.S. lawmakers on Tuesday discussed another possible round of deficit-financed tax cuts, highlighting an initiative seen by some tax experts as an election-year effort with little chance of becoming law.

Headline: Social media companies defend filtering practices before Congress
Article: Facebook Inc , Alphabet Inc and Twitter Inc told a U.S. House panel on Tuesday that the social media companies are not discriminating against content for political reasons.

Headline: Jury convicts ex-N.Y. state senate leader of soliciting bribes
Article: Former New York State Senate majority leader Dean Skelos was found guilty of soliciting bribes and other federal corruption charges by a jury on Tuesday, nearly a year after an appeals court threw out an earlier conviction.

Headline: Trump to speak about Putin meeting at 2 p.m. EDT (1800 GMT): White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will make remarks about his meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin at 2 p.m. EDT (1800 GMT) on Tuesday before his planned meeting with members of Congress, White House spokeswoman Sarah Sanders said.

Headline: U.S. move to protect 'dark money' donors raises Russia concerns
Article: A U.S. Treasury Department decision to safeguard the identities of so-called "dark money" donors to politically active nonprofit groups spawned warnings on Tuesday that the policy could inadvertently aid foreign actors, including Russia.

Headline: Mike Pompeo to testify on Russia next week: Senate panel chair
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will testify before Congress to discuss Russia next week, the Republican chair of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee told reporters on Tuesday.

Headline: Russian establishment chalks up Trump summit as a win for Putin
Article: Russia's political and media establishment heralded talks between the Russian and U.S. leaders in Helsinki as a victory for Vladimir Putin in breaking down Western resolve to treat Russia as a pariah.

Headline: House may consider new sanctions on Russia: Speaker Ryan
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan on Tuesday said he is willing to consider additional sanctions on Russia, and reiterated his support for U.S. intelligence community findings that Russia interfered in the 2016 election.

Headline: Trump to host European Commission chief on July 25
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will host the head of the European Commission at the White House later this month to discuss trade and other economic issues, the White House said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headline: UK PM May's spokesman says Trump's meeting with Putin does not undermine transatlantic alliance
Article: A spokesman for British Prime Minister Theresa May said the outcome of President Donald Trump's meeting with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in Helsinki on Monday does not undermine the strength of the transatlantic alliance.

Headline: House Republican backs effort to restore net neutrality rules
Article: A Republican in the U.S. House of Representatives said on Tuesday he will back an uphill battle to try to force a vote to restore net neutrality rules that were overturned by the Trump administration.

Headline: Trump backs Putin on election meddling at summit, stirs fierce criticism
Article: Standing side by side with Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump refused on Monday to blame the Russian leader for meddling in the 2016 U.S. election, casting doubt on the findings of his own intelligence agencies and sparking a storm of criticism at home.

Headline: U.S. judge suspends deportations of reunited immigrant families
Article: A federal judge temporarily barred the U.S. government on Monday from the rapid deportation of immigrant parents reunited with their children, while a court considers the impact on children's rights to seek asylum.

Headline: U.S. Treasury moves to protect identities of 'dark money' political donors
Article: The U.S. Treasury said on Monday that it will no longer require certain tax-exempt organizations including politically active nonprofit groups, such as the National Rifle Association and Planned Parenthood, to identify their financial donors to U.S. tax authorities.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers condemn Trump over Helsinki summit with Putin
Article: A wave of condemnation by U.S. lawmakers from both Republican and Democratic parties followed President Donald Trump's failure at a Helsinki summit to warn Russian President Vladimir Putin about meddling in the 2016 U.S. election.

Headline: Top Senate Democrat urges sanctions, hearings after Trump-Putin summit
Article: U.S. Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer called for a bipartisan effort to "ratchet up" sanctions on Moscow following U.S. President Donald Trump's summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki earlier on Monday.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers slam Trump as 'weak' in Russia summit; some push new sanctions
Article: Leading U.S. lawmakers, including numerous Republicans, criticized President Donald Trump on Monday for failing to confront Russian President Vladimir Putin over Moscow's meddling in the 2016 U.S. election as the two heads of nuclear powers stood side-by-side at a joint news conference.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 16): NATO, Russian Meddling
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: U.S. politician denounces as 'sick fraud' Baron Cohen TV guns prank
Article: A Republican congressman filmed for Sacha Baron Cohen's satirical television series who appeared to back a fictitious scheme to train toddlers to use guns said on Monday that he was the victim of "a sick fraud."

Headline: Trump to meet with members of Congress after summit criticism
Article: President Donald Trump will meet with members of Congress on Tuesday, the White House said, after many lawmakers criticized his performance at a summit on Monday with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: Putin says he told Trump that Russia prepared to extend START treaty: Fox News
Article: Russian President Vladimir Putin said in an interview broadcast on Monday that he told U.S. President Donald Trump that Russia is prepared to extend the New START nuclear treaty that expires in 2021.

Headline: Mnuchin says U.S. to consider waivers on Iran sanctions
Article: The United States in certain cases will consider waivers for countries that need more time to wind down imports of oil from Iran as it seeks to avoid disrupting global oil markets while reimposing sanctions against Tehran, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said.

Headline: After pummeling allies, Trump ends wild Europe trip with Putin embrace
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's week-long adventure on the world stage in Europe came to a raucous conclusion in Helsinki on Monday, with American allies fuming and confused and Russian President Vladimir Putin literally smiling at his good fortune.

Headline: Trump, after Helsinki summit, says he has confidence in U.S. intelligence
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump, facing a barrage of criticism for his comments during a news conference in Helsinki with Russian President Vladimir Putin, insisted in a post on Twitter on Monday that he has "GREAT confidence in MY intelligence people."

Headline: House lawmakers agree on bipartisan package on capital markets rule-easing
Article: Top lawmakers in the U.S. House of Representatives on Monday said they had agreed on a bipartisan legislative package to ease rules in a bid to help Main Street companies and boost jobs.

Headline: After Helsinki, U.S. intel chief defends findings on Russian meddling
Article: The U.S. intelligence community has been clear about the threat posed by Russian political interference and will continue "to provide unvarnished and objective intelligence" assessments, the Director of National Intelligence said on Monday.

Headline: Fed's 'good place' U.S. economy heads for congressional review
Article: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell takes his upbeat view of the U.S. economy to Capitol Hill on Tuesday, with markets and many of Powell's colleagues expecting two more interest rate increases this year amid a continued economic expansion.

Headline: Senator McCain says Trump summit with Putin 'tragic mistake'
Article: Republican U.S. Senator John McCain on Monday called President Donald Trump's meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki "a tragic mistake" and a new low point for the United States, accusing the American leader of failing to defend his country.

Headline: Republican Senator Corker: Trump comments on Putin make U.S. look like 'pushover'
Article: The Republican head of the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee Bob Corker said President Donald Trump's comments at a joint news conference with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday made the United States look like a "pushover."

Headline: House speaker says Trump 'must appreciate' Russia is not an ally
Article: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan, following President Donald Trump's remarks on Russia on Monday, said there was "no question" that Moscow interfered in the U.S. 2016 election and that Trump "must appreciate that Russia is not our ally."

Headline: U.S. Rep. Schiff: Trump comments give Putin OK on 2018 interference
Article: The top Democrat on the U.S. House of Representatives intelligence panel said President Donald Trump's comments in Helsinki on Monday essentially gave Russian President Vladimir Putin permission to interfere in November's midterm election.

Headline: Highlights: Trump and Putin speak after meeting in Helsinki
Article: Donald Trump met one-on-one with Russia's Vladimir Putin behind closed doors on Monday in a long-awaited summit overshadowed by the U.S. president blaming his own country's past "foolishness and stupidity" for the two powers' hostile relations.

Headline: U.S. Senate Democratic leader: Trump 'putting himself over' U.S.
Article: U.S. Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer on Monday blasted President Donald Trump's comments at a news conference alongside Russian President Vladimir Putin, saying his actions have "strengthened our adversaries while weakening our defenses and those of our allies."

Headline: Trump stresses Israel's security in talks with Putin
Article: The United States and Russia will work together to ensure Israel's security, U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday after his meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: Comments by former clerks may backfire on Trump's high court pick
Article: When it became clear that President Donald Trump was seriously considering nominating Brett Kavanaugh to the U.S. Supreme Court, the conservative judge's former law clerks swung into action as among his most energetic public cheerleaders.

Headline: Trump says he raised question of possible Russian election meddling with Putin
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he had raised the issue of alleged Russian meddling in U.S. elections in talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday.

Headline: Trump says U.S. must find ways to cooperate with Russia
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he had productive talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin that had turned the corner on a relationship that had never been worse.

Headline: Trump says one-on-one meeting with Putin a 'good start'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump described his one-on-one meeting with Russia's Vladimir Putin as a "good start" on Monday.

Headline: Face-to-face meeting between Putin and Trump ends: Interfax
Article: A face-to-face meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump in Helsinki has ended, Russia's Interfax news agency reported.

Headline: Putin to Trump: it's time to talk about our relations
Article: Russia's Vladimir Putin told U.S. President Donald Trump at the start of their summit in Helsinki that it was time to talk about relations between Moscow and Washington.

Headline: Trump says getting along with Russia is a 'good thing not a bad thing'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that getting along with Russia would be a "good thing, not a bad thing", in opening remarks in front of media before his closed-door summit with Russia's President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: Putin lands in Helsinki later than expected for summit with Trump
Article: Russian President Vladimir Putin's plane landed in the Finnish capital Helsinki on Monday about a half hour behind schedule for his summit meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headline: Factbox: Handful of U.S. senators hold keys to Kavanaugh Supreme Court bid
Article: President Donald Trump's nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the U.S. Supreme Court is now in the hands of the Senate, where the opposing forces are clear, except for a few senators who sometimes cross party boundaries, depending on the issues.

Headline: Republicans target elections with more deficit-boosting tax cuts
Article: As November's U.S. elections approach, Republicans in the House of Representatives and the Trump administration are planning another deficit-financed tax-cut plan, but one widely seen as a vote-getting exercise with little chance of becoming law.

Headline: Trump says U.S.-Russia ties have 'never been worse'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Twitter on Monday that U.S.-Russian ties have never been worse.

Headline: Trump says Obama did nothing about Russian election meddling
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a Twitter post on Monday his predecessor, Barack Obama, paid little attention to FBI allegations of Russian election meddling and they were only taken seriously after he was elected.

Headline: Trump says NATO summit was 'truly great'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a Twitter post on Monday the NATO summit he attended last week had been a success and was inaccurately reported by much of the media.

Headline: Trump says NATO summit was 'truly great'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a Twitter post on Monday the NATO summit he attended last week had been a success and was inaccurately reported by much of the media.

Headline: Kremlin takes Trump to task over his gas pipeline comments: RIA
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's criticism of Russia's Nord Stream-2 gas pipeline to Europe is an egregious example of unscrupulous competition and it worries Moscow, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov was quoted as saying on Monday.

Headline: Trump says he will run for reelection, had Brexit chat with Queen Elizabeth
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he intends to run for re-election in 2020 because "everybody wants me to" and there are no Democratic candidates who could defeat him, the Mail on Sunday newspaper reported.

Headline: Twitter suspends two accounts linked to 12 Russians indicted by Mueller
Article: Social networking site Twitter Inc on Saturday suspended two accounts linked to 12 Russian spies indicted by Special Counsel Robert Mueller for interfering in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: Trump's ambassador lobbied Britain on behalf of jailed right-wing activist Tommy Robinson
Article: (This story fixes dateline to July 13 and typo in eighth paragraph.))

Headline: U.S. judge, Trump administration spar over immigrant child safety
Article: A U.S. judge struck back late Friday night at a Trump administration claim that speeding up the reunification of immigrant families separated at the U.S.-Mexican border would put children at risk, saying the government had either misunderstood his instructions or was "acting in defiance of them."

Headline: U.S. accuses Russian spies of 2016 election hacking as summit looms
Article: A federal grand jury charged 12 Russian intelligence officers on Friday with hacking Democratic computer networks in 2016, in the most detailed U.S. accusation yet that Moscow meddled in the presidential election to help Republican Donald Trump.

Headline: Indictment of Russian officers puts pressure on Trump at Putin summit
Article: If U.S. President Donald Trump was inclined to be tentative when raising election meddling with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday, the indictment of 12 Russian intelligence officers with hacking in 2016 has made that approach a much harder sell.

Headline: Judge tells U.S. to pay costs of reuniting immigrant families
Article: A U.S. judge in California on Friday ordered President Donald Trump's administration to pay the costs of reuniting immigrant parents with children separated from them by officials at the U.S.-Mexican border, rather than forcing the parents to pay.

Headline: Trump must demand that Putin stop Russia election meddling: Pelosi
Article: President Donald Trump must seek a deal with Russian President Vladimir Putin to end Moscow's interference in American elections, the top Democrat in the House of Representatives said on Friday after fresh indictments against Russian military officers.

Headline: Russia says U.S. indictment over election meddling is groundless
Article: Russia's foreign ministry said there was no evidence the 12 people indicted by the United States on Friday were linked to military intelligence or hacking into the computer networks of the U.S. Democratic party.

Headline: U.S. indictments show technical evidence for Russian hacking accusations
Article: U.S. indictments against a dozen Russian intelligence officers on Friday provided detailed technical evidence to back up allegations of Russian hacking and leaking of information to influence the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: White House official who favored more refugee admissions is out: sources
Article: A White House official who supported higher numbers of refugee admissions to the United States and clashed with immigration hard-liners in the Trump administration left her position on Thursday, two U.S. officials with knowledge of the departure said.

Headline: U.S. intel chief warns of devastating cyber threat to U.S. infrastructure
Article: The U.S. intelligence chief warned on Friday that the threat was growing for a devastating cyber assault on critical U.S. infrastructure, saying the "warning lights are blinking red again" nearly two decades after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 13) - Matt Gaetz, Theresa May
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: New indictments expected in Mueller special counsel probe: CNN
Article: Prosecutors for U.S. special counsel Robert Mueller visited a federal magistrate in Washington on Friday to return a grand jury indictment, CNN reported, citing an itinerary posted outside the courtroom.

Headline: Novartis disputes U.S. senators' report on Cohen contract
Article: Novartis on Friday disputed a report from Democratic U.S. senators that concluded the Swiss drugmaker misled the public about its $1.2 million contract with a former attorney for President Donald Trump.

Headline: House Republicans face off with FBI agent at raucous hearing
Article: An FBI agent who criticized Donald Trump in text messages during the 2016 campaign vigorously defended himself at a raucous congressional hearing on Thursday that highlighted the deep divisions over a probe of Russian election meddling that has clouded Trump's presidency.

Headline: Commerce Secretary Ross admits lapses in asset reporting after warning
Article: U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross on Thursday admitted ethical lapses in reporting on his financial assets and said he would sell all of his remaining stocks after a federal ethics agency warned of the "potential for a serious criminal violation."

Headline: White House orders greater access to files on FBI informant: New York Times
Article: The White House has ordered that a wider group of lawmakers have access to classified information about an informant the FBI used to investigate possible ties between the Trump campaign and Russia, the New York Times reported on Thursday, citing two American officials with knowledge of the decision.

Headline: U.S. judge asked to create mental health fund for migrant children
Article: A civil rights group asked a federal judge on Thursday to order the U.S. government to provide mental health counseling for the around 2,000 immigrant children separated from their parents by officials at the U.S.-Mexican border.

Headline: Kushner security clearance limits his access to some U.S. secrets: Washington Post
Article: President Donald Trump's son-in-law, Jared Kushner, does not have a high-enough security clearance level to gain access to some of the most sensitive U.S. government secrets, the Washington Post reported on Thursday, citing two people familiar with his access.

Headline: As Trump says Putin 'not my enemy', skeptics in U.S. see danger
Article: In preparing for his first summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Donald Trump has provoked a rare agreement among Democrats and Republicans alarmed by the possibility of a cozy meeting.

Headline: House Speaker casts doubt on Congress acting to stop trade tariffs
Article: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan said on Thursday that while he does not support President Donald Trump's moves to impose tariffs on major U.S. trading partners' goods, he questioned the wisdom of Congress taking legislative action to stop such sanctions.

Headline: U.S. senators want ban on China's ZTE, despite Trump action
Article: Republican and Democratic U.S. senators said on Thursday they want the government to reinstate penalties on ZTE Corp, despite a Trump administration agreement paving the way for an end of a ban on the Chinese telecommunications company.

Headline: U.S. would re-open trade talks if China makes major changes: Mnuchin
Article: The United States and China could reopen talks on trade but only if Beijing is willing to make significant changes, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S., North Korea to meet on Sunday over war remains
Article: North Korea has offered to meet an American delegation on Sunday to discuss the repatriation of remains of soldiers killed in the Korean War, a U.S. State Department spokeswoman said on Thursday.

Headline: Trump elevates tax aide Shahira Knight as Congress adviser
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday named his tax aide Shahira Knight as his main liaison with Congress, elevating her to a key role as the White House pushes the U.S. Senate to confirm Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court.

Headline: U.S. senators blast Trump on trade, vow to press for change in policy
Article: Republican and Democratic U.S. senators blasted Trump administration trade policy on Thursday and vowed to press ahead with legislation to give Congress a say in decisions to impose tariffs on national security grounds.

Headline: Manafort loses bid to stay in 'VIP' jail, could face evidence from 1980s
Article: U.S. President Donald Trumpâ€™s former campaign manager Paul Manafort may face evidence at trial about alleged wrongdoing in the 1980s and lost a bid to stay at a jail where he said he was being treated like a "VIP," court papers on Wednesday showed.

Headline: All migrant kids under five to be back with parents by Thursday: U.S. official
Article: All migrant children under age 5 who were separated at the U.S.-Mexico border will have been reunited with their parents by early Thursday morning if they were eligible, a Trump administration official said in a statement on Wednesday.

Headline: All children under five will be reunified with parents by Thursday: U.S. official
Article: All migrant children under age 5 who are eligible will be reunified with their parents by early on Thursday morning, a Trump administration official said on Wednesday.

Headline: Democrats refocus fight against Trump's Supreme Court nominee on healthcare
Article: Democrats on Wednesday were reorienting their uphill push to block U.S. Senate confirmation of President Donald Trump's nominee to the Supreme Court, moving healthcare to the center of their strategy and putting less emphasis on abortion rights.

Headline: EPA's acting head vows to carry out Trump's regulation cuts
Article: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's acting chief said on Wednesday he would push to cut regulations on industry and speed up decisions on permits, echoing the policies of former head Scott Pruitt who stepped down last week.

Headline: Trump's broadside against Germany at NATO finds some support at home
Article: They might not have agreed with the U.S. president calling Germany a "captive" of Russia, but some Republican lawmakers on Wednesday said they believe Donald Trump is right to shame one of America's most important allies into spending more on defense.

Headline: Trump high court pick Kavanaugh may face contentious cases soon
Article: President Donald Trump's Supreme Court nominee may not have to wait too long for controversial cases if he is confirmed to the job, with disputes involving abortion, immigration, gay rights, voting rights and transgender troops possibly heading toward the justices soon.

Headline: U.S. Senate backs non-binding tariff measure, minor snub of Trump
Article: The U.S. Senate made a minor effort to push back against President Donald Trump's trade policies on Wednesday by backing a non-binding motion to give Congress a role in his decisions to impose tariffs for national security reasons.

Headline: Tech issues plague U.S. web portal tracking separated children
Article: In late June, attorney Sebastian Harley tried to log into a U.S. government web portal to check on a Guatemalan child who had been separated from his parent at the border. He got an error message saying there were too many users.

Headline: State Department still investigating diplomats' illnesses in Cuba, China
Article: U.S. officials are still investigating health problems at the U.S. embassy in Cuba, and do not know who or what was behind the mysterious illnesses, which began in 2016 and have affected 26 Americans.

Headline: 'Imagine the joy:' Father, four-year-old son reunite in U.S. immigration crisis
Article: With tears and smiles, Salvadoran asylum seeker Walter Armando Jimenez Melendez reunited with his 4-year-old son Jeremy on Tuesday after six weeks of anguished separation.

Headline: Trump administration cuts grants to help people get Obamacare
Article: The Trump administration is cutting most of the funds previously provided to groups that help people get health insurance under the Affordable Care Act and will push them to promote plans lacking the law's benefits and protections, a government agency said on Tuesday.

Headline: Pfizer delays drug price hikes after talking with Trump
Article: Pfizer Inc said on Tuesday it was deferring drug price increases for no more than six months after the company's chief executive officer had an extensive conversation with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headline: Former Trump aide Flynn eager to get to sentencing, lawyer says
Article: Michael Flynn, President Donald Trump's former national security adviser who pleaded guilty in a case related to the Russian election collusion investigation, is eager to move to the sentencing phase and put his legal ordeal behind him, Flynn's lawyer said at a hearing on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. says to meet Tuesday deadline for immigrant families
Article: The U.S. government believes it is in compliance with a court-ordered Tuesday deadline to reunite immigrant children under 5 who were separated from their parents while crossing the U.S.-Mexico border, according to a court filing.

Headline: Trump nominates Hale to be under secretary of state for political affairs
Article: President Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated David Hale, currently the U.S. ambassador to Pakistan, to be under secretary of state for political affairs, the White House said.

Headline: No. 2 U.S. House Democrat out of hospital after bout with pneumonia
Article: U.S. Representative Steny Hoyer, the No. 2 Democrat in the House of Representatives, was released from the hospital over the weekend after a bout of pneumonia and plans to return to work on Capitol Hill this week, his spokeswoman said on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump blasts migrants as courts reject detention policies
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday pushed back against court rulings against his administration's migrant detention policies, saying immigrants should not come to the United States illegally.

Headline: McConnell says not worried about Trump withdrawing U.S. from NATO
Article: The top Republican in the U.S. Senate, Mitch McConnell, on Wednesday said he was not worried that President Donald Trump will withdraw the country from NATO, as Trump, who has a history of fiercely criticizing and occasionally scrapping international agreements, traveled to a major summit of NATO members.

Headline: Trump's Supreme Court nominee Kavanaugh woos Senate
Article: President Donald Trump's Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh visited top U.S. Senate Republicans on Capitol Hill on Tuesday, seeking to build support among lawmakers in what promises to be a contentious confirmation battle with Democrats.

Headline: Trump picks conservative judge Kavanaugh for Supreme Court
Article: President Donald Trump nominated Brett Kavanaugh for the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday as he aimed to entrench its conservative control for years to come, but the federal appeals court judge faces a tough confirmation fight in the bitterly divided Senate.

Headline: Trump's Supreme Court pick tests vulnerable Senate Democrats
Article: It may soon become difficult to determine who sits in the hotter seat: U.S. President Donald Trump's Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh or Senate Democrats from conservative states who must decide whether they are jeopardizing their political careers by opposing him.

Headline: U.S. to reunite only half of young migrant children by Tuesday deadline
Article: The U.S. government is struggling to reunite immigrant families it separated at the border with Mexico and only about half the children under age 5 will be back with their parents by a court-ordered deadline of Tuesday, a government attorney told a judge on Monday.

Headline: Judge rejects Trump request for long-term detention of immigrant children
Article: A U.S. federal judge on Monday rejected the Trump administration's request to allow long-term detention of illegal immigrant children, a legal setback for President Donald Trump's push to detain immigrant families taken into custody at the U.S.-Mexico border.

Headline: Washington insider Kavanaugh boasts conservative credentials
Article: Brett Kavanaugh, the consummate Washington insider picked by President Donald Trump on Monday for a lifetime seat on the U.S. Supreme Court, has viewed business regulations with skepticism in his 12 years as a judge and taken conservative positions on some divisive social issues.

Headline: Supreme Court nominee has been a foe of emissions rules
Article: Brett Kavanaugh, nominated on Monday to be a Supreme Court justice by U.S. President Donald Trump, is a long-time skeptic of business regulations, especially on rules limiting harmful emissions, although he has called global warming an "urgent" issue.

Headline: Supreme Court nominee has been a foe of emissions rules
Article: Brett Kavanaugh, nominated on Monday to be a Supreme Court justice by U.S. President Donald Trump, is a long-time skeptic of business regulations, especially on rules limiting harmful emissions, although he has called global warming an "urgent" issue.

Headline: Trump picks conservative Kavanaugh as Supreme Court nominee: NBC
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump has chosen conservative federal appeals court Judge Brett Kavanaugh as his nominee for U.S. Supreme Court Justice, NBC News reported on Monday, just before the official White House announcement.

Headline: House Republicans query Apple, Alphabet on privacy, data practices
Article: Four senior U.S. House Republicans sent letters on Monday to the chief executives of Apple Inc and Google parent Alphabet Inc asking questions about location data and mobile phone privacy practices and the handling of customer data.

Headline: After Pyongyang put-down, Pompeo stands by 'difficult' denuclearization talks
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo brushed off North Korean charges that he used "gangster-like" diplomacy in negotiations in Pyongyang, saying on Sunday after meeting his Japanese and South Korean counterparts that he would keep pursuing denuclearization talks with North Korea.

Headline: Return of U.S. war dead could build trust with North Korea: Pompeo
Article: The return of remains of U.S. troops who went missing during the 1950-53 Korean War could help build trust between North Korea and the United States, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Monday.

Headline: Trump adviser says two Supreme Court candidates are tougher sell
Article: A judicial activist advising U.S. President Donald Trump on potential nominees to the Supreme Court signaled on Sunday that two of the candidates would be a tougher sell to conservatives.

Headline: Pompeo urges North Korea's Kim to follow Vietnam's example
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Sunday urged North Korea to follow the example of Vietnam, saying President Donald Trump believed Pyongyang could replicate Hanoi's path to normal relations with Washington and to prosperity.

Headline: Trump administration halts billions in insurance payments under Obamacare
Article: The Trump administration on Saturday halted billions of dollars in payments to health insurers under the Obamacare healthcare law, saying that a recent federal court ruling prevents the money from being disbursed.

Headline: Ex-Trump campaign manager Manafort seeks to move, postpone trial
Article: U.S. President Donald Trumpâ€™s former campaign manager Paul Manafort on Friday asked for his July trial to be moved further away from Washington D.C., saying potential jurors in the capital had consumed too much negative press coverage about him and were biased against Trump.

Headline: Judge orders U.S. to provide list of separated migrant children
Article: The U.S. government must provide a list by Saturday evening of the estimated 100 children under the age of 5 who were separated from their parents when entering the United States, a federal judge ordered on Friday.

Headline: Candidate for Congress to continue campaign after car crash
Article: South Carolina Republican congressional candidate Katie Arrington was released from the hospital on Friday, two weeks after she broke her back and several ribs in a car crash, and vowed to continue her campaign after some rest.

Headline: Inside Qatar's charm offensive to win over Washington
Article: There was much bonhomie as a few dozen people, including members of Congress and U.S. administration officials, gathered last week for dinner in a posh Washington neighborhood in honor of Qatar's foreign minister.

Headline: Under fire for ethics scandals, EPA chief Pruitt resigns
Article: Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt, who had been lauded by President Donald Trump for his aggressive efforts to roll back environmental regulations, resigned on Thursday under heavy fire for a series of ethics-related controversies.

Headline: As Pompeo heads to North Korea, State Department denies softening
Article: The State Department on Thursday denied that the United States had softened its approach toward North Korea's denuclearization, as U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo heads to Pyongyang hoping to hammer out a roadmap for its nuclear disarmament.

Headline: Pompeo says Trump believes Kim wants 'brighter future' for North Korea
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump believes North Korean leader Kim Jong Un wants a "different, brighter future" for North Koreans, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said in a tweet on Thursday.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 5): Immigration, Scott Pruitt, EPA
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Immigration top issue for U.S. voters, economy a close second: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: Immigration tops the economy and healthcare as the most important issue determining Americans' vote ahead of the midterm elections in November, a new Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll shows.

Headline: Trump lawyer Cohen adds ex-Clinton special counsel to legal team
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's longtime personal lawyer Michael Cohen has hired Lanny Davis, a crisis manager and former special counsel to President Bill Clinton in the 1990s, to help him defend against a federal investigation in New York.

Headline: Trump says he believes U.S. Representative Jordan's denial of ignoring sex abuse
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he did not believe allegations by several former wrestlers at Ohio State University coached by Republican Representative Jim Jordan that he was aware the team doctor was molesting them.

Headline: U.S. moving some detained migrant parents closer to their children
Article: The U.S. government is moving some migrant parents to detention sites closer to the young children they were separated from while crossing the U.S.-Mexico border in an attempt to meet a court-imposed deadline to reunify families, U.S. Secretary of Health and Human Services Alex Azar said on Thursday.

Headline: Trump focused on Kavanaugh, Kethledge for Supreme Court: source
Article: Conservative federal appeals court judges Brett Kavanaugh and Raymond Kethledge are the two most serious contenders being considered by President Donald Trump for the U.S. Supreme Court, a source familiar with the process said on Thursday.

Headline: Trump says Kim 'sees different future' for North Korea
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he believes that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un sees a different future for his country, as America's top diplomat heads to Pyongyang for talks on denuclearization.

Headline: U.S. renewable fuel credits rise as EPA chief resigns: traders
Article: Renewable fuel (D6) credits for 2018 rose by three cents to trade at 25 cents each on Thursday after the news that U.S. Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt had resigned, traders said.

Headline: Trump says to announce top court pick Monday at 9 p.m.
Article: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he will announce his nominee for a vacancy on the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday at 9 p.m. ET.

Headline: Judge largely rules for California in 'sanctuary state' fight
Article: California's "sanctuary state" laws largely survived a legal attack by the Trump administration on Thursday after a federal judge declined to block state measures aimed at thwarting cooperation with Washington's crackdown on illegal immigration.

Headline: Trump names former Fox executive Bill Shine to communications job
Article: President Donald Trump named former Fox News executive Bill Shine to a top White House communications job on Thursday, 14 months after he left the network amid charges he failed take effective steps to deal with sexual misconduct at the channel.

Headline: Democrats seek probe of EPA's Pruitt meeting records
Article: Two Democratic lawmakers asked the EPA's inspector general on Thursday to investigate new allegations that Administrator Scott Pruitt falsified his official schedule to hide or remove records of meetings or discussions with industry representatives.

Headline: U.S. lets Yemenis stay 18 more months
Article: The Trump administration said on Thursday it would allow some 1,250 Yemenis to remain in the United States for at least another 18 months under protected status as war and a humanitarian crisis rage in their native country.

Headline: No. 2 House Democrat Hoyer hospitalized with pneumonia
Article: U.S. Representative Steny Hoyer, the No. 2 Democrat in the House of Representatives, has been hospitalized with pneumonia and is expected to make a quick recovery, his office said on Wednesday.

Headline: Top Supreme Court candidates' views on abortion under scrutiny
Article: From the moment Justice Anthony Kennedy announced his retirement from the U.S. Supreme Court last week, speculation has centered on whether his replacement would vote to overturn a woman's right to abortion.

Headline: Trump speaks with three more possible Supreme Court candidates
Article: President Donald Trump interviewed three possible candidates to fill a coming vacancy on the U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday, the White House said, a day after he spoke to Republican Senator Mike Lee of Utah about the job.

Headline: Trump administration rolls back racial diversity guidelines for colleges
Article: The Trump administration on Tuesday rescinded an extensive set of guidelines put in place under President Barack Obama that had called on colleges and universities to consider race as a way of promoting diversity.

Headline: EPA's Pruitt asked Trump to fire Sessions, name him attorney general: CNN
Article: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt directly appealed to President Donald Trump in the spring to fire Attorney General Jeff Sessions and name him as temporary replacement to run the Justice Department, CNN reported on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (July 3) - Harley-Davidson, The Washington Post
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Senate panel backs intelligence agencies on Russia-Trump conclusions
Article: A Senate Intelligence Committee report released on Tuesday supports three U.S. intelligence agencies' conclusion that Russia tried to help Donald Trump win the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: Trump administration names new U.S. drug enforcement chief
Article: (Refiles this July 2 story to correct typo in name of former President George W. Bush in paragraph 7.)

Headline: Trump spoke to three potential Supreme Court nominees on Tuesday
Article: President Donald Trump spoke on Tuesday with three potential nominees to replace retiring U.S. Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy, White House spokesman Raj Shah said.

Headline: Trump administration must turn over information about 2020 census question
Article: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered President Donald Trump's administration to hand information about its plan to ask people filling out the 2020 census form whether they are U.S. citizens over to a group of states and cities suing the administration over the question.

Headline: Trump supporters urge Walmart boycott over 'Impeach 45' clothing
Article: U.S. retailer Walmart Inc faced an outcry from supporters of President Donald Trump on Tuesday for listing for sale on its open marketplace clothing with the slogan "Impeach 45," an apparent reference to Trump, the country's 45th president.

Headline: Oprah Winfrey reiterates she will not run for president
Article: American television mogul Oprah Winfrey has reiterated she will not run for president, saying it would "kill" her, drawing a line over speculation about a potential 2020 bid.

Headline: KFA decides against punishing egg-throwers
Article: The Korea Football Association (KFA) has decided not to pursue charges against people who threw eggs at the national team after they arrived home from the World Cup, police said on Tuesday.

Headline: U.S. judge orders release reviews for asylum seekers
Article: The U.S. government has been nearly uniformly detaining asylum seekers who were initially found to have credible fears of persecution instead of releasing them pending hearings on their individual cases as required, a federal judge ruled on Monday in a setback for the Trump administration.

Headline: Trump meets with Supreme Court contenders, two in focus
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he met with four potential Supreme Court justices on Monday, while a person familiar with the selection process said Trump was focused keenly on two people, although others were still in contention.

Headline: Trump lawyer Cohen vows to defend himself, puts family first: ABC News
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's longtime personal lawyer Michael Cohen vowed to defend himself and protect his family and country first if Trump or the president's legal team tried to discredit him, ABC News reported on Monday.

Headline: Trump says new Mexican president may help U.S. with border issue
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he had spoken to Mexican President-elect Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador about border security and believed the new Mexican leader would help the United States with its border issue.

Headline: Factbox: Appeals court judges top Trump's Supreme Court contenders list
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump has said that on July 9 he will name a nominee to fill the Supreme Court vacancy created by the retirement of Justice Anthony Kennedy.

Headline: Brian Ross, who aired erroneous Trump report, to leave ABC News
Article: LOS ANGELES (Variety.com) - Brian Ross, the veteran ABC News investigative correspondent who embarrassed the network late last year with an on-air report suggesting former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn had been told by President Donald Trump to make contact with Russian officials during the 2016 campaign for the Oval Office, is leaving the network, along with Rhonda Schwartz, who served as the chief investigative producer for Ross' team.

Headline: Trump says he will meet with two or three more Supreme Court candidates
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he met with four potential Supreme Court justices on Monday morning.

Headline: From top to bottom, Trump's White House churns through staff: report
Article: Forty percent of the staff members who were working a year ago in U.S. President Donald Trump's White House have since left for other jobs, a new report shows, providing a snapshot of the chaos among Trump's closest subordinates.

Headline: Former U.S. envoys to U.N. urge Pompeo to restore relief agency funding
Article: Seven former U.S. ambassadors to the United Nations under both Republican and Democratic presidents urged U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Monday to restore U.S. funding for the U.N. agency that helps Palestinian refugees.

Headline: Massachusetts top court upholds 20-day voter registration cut-off
Article: Massachusetts' top court on Monday unanimously upheld a state requirement that people must register to vote 20 days before an election, ruling in a case that could impact the ability of thousands of citizens to cast ballots.

Headline: Russia's Lavrov to meet U.S. Congressmen on Tuesday: Ifax cites foreign ministry
Article: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will meet with a delegation of U.S. Congressmen on Tuesday, Interfax news agency cited the Russian Foreign Ministry as saying on Monday.

Headline: Kennedy's departure from high court could benefit business interests
Article: In a hotly contested case before the U.S. Supreme Court three years ago, Justice Anthony Kennedy cast the deciding vote to uphold the broad scope of race discrimination claims that can be brought under the Fair Housing Act.

Headline: U.S. has plan to dismantle North Korea nuclear program within a year: Bolton
Article: White House national security adviser John Bolton said on Sunday he believed the bulk of North Korea's weapons programs could be dismantled within a year, as the United States and North Korea resumed working-level talks.

Headline: Senator Collins will not back anti-abortion Supreme Court nominee
Article: A key moderate Republican U.S. senator said on Sunday that she will not support a nominee to fill a soon-to-be-vacated seat on the Supreme Court who would overturn a landmark legal ruling that supports a woman's right to abortion.

Headline: Trump will press Putin on election meddling denials: security aide
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will press Russian leader Vladimir Putin on Moscow's denial of meddling in the 2016 presidential election when the two leaders meet next month, national security adviser John Bolton said on Sunday.

Headline: U.S. envoy Kim held talks with North Korea: South Korean media
Article: U.S. envoy Sung Kim held talks with North Korean officials on Sunday in the border village of Panmunjom within the demilitarized zone between the North and South Korea, South Korean media reported on Sunday.

Headline: New Jersey averts government shutdown with last-minute budget
Article: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy struck a last-minute budget deal on Saturday, ending threats of a government shutdown that had raged for weeks as he struggled to reach an accord with members of his own party.

Headline: Trump narrows Supreme Court list, to name nominee July 9
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he plans to announce his nominee to replace retiring U.S. Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy on July 9, and that he has narrowed his list of candidates.

Headline: Senior U.S. diplomat for Asia Susan Thornton to retire in July
Article: The senior U.S. diplomat for Asia, Susan Thornton, will retire at the end of July, the State Department said on Saturday, in the midst of critical negotiations with North Korea and China.

Headline: U.S. government says it will detain migrant children with parents
Article: The U.S. government said in a court filing on Friday that it has the right to detain children and parents caught crossing the U.S. border illegally for the duration of their immigration proceedings.

Headline: Exclusive: Vacant Supreme Court seat will likely influence U.S. election turnout, poll shows
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court seat left open by the retirement of Justice Anthony Kennedy is a powerful motivator for voters, particularly Democrats, in this fall's midterm election fight for control of Congress, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll released on Friday.

Headline: Manafort assistant gave FBI access to storage locker: testimony
Article: A personal assistant to Paul Manafort granted the FBI access to a storage locker, allowing the government to secure evidence that President Donald Trump's former campaign manager is trying to suppress, according to testimony on Friday in a federal court hearing in Virginia.

Headline: U.S. judge bars Kentucky from requiring Medicaid recipients to work
Article: A U.S. federal judge on Friday blocked Kentucky from implementing work requirements in its Medicaid program, potentially dealing a blow to the Trump administration's effort to scale back the 50-year-old health insurance program for the poor and disabled.

Headline: Trump says he is not seeking new chief of staff, but 'things happen'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he is not looking for a new chief of staff to replace John Kelly but at some point, "things happen."

Headline: Trump says will raise election meddling with Putin in Helsinki meeting
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would raise the issue of alleged Russian meddling in U.S. elections during his planned meeting with President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki next month.

Headline: Republicans might need an even stronger U.S. economy to hold onto House
Article: Every two years, a small league of political scientists and economists fire up computer models they've developed to predict who will win the U.S. congressional elections in November.

Headline: Trump says he plans to name Supreme Court nominee on July 9
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he plans to announce his nominee for a coming vacancy on the U.S. Supreme Court on July 9 and that he has five finalists, including two women.

Headline: Trump says expects another tax overhaul 'probably in October'
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said he expects a second tax overhaul to be unveiled in October or a bit earlier, and he is considering cutting the corporate tax rate to 20 percent from 21 percent.

Headline: Trump says probably won't ask Supreme Court nominee about abortion ruling
Article: President Donald Trump said he probably will not ask the person he nominates for a seat on the U.S. Supreme Court how they would vote on the 1973 Roe v. Wade landmark abortion ruling.

Headline: U.S. unveils 'streamlined' tax form to warnings from Democrats
Article: Sticking to a pledge that Americans will be able to file tax returns on a postcard under President Donald Trump's tax code overhaul, the U.S. Treasury Department released a new Form 1040 for individuals on Friday, but met swift Democratic criticism about its potential complexity.

Headline: After a year and a half, Trump fills key South Korea post
Article: After nearly a year and a half in office, the Trump administration has succeeded in filling one of the most important U.S. diplomatic posts, with the Senate unanimously approving former Pacific commander Harry Harris as the next U.S. ambassador to South Korea.

Headline: Trump's man snubbed as U.N. picks new migration boss
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's nominee for the top U.N. migration job was roundly rejected on Friday after a candidacy that was dogged by a history of social media posts disparaging Muslims and overshadowed by Trump's policies on migrants.

Headline: Protestors, lawmaker arrested in Senate building sit-in over immigration
Article: Some 600 protestors were arrested during a clangorous occupation of a U.S. Senate office building in Washington on Thursday, where they decried U.S. President Donald Trump's "zero- tolerance" stance on illegal immigration.

Headline: Conservative lawyers steer Trump on Supreme Court pick
Article: President Donald Trump will be advised by a small group of deeply conservative lawyers, some inside the White House and at least one from outside, on choosing a nominee to the U.S. Supreme Court to replace Justice Anthony Kennedy, said several sources familiar with the process. Kennedy announced his retirement on Wednesday.

Headline: House Republicans shout down Rosenstein in tense hearing
Article: U.S. House Republican allies of President Donald Trump shouted and attacked Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein on Thursday, alleging he was improperly withholding documents related to the FBI's investigation of Trump's 2016 campaign.

Headline: California prohibits city soda taxes through 2030
Article: Big Soda scored a major victory on Thursday as California passed a law that bans local sugar taxes through 2030 in the most populous U.S. state, where cities including Berkeley have approved such levies.

Headline: Ex-Trump campaign aide Papadopoulos to be sentenced Sept. 7
Article: Former Trump campaign aide George Papadopoulos, who pleaded guilty in October to lying to FBI agents investigating possible collusion between President Donald Trump's campaign and Russia, will be sentenced on Sept. 7, a judge ordered on Thursday.

Headline: California lawmakers approve data-privacy bill opposed by Silicon Valley
Article: California Governor Jerry Brown on Thursday signed data privacy legislation aimed at giving consumers more control over how companies collect and manage their personal information, a proposal that Google and other big companies had opposed as too burdensome.

Headline: Senate passes farm bill without big food stamp changes
Article: The U.S. Senate on Thursday passed a sweeping farm bill without the food stamps changes approved by the House of Representatives earlier this month.

Headline: Trump considering who will be next White House chief of staff: source
Article: With John Kelly's tenure as White House chief of staff possibly winding down, President Donald Trump has been consulting with some of his advisers on who should succeed Kelly in that post, a source familiar with the situation said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. lawmaker holds back support for munitions sale to Gulf allies due to Yemen
Article: A top U.S. Senate Democrat said on Thursday he cannot support for now a Trump administration plan to sell high-tech munitions to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates over concerns about the war in Yemen, a decision that could derail the sale.

Headline: U.S. tax chief nominee pledges independence despite 'Trump' hotel interest
Article: President Donald Trump's nominee to head the Internal Revenue Service promised independent leadership of the U.S. tax-collecting agency on Thursday, but drew a senator's criticism for not disclosing business ties to a Trump-branded hotel in Hawaii.

Headline: Mueller subpoenas another associate of Trump adviser Roger Stone
Article: U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller has issued a grand jury subpoena to another associate of longtime Donald Trump adviser Roger Stone, a lawyer for Andrew Miller, the subject of the subpoena, said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. Secretary of State Pompeo to visit North Korea next week: report
Article: U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo plans to travel to North Korea next week to discuss the country's denuclearization plans, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing four people familiar with his plans.

Headline: U.S. House votes to rebuke Justice Department, FBI
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives voted along party lines on Thursday to demand the Department of Justice produce documents, including some related to the investigation of President Donald Trump and Russia, in an unusual rebuke to U.S. law enforcement.

Headline: Supreme Court partly rejects redrawn North Carolina election districts
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday threw out part of a lower court ruling that had invalidated a series of state legislative districts drawn by Republicans in North Carolina for failing to resolve claims that the lawmakers intended to diminish the clout of black voters.

Headline: Protesters pushed away from immigration office in Portland
Article: Federal officers on Thursday removed protesters from the entrance of an office used by immigration authorities in Portland, Oregon, breaking up a days-long demonstration against the Trump administration's immigration policies, officials said.

Headline: In Supreme Court pick, Trump can push conservative social agenda
Article: With a second Supreme Court pick less than 18 months into his presidency, Donald Trump is poised to cement conservative control of the court and fire up supporters eager for a rightward shift on divisive social issues.

Headline: Justice Kennedy to retire, Trump has chance to reshape Supreme Court
Article: Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy said on Wednesday he plans to retire after three decades as a pivotal vote on the highest U.S. judicial body, giving President Donald Trump an opportunity to make the court more firmly conservative.

Headline: U.S. police chiefs oppose Trump move to detain immigrant families
Article: Republican and Democratic U.S. police chiefs and sheriffs on Wednesday urged U.S. congressional leaders to find alternatives to detention of immigrant families because of the risks it poses to children and its huge cost.

Headline: Online bettors see Kavanaugh as likely U.S. Supreme Court nominee
Article: A federal appeals court judge in Washington was the early favorite among political bettors to succeed U.S. Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy, who announced his retirement on Wednesday.

Headline: Retiring Justice Kennedy left his mark on American society
Article: Anthony Kennedy left an indelible mark on American society in his three decades as a mild-mannered and professorial justice on the U.S. Supreme Court in areas as varied as gay rights, abortion, the death penalty and political spending.

Headline: Kennedy's departure puts abortion, gay rights in play at high court
Article: U.S. Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy's retirement, announced on Wednesday, could put some of his signature rulings in jeopardy, including ones that expanded or preserved gay rights and abortion rights.

Headline: Trump says he wants Supreme Court nominee who will serve 40-45 years
Article: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he wants to pick a U.S. Supreme Court nominee who will serve on the court for 40 to 45 years.

Headline: Factbox - Appeals court judge tops Trump's Supreme Court contenders list
Article: Brett Kavanaugh, a federal appeals court judge in Washington, was seen by some legal experts on Wednesday as the front-runner on President Donald Trump's list of contenders to fill an imminent vacancy on the U.S. Supreme Court.

Headline: Justice Kennedy's retirement injects abortion issue into U.S. elections
Article: With his surprise announcement, Justice Anthony Kennedy placed the U.S. Supreme Court and contentious issues like abortion and gay rights at the forefront of November's midterm election battle for control of the U.S. Congress.

Headline: Schumer urges Senate to reject Supreme Court nominee who opposes Roe v. Wade
Article: U.S. Senate Democratic leader Charles Schumer said on Wednesday the Senate should reject any Supreme Court nominee put forth by President Donald Trump who would vote to overturn the Roe v. Wade abortion decision or "undermine" healthcare protections.

Headline: Democrats reading tea leaves after U.S. congressman's upset
Article: Liberal Democrats on Wednesday said a string of victories in U.S. nominating contests, notably the surprise toppling of powerful congressman Joseph Crowley in New York, proved the party must embrace progressive priorities or face defeat.

Headline: U.S. House rejects compromise bill on border family separations
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives rejected a "compromise" immigration bill on Wednesday, as expected, that would have addressed the crisis of families being separated at the U.S.-Mexico border.

Headline: U.S. judge orders agency to ease release of some migrant children
Article: A federal judge on Wednesday ordered a U.S. refugee agency to reverse a policy that a New York civil rights group has blamed for excessively long detention of immigrant children in the state.

Headline: Manafort had $10 million loan from Russian oligarch: court filing
Article: A search warrant application unsealed on Wednesday revealed closer links than previously known between President Donald Trumpâ€™s former campaign manager Paul Manafort and a Russian oligarch with close ties to the Kremlin.

Headline: White House likely soon announce former Fox News executive for communications job
Article: The White House will likely soon announce U.S. President Donald Trump's pick of former Fox News executive Bill Shine to become the next White House communications director, a White House official on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump says launches search to replace retiring Supreme Court Justice Kennedy
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he was launching an immediate search for someone to replace retiring Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy, whom he hailed as a spectacular man with great vision and heart.

Headline: High-ranking House Democrat dealt surprise defeat at polls
Article: The Democratic Party's insurgent left wing and Republican U.S. President Donald Trump each claimed big victories on Tuesday, as voters in seven states selected the parties' candidates for November's midterm elections that will determine control of Congress.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (June 27) - Maxine Waters, immigration bill, Harley-Davidson
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Senate to debate Trump high court nominee in fall: McConnell
Article: U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Wednesday said President Donald Trump's eventual nomination to replace retiring Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy will be debated by the full Senate this fall.

Headline: Supreme Court delivers blow to organized labor in fees dispute
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday dealt a big blow to organized labor, ruling that non-members cannot be forced in certain states to pay fees to unions representing public employees such as teachers and police, shutting off a key union revenue source.

Headline: Trump says he told House Republicans to pass immigration bill or make new plan
Article: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that he told Republicans from the U.S. House of Representatives to either pass an immigration bill or to come back with a different proposal.

Headline: After court loss, unions prepare to back Democrats with less cash
Article: A U.S. Supreme Court decision on Wednesday limiting public sector labor unions' ability to collect fees from employees could reduce the cash that unions can pump into Democratic campaigns for congressional elections in November.

Headline: U.S. House defeats broad Republican immigration bill
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives, as expected, defeated a Republican "compromise" bill on Wednesday aimed at providing long-term protections to "Dreamers" brought to the United States illegally as children, and dealing with a crisis over immigrant children being separated from their families.

Headline: Some U.S. states embrace pro-union laws, with key fees imperiled
Article: Anticipating a setback at the U.S. Supreme Court, several labor-friendly states passed Democratic-backed laws in recent months intended to protect a vital source of money for unions that was imperiled under a major ruling by the justices on Wednesday.

Headline: Justice Department to distribute grants after legal spat over sanctuary policies
Article: The U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday it is starting to distribute public safety grants to municipalities after the funds were put on hold pending a legal dispute over cities' "sanctuary" policies that protect illegal immigrants from deportation.

Headline: White House spokeswoman Sanders to get Secret Service protection: source
Article: White House press secretary Sarah Sanders will get Secret Service protection after she was asked to leave a restaurant in southern Virginia in protest of President Donald Trump's policies, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Headline: Supreme Court rules against unions over non-member fees
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday dealt a blow to organized labor, ruling that non-members cannot be forced in certain states to pay fees to unions representing public employees such as teachers and police, shutting off a key union revenue source.

Headline: U.S. judge orders migrant families to be reunited
Article: A U.S. judge has blocked the Trump administration from separating immigrant parents and children at the U.S.-Mexico border, and ordered that those who were separated be reunited within 30 days.

Headline: Trump urges House to pass immigration bill on Wednesday
Article: President Donald Trump urged Republican lawmakers to pass a "strong but fair" immigration bill before the House of Representatives on Wednesday, despite its slim chances in the U.S. Senate.

Headline: Democrat Joseph Crowley loses bid for 11th term
Article: The No. 4 Democrat in the U.S. House of Representatives, 10-term incumbent Joseph Crowley, lost his bid for another term on Tuesday to a 28-year-old democratic socialist, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

Headline: States sue Trump over immigrant families as Congress quarrels
Article: More than a dozen states sued the Trump administration on Tuesday over its separation of migrant children and parents at the U.S.-Mexico border, saying President Donald Trump's order last week ending the breakups was illusory.

Headline: U.S. issued waivers to Trump's travel ban at rate of 2 percent, data shows
Article: One argument the Trump administration made to the Supreme Court this spring to prove the legality of its travel ban on several majority-Muslim countries was that it had a robust waiver process that would allow people in on a case-by-case basis.

Headline: U.S. top court upholds Trump travel ban targeting Muslim-majority nations
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday handed Donald Trump one of the biggest victories of his presidency, upholding his travel ban targeting several Muslim-majority countries and rejecting the argument that it represented unconstitutional religious discrimination.

Headline: Zinke's sock tweet may have violated U.S. campaign law
Article: Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke on Tuesday deleted a photo of a sock he was wearing with President Donald Trump's "Make America Great Again" campaign slogan on it after realizing he may have violated a law that prohibits federal employees from engaging in political activity.

Headline: Ex-Trump campaign chief Manafort loses bid to dismiss Virginia charges
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's former campaign manager Paul Manafort was dealt a setback on Tuesday when a judge who had expressed some sympathy for Manafort's argument that a special counsel lacked the authority to prosecute him, refused to dismiss the case.

Headline: U.S. senators want Trump to reconsider lifting ban on China's ZTE
Article: Two U.S. senators urged President Donald Trump on Tuesday to reconsider his agreement with ZTE Corp , saying lifting a ban on China's second-largest telecommunications maker poses "a significant threat" to national security.

Headline: U.S. House backs tighter foreign investment rules amid China worries
