Headline: Democrats outraising Republicans in key House races
Article: Democrats have a $10.5 million fundraising advantage over Republicans in the 25 most competitive races for seats the U.S. House of Representatives ahead of the November elections, according to an analysis by Reuters.

Headline: Trump to nominate Clarida, Bowman to Fed's Board of Governors
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he would nominate Richard Clarida, an economist who advises fund manager Pimco, and Michelle Bowman, a Kansas banking regulator, for two key positions at the U.S. Federal Reserve.

Headline: EPA must explain why Pruitt's $43,000 phone booth was legal: Republican senator
Article: The head of the Senate environment committee said on Monday the Environmental Protection Agency must give a full public accounting of its approval of $43,000 for a private soundproof phone booth for agency chief Scott Pruitt.

Headline: Colorado teachers follow other state educators in pressing for more funding
Article: Teachers in Colorado on Monday became the latest in the United States to converge on their state capital to lobby lawmakers for more funding, leading one suburban school district to close for the day.

Headline: Supreme Court rejects ex-Illinois governor's latest appeal
Article: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday turned away former Illinois Governor Rod Blagojevich's latest bid to shorten his 14-year prison sentence for corruption offenses including soliciting bribes for appointment to the Senate seat that Barack Obama vacated after being elected president in 2008.

Headline: South Dakota e-commerce sale tax fight reaches U.S. Supreme Court
Article: A high-stakes showdown at the U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday will determine whether states can force out-of-state online retailers to collect sales taxes in a fight between South Dakota and e-commerce businesses.

Headline: Fired FBI director Comey says Trump 'morally unfit': ABC News interview
Article: Former FBI director James Comey said in an ABC News interview on Sunday that U.S. President Donald Trump is a dangerous, "morally unfit" leader doing "tremendous damage" to institutional and cultural norms.

Headline: After Trump drama, new Pence national security aide steps down
Article: A new national security aide to U.S. Vice President Mike Pence stepped down on Sunday, only two days after being officially named to the job, after a behind-the-scenes White House argument hit the headlines, a White House official said.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (April 15): James Comey, Rasmussen Poll
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: President Trump's re-election campaign raised $10 million so far in 2018
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's re-election campaign raised $10 million in the first quarter of the year, leaving his re-election operation with $28 million in cash, his campaign disclosed on Sunday.

Headline: After walkouts, U.S. teachers eye elections for school funding gains
Article: High school physics teacher Craig Hoxie filed to run for Oklahoma's House of Representatives on Friday, a day after the end of a two-week teacher walkout that had pressed lawmakers for school funding.

Headline: Trump lawyer Cohen denies media report of Prague trip
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen on Saturday denied a media report that the special counsel investigating alleged Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election has evidence Cohen visited Prague that year.

Headline: U.S. marijuana friends and foes cautious at signs of softer Trump
Article: Both advocates and opponents of legalized marijuana reacted with caution on Saturday to signs from the White House that growers in U.S. states where the drug is permitted would be shielded from federal prosecution, saying it was too early to know the final impact.

Headline: Former FBI head: assumption Clinton would win a factor in email probe
Article: Former FBI Director James Comey said his assumption that Hillary Clinton would win the 2016 presidential election was a factor in opening an inquiry into her emails, according to part of an ABC interview broadcast on Saturday.

Headline: Trump says U.S. will only rejoin Pacific trade pact if terms are improved
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said the United States would only join the Trans Pacific Partnership, a multinational trade deal his administration walked away from last year, if it offered "substantially better" terms than those provided under previous negotiations.

Headline: Trump's personal lawyer attacked by U.S. prosecutor over privacy claim
Article: A U.S. prosecutor on Friday attacked a claim by President Donald Trump's longtime personal lawyer Michael Cohen that many of the materials seized this week in FBI raids on Cohen's office and home as part of a criminal investigation should remain private.

Headline: Trump lawyer Cohen seeks delay in porn star's lawsuit
Article: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, on Friday filed for a 90-day delay in porn star Stormy Daniels' defamation lawsuit, citing Monday's raids on his home, office and hotel room by U.S. prosecutors.

Headline: Trump, called an unethical liar in book, blasts ex-FBI chief as 'slime ball'
Article: President Donald Trump attacked James Comey as a "weak and untruthful slime ball" on Friday after the fired former FBI director castigated him as an unethical liar and likened him to a mob moss in a searing new memoir.

Headline: Trump lawyer arranged $1.6 million payoff to Playboy Playmate for Republican fundraiser: source
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer arranged for a $1.6 million payment to a Playboy Playmate to keep secret her sexual relationship with Republican fundraiser and Trump ally Elliott Broidy, during which she became pregnant, a person familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Headline: House passes bill to streamline 'Volcker Rule'
Article: The U.S. House of Representatives voted on Friday to name the Federal Reserve as the primary regulator for the â€œVolcker Rule,â€ which bars banks from speculative trading.

Headline: Trump says would only join TPP if deal were substantially better than offered to Obama
Article: President Donald Trump said late on Thursday he would only consider joining the landmark Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement if it were a "substantially better" deal than the one offered to President Barack Obama.

Headline: Special counsel has evidence Michael Cohen traveled to Prague: McClatchy
Article: The U.S. special counsel in the Russia probe has evidence that President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen traveled to Prague in 2016, refuting Cohen's claim that he never visited the Czech capital and bolstering an intelligence dossier that first described the trip, McClatchy reported on Friday.

Headline: Trump to lift legal threat to states that permit marijuana use
Article: President Donald Trump will lift his administration's plans for a possible crackdown on states that have legalized marijuana after talks with a Colorado senator, the White House said on Friday, an action that undercuts U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions.

Headline: Republican-led House panel orders interviews with Pruitt aides at EPA
Article: A Republican-led House of Representatives committee wrote to Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Scott Pruitt on Friday to demand interviews with five top aides, including his security chief.

Headline: Trump's 'slime ball' tweet sparks rush to online dictionary
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's denunciation of former FBI Director James Comey as a "slime ball" on Friday triggered a 60,000 percent jump in look-ups for the word on Merriam-Webster's website, the dictionary publisher said.

Headline: Pence announces $16 million for Venezuelan migrants
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence announced in Peru on Friday that Washington was giving $16 million to help Venezuelans who have fled the country's economic crisis, some of which would go to host communities in Colombia and Brazil.

Headline: With Russia on his mind, Trump looks for tougher approach on Syria: sources
Article: President Donald Trump is pressing for a more aggressive U.S. strike against Syria than military chiefs have recommended as he adopts a tougher stance against Russian President Vladimir Putin, whose support for Syriaâ€™s government has allowed it to crush opposition forces, U.S. officials said.

Headline: House Speaker Ryan endorses McCarthy as successor: NBC interview
Article: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan endorsed Republican House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy to be his successor, NBC News reported on Friday.

Headline: Trump attorney Michael Cohen under criminal investigation: court filing
Article: Michael Cohen, an attorney for U.S. President Donald Trump, has been under criminal investigation for months, federal prosecutors disclosed in a filing in Manhattan federal court in Friday.

Headline: Highlights from former FBI Director James Comey's new book
Article: A searing memoir by former FBI Director James Comey, who was fired last May by U.S. President Donald Trump, is due to be published next week.

Headline: Comey says in book Trump denied allegations of lewd behavior: Washington Post
Article: President Donald Trump denied allegations of lewd behavior made in an intelligence dossier and asked whether the FBI would consider proving it was a lie, former FBI Director James Comey wrote in an upcoming memoir, according to the Washington Post.

Headline: Lawmakers question FBI over San Bernardino suit against Apple
Article: A bipartisan group of lawmakers in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday sent a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray questioning the law enforcement agency's decision to take Apple Inc to court to force the company to help unlock a mass shooter's iPhone.

Headline: Struggle to replace Ryan could blow up Congress budget deal
Article: A six-month budget truce stitched together by Congress in March could unravel if Republican leaders vying to replace U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan indulge party conservatives who want to renege on critical parts of the pact.

Headline: At New York's Trump Tower, condo prices have lost their glitter
Article: For Todd Brassner, an art dealer who died in a fire that ripped through his Trump Tower apartment last weekend, the New York high-rise he lived in for two decades became unbearable after Donald Trump announced he was running for president.

Headline: Trump's consumer watchdog chief vents about 'leaked' information: memo
Article: The top U.S. watchdog for protecting consumers against financial abuse on Thursday blamed employees for "leaking" information about cases that he had dropped or was aiming to settle, according to an internal memo reviewed by Reuters.

Headline: Missouri governor faces growing pressure to resign over sex scandal
Article: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens, charged with criminal invasion of privacy in connection with an admitted extramarital affair, faced mounting pressure to resign on Thursday after lawmakers presented detailed allegations of abuse and blackmail from the woman involved.

Headline: Trump orders EPA to speed air quality permits to aid industry
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to speed up its decision-making on air quality permitting to make it easier for manufacturers to expand and open new plants.

Headline: Trump now less likely to sit for Mueller interview: sources
Article: An interview of U.S. President Donald Trump by special counsel Robert Mueller was less likely after this week's FBI raids on Trump's personal lawyer, two people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headline: Tech billionaire says his plan to break up California ready for voters
Article: A California technology billionaire said on Thursday that his longtime and perhaps quixotic effort to partition the Golden State into multiple new states could soon be put before voters.

Headline: Trump lawyer to seek halt to Stormy Daniels' lawsuit
Article: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, will seek on Friday to halt porn star Stormy Daniels' defamation lawsuit, and Daniels' attorney said he expected Cohen to refuse to testify if the effort fails.

Headline: Trump nominee Pompeo pledges to be tough on Russia, 'fix' Iran deal
Article: U.S. Secretary of State nominee Mike Pompeo promised on Thursday he would be willing to break from President Donald Trump if necessary, saying he would take a tough line with Russia and that he wanted to "fix" the Iran nuclear deal.

Headline: VP Pence to visit Brazil at end of May
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence will visit Brazil at the end of May in his first official trip to the country, the governments of the United States and Brazil said on Thursday.

Headline: Former congressman Stockman convicted of fraud in Texas
Article: A federal jury in Houston on Thursday found former Republican U.S. Representative Steve Stockman guilty of fraud and siphoning off hundreds of thousands of dollars in campaign funds for his personal use.

Headline: Pence to meet Canada's Trudeau at Americas summit in Lima: White House
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence will meet on Saturday with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on the sidelines of the Summit of the Americas in Lima, Peru, a White House official said on Thursday.

Headline: Republicans, eyeing midterms, hold 'messaging' vote on deficits
Article: The Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives on Thursday failed to pass a balanced budget amendment that would have prohibited federal spending from exceeding revenues.

Headline: Democrats ask EPA's Pruitt for details on weapons, security buys
Article: Democratic U.S. lawmakers asked embattled Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt on Thursday to provide documents about ethics issues they said were revealed to them by a former agency official, including spending on bulletproof vests, weapons and a contract with an Italian security service.

Headline: Unions brace for big changes under Republican-led U.S. labor board
Article: As Republicans take control of the U.S. agency that enforces federal labor law, unions are bracing for decisions that could make it harder for them to solicit support and boost their ranks by limiting their ability to contact workers.

Headline: U.S. VP Pence to meet with Venezuelan opposition leaders in Lima: White House
Article: U.S. Vice President Mike Pence will meet with Venezuelan opposition leaders in Lima, Peru on Friday, White House officials said, part of a U.S. push to galvanize regional pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

Headline: Senate confirms former coal lobbyist as deputy at EPA
Article: The U.S. Senate on Thursday confirmed Andrew Wheeler, a former coal lobbyist and senate aide, as deputy at the Environmental Protection Agency by a vote of 53 to 45.

Headline: In boost for farmers, Trump says he may allow E15 gasoline sales all year
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration may allow the sale of gasoline containing 15 percent ethanol year-round, which could help farmers by firing up corn demand but faces opposition from Big Oil.

Headline: Senator slams bank gun policies, threatens consumer complaint
Article: A U.S. senator on Thursday criticized Citigroup Inc and Bank of America Corp's restrictions on lending to firearm makers and sellers, saying the new policies were wrongly politicizing banking services.

Headline: Trump touts effect of his call with China's Xi on U.S. beef exports
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said he thinks a conversation he had with China's President Xi Jinping has had an impact on U.S. beef exports to China, where American exporters are now selling "a lot" of beef.

Headline: U.S. launches crackdown on sexual harassment in housing
Article: The Trump administration launched an initiative on Thursday to crack down on sexual harassment of women by landlords and encourage victims to come forward for help from the U.S. Justice Department and Department of Housing and Urban Development.

Headline: House Republicans propose food stamp changes for Farm Bill
Article: Republicans on the U.S. House Agriculture Committee on Thursday called for changes to the government's food assistance program for the poor, in a package of long-awaited proposals for the next U.S. Farm Bill that could complicate its passage through Congress.

Headline: Banker asked about U.S. Army post before making Manafort loan: lawmakers
Article: Democratic lawmakers on Thursday questioned whether the head of a Chicago bank was seeking a favor from the incoming Trump administration when he inquired about the confirmation process for a top U.S. Army position before extending $16 million in loans to Trump's former campaign chairman.

Headline: U.S. trade chief Lighthizer cancels trip to summit in Peru
Article: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer has canceled his attendance at the Summit of the Americas in Peru starting on Friday, a USTR spokeswoman said on Thursday, after President Donald Trump pulled out of the meeting earlier this week.

Headline: U.S. Secretary of State nominee Pompeo confirms special counsel interview
Article: CIA Director Mike Pompeo, President Donald Trump's nominee to be secretary of state, said on Thursday he had been interviewed by Special Counsel Robert Mueller, who is investigating alleged Russian meddling in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

Headline: House Speaker Ryan touts farm, immigration bills
Article: U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan said on Thursday he would like to see action this year on a rewrite of U.S. farm policy and legislation protecting young, undocumented immigrants from deportation, despite signs both are likely to stall.

Headline: Pompeo says he 'wants to fix' Iran deal, work with allies if can't be fixed
Article: CIA Director Mike Pompeo, U.S. President Donald Trump's nominee to be secretary of state, said on Thursday he "wants to fix" the international Iran nuclear deal.

Headline: Bipartisan group of senators introduce proposal to protect Mueller
Article: A bipartisan group of senators will introduce legislation on Wednesday to protect the office of the special counsel, one day after the White House said U.S. President Donald Trump had the authority to fire a special prosecutor investigating Russia and the 2016 election.

Headline: Nationwide protests planned if Trump fires Mueller or Rosenstein
Article: U.S. progressive groups are gearing up for nationwide protests if President Donald Trump fires the special counsel investigating Russian meddling in the 2016 U.S. election, or replaces the Justice Department official overseeing the probe.

Headline: Facebook's Zuckerberg unscathed by congressional grilling, stock rises
Article: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg fielded 10 hours of questions over two days from nearly 100 U.S. lawmakers and emerged largely unscathed and considerably richer.

Headline: Backstory: Putting a spotlight on Facebook
Article: Reuters covers dozens of high-profile Congressional hearings each year, but few draw the intensity and urgency of Facebook founder Mark Zuckerbergâ€™s visit to Capitol Hill this week.

Headline: Zuckerberg resists effort by U.S. senators to commit him to regulation
Article: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday navigated through the first of two U.S. congressional hearings without making any further promises to support new legislation or change how the social network does business.

Headline: Myanmar activists welcome Zuckerberg's 24-hour target to block hate speech on Facebook
Article: Myanmar civil society groups welcomed a commitment by Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to tackle hate speech within 24 hours as the social media giant fights messages inciting violence, but urged it to deploy more resources in the country.

Headline: Pressure mounts for Missouri governor to resign over sex scandal
Article: Missouri's attorney general called on Governor Eric Greitens, a fellow Republican, to resign on Wednesday, saying the findings of a newly released state legislative report on the sex scandal embroiling the governor are grounds for his impeachment.

Headline: As Trump Mideast peace plan nears completion, rollout still unclear: source
Article: The Trump administration has nearly completed a long-awaited Israeli-Palestinian peace plan but is still struggling to decide how and when to roll it out, a senior White House official said, acknowledging that Washington faces a â€œdisconnectâ€ with Palestinians over its planned U.S. embassy move to Jerusalem.

Headline: Pompeo to signal tough line on Moscow in Cabinet nomination hearing
Article: CIA Director Mike Pompeo will signal a harder line toward Moscow during his confirmation hearing on Thursday to become U.S. President Donald Trump's new secretary of state, according to excerpts of his testimony.

Headline: Renewed sanctions need not mean U.S. exit from Iran deal: Mnuchin
Article: A decision by U.S. President Donald Trump not to renew sanctions relief for Iran on May 12 would not necessarily mean the United States had withdrawn from the 2015 Iran nuclear deal, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Wednesday.

Headline: Teen birthday vote drive targets pro-gun lawmakers
Article: Gun control advocates are planning to send birthday packages to newly turned 18-year-olds in 10 states where they believe pro-gun lawmakers are vulnerable. Inside each: a voter registration form.

Headline: ACLU sues Trump administration for separating immigrant couples
Article: The American Civil Liberties Union has filed a lawsuit challenging what it calls a pattern by President Donald Trump's administration of detaining illegal immigrants seeking to legalize their status based on marriages to U.S. citizens.

Headline: House Speaker Ryan to quit, shaking Republicans as elections near
Article: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan will not seek re-election and will leave his post at the start of 2019, dealing a blow to fellow Republicans and President Donald Trump ahead of fast-approaching congressional elections.

Headline: South Korea's national security adviser in U.S. to meet Bolton: officials
Article: South Korea's national security adviser was in Washington on Wednesday for his first meeting with his new American counterpart, John Bolton, U.S. officials said, amid preparations for separate U.S. and South Korean summits with North Korea.

Headline: In call with Saudi king, Trump demanded quick end to Gulf rift: U.S. officials
Article: In a telephone call this month with Saudi Arabia's King Salman, President Donald Trump demanded that the kingdom and its Arab partners quickly end a nearly year-old dispute with Qatar that has left U.S. allies in the region fractured, according to two U.S. officials briefed on the conversation.

Headline: Interior Department watchdog raps transfers of top executives
Article: The U.S. Interior Department watchdog on Wednesday criticized the reassignment of more than two dozen senior staff, saying political appointees shunted the executives into new jobs without leaving a paper trail or informing them beforehand.

Headline: Ryan assured Trump won't fire special counsel, Senate eyes bill
Article: As President Donald Trump fumed over an FBI raid targeting his personal attorney, U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan said on Wednesday he has been assured Trump does not intend to fire the special counsel investigating Russian election meddling.

Headline: Missing hyphens will make it hard for some people to vote in U.S. election
Article: Fabiola Diaz, 18, sits in the food court of her Georgia high school and meticulously fills out a voter registration form.

Headline: House oversight panel asks EPA for travel, condo documents
Article: The Republican head of the U.S. House of Representative's oversight committee told Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt on Wednesday his agency has not provided requested documents about expensive air travel, including documents related to any threats that had been made on Pruitt.

Headline: Senate panel to hold hearing on sexual abuse of Olympic athletes
Article: The U.S. Senate will hold a hearing next week into how the U.S. Olympic Committee, USA Gymnastics and other sports organizations handled sexual misconduct allegations.

Headline: Oklahoma's striking teachers seek more funds, Republicans say they are done
Article: A strike by Oklahoma educators demanding more school funding extended to a 10th day on Wednesday, as the state's Republican leaders warned they planned no further increases after approving $450 million in new revenue to boost teacher pay.

Headline: Kentucky attorney general's lawsuit seeks to void new pension law
Article: A new Kentucky law aimed at addressing the state's unfunded pension liability is unconstitutional and should be voided, according to a lawsuit filed on Wednesday by the state's attorney general and groups representing teachers and police officers.

Headline: ACLU sues to block new Kentucky law restricting abortions
Article: A civil rights group on Wednesday sued to block a Kentucky law that restricts abortion access in the state a day after the governor signed the bill.

Headline: Trump signs law to punish websites for sex trafficking
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday signed legislation aimed at penalizing website operators that facilitate online sex trafficking and chipping away at a legal protection for the technology industry.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers quiz Trump's consumer chief over lack of action
Article: Democratic lawmakers asked U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau chief Mick Mulvaney on Wednesday why he has not issued any sanctions during his five months at the agency.

Headline: U.S. Senate Judiciary chairman seeks vote on special counsel bill - CNN
Article: The head of the U.S. Senate Judiciary Committee wants the panel to vote as soon as Thursday on a bipartisan bill aimed at protecting the U.S. Special Counsel investigating alleged Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election and possible collusion with President Donald Trump's campaign, CNN reported.

Headline: Russian company indicted by Mueller hires Washington lawyers
Article: A Russian company charged with helping fund a Russian propaganda operation that allegedly tampered in the 2016 U.S. presidential election has retained two Washington lawyers to handle its defense, according to court filings on Wednesday.

Headline: U.S. lifts travel ban on Chad citizens: White House
Article: President Donald Trump lifted a U.S. travel ban on citizens from Chad on Tuesday after a six-month U.S. government review found improvements in the African country's security standards, the White House said.

Headline: As Trump fumes over FBI raid, White House lawyers urge restraint
Article: White House lawyers are trying to dissuade U.S. President Donald Trump from seeking to get rid of Special Counsel Robert Mueller, as Trump weighs options after the FBI raided his personal attorney's office and home, two U.S. officials said on Tuesday.

Headline: 'Momentum is on our side,' Oklahoma teachers union leader declares with strike in ninth day
Article: Oklahoma teachers carried their walkout over school funding and higher pay into a ninth day on Tuesday as the Republican party governor signed school revenue bills that fell short of their demands.

Headline: Trump cancels trip to Latin America, prompting relief and criticism
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump canceled his first official trip to Latin America, the White House announced on Tuesday, triggering a mix of relief and criticism from a region he has repeatedly disparaged over immigration, narcotics and trade.

Headline: Factbox: Under investigation or indicted - the Trump aides facing scrutiny
Article: The federal investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 presidential election and potential collusion by Donald Trump's campaign has targeted - directly or indirectly - a growing group of presidential associates.

Headline: Trump's lawyer Cohen says paying Daniels perfectly legal: CNN
Article: President Donald Trump's attorney Michael Cohen says everything he did in regard to paying adult film star Stormy Daniels was perfectly legal, CNN reported on Tuesday, citing an interview.

Headline: Trump believes he has the power to fire Mueller: White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump believes he has the power to dismiss special counsel Robert Mueller, the White House said on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump's homeland security adviser Bossert resigns on Bolton's request
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's homeland security adviser, Tom Bossert, has resigned at the request of new national security adviser John Bolton, an administration official said on Tuesday, marking the latest departure from the White House of a senior adviser.

Headline: Trump to put biofuel reform push on ice, for now: sources
Article: The Trump administration will delay any moves to reform the nation's biofuel policy for about three months, according to three sources briefed on the matter - a decision one of the sources said was meant to shield farmers worried about a potential trade war with China.

Headline: Timeline of Mueller probe of Trump campaign and Russia
Article: The raid by FBI agents on Monday on the offices and home of U.S. President Donald Trump's longtime attorney Michael Cohen grew out of an investigation by Special Counsel Robert Mueller that has cast a cloud over Trump's presidency.

Headline: Senate leader says doesn't see need for bill to protect special counsel
Article: Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell said on Tuesday he did not see the need for legislation to protect the special counsel probing potential collusion between Donald Trump's presidential campaign and Russia.

Headline: Senate leader says open to talks on spending cuts package
Article: The Republican leader in the U.S. Senate said on Tuesday he was open to discussing potential legislation to cut government spending from levels recently approved by Congress, but indicated some doubt on whether such as goal could be reached.

Headline: Senate plans future hearing on Cambridge Analytica, other firms
Article: The U.S. Senate Commerce Committee plans to hold a future hearing on Cambridge Analytica and other companies that may have improperly obtained Facebook Inc user data, the chairman of the panel said on Tuesday.

Headline: Factbox: Does attorney-client privilege apply to Trump lawyer raid?
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump has assailed the Monday raid by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents on the New York offices and home of his personal lawyer Michael Cohen, complaining on Twitter on Tuesday that "attorney-client privilege is dead!"

Headline: U.S. senate panel plans to repeal auto lending rules: Toomey
Article: U.S. Senate Banking Committee Republican Pat Toomey said on Tuesday the panel plans to repeal the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau's indirect auto lending and leveraged lending rules in the coming weeks.

Headline: FBI raids offices, home of Trump's personal lawyer: sources
Article: The Federal Bureau of Investigation on Monday raided the offices and home of U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Michael Cohen, law enforcement sources said, in a dramatic new development in a series of probes involving close Trump associates.

Headline: Trump says China will take down trade barriers, deal on IP - Tweet
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said in a tweet on Sunday that China would take down its trade barriers and that the two countries would reach a deal on intellectual property.

Headline: Factbox: How might Trump remove special counsel in Russia probe?
Article: After reports on Monday that the FBI had raided the offices of his attorney Michael Cohen, U.S. President Donald Trump was asked if he would fire Special Counsel Robert Mueller.

Headline: Trump administration issues rule further watering down Obamacare
Article: The Trump administration took additional steps to weaken Obamacare on Monday, allowing U.S. states to relax the rules on what insurers must cover and giving states more power to regulate their individual insurance markets.

Headline: Porn star's lawyer asks court to deny Trump lawyer's push for arbitration
Article: The lawyer for Stormy Daniels, the adult film star who says she had sex with U.S. President Donald Trump, on Monday asked a federal judge to set aside a motion by Trump's lawyer to force her to use arbitration to settle a dispute over an agreement to keep quiet about the encounter.

Headline: Republican tax cuts to fuel historic U.S. deficits: CBO
Article: The massive tax cuts signed into law in December, which Republicans said would pay for themselves, will balloon the U.S. deficit in years ahead, the Congressional Budget Office said on Monday, possibly hobbling President Donald Trump's future agenda.

Headline: Zuckerberg ditches T-shirt, apologizes for Facebook mistakes
Article: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg swapped his trademark T-shirt and jeans for a dark suit and a purple tie on Monday as he met U.S. lawmakers to apologize for the social network's misuse of its members' data and to head off possible regulation.

Headline: Trump calls FBI raid on his attorney's home and office disgraceful
Article: President Donald Trump said on Monday that the FBI's raid on the office and home of his personal attorney Michael Cohen was a disgraceful action and a total witch hunt.

Headline: Trump lawyer under investigation for campaign finance violations: Washington Post
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's personal lawyer, Michael Cohen, is under investigation for campaign finance violations and bank fraud, the Washington Post reported on Monday, citing a source familiar with the case.

Headline: Trump says will meet with North Korean leader in May or early June
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday he planned to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un next month or in early June and hoped the discussions would ultimately lead to an end of the North's nuclear weapons program.

Headline: Florida Republican Governor Scott enters marquee Senate race
Article: Republican Florida Governor Rick Scott on Monday kicked off his campaign for the U.S. Senate, challenging Democrat Bill Nelson in a race expected to be among the most competitive contests to decide which party controls Congress.

Headline: Oklahoma teachers press lawmakers for tax plan to end strike
Article: Thousands of Oklahoma teachers packed the state Capitol on Monday to press the Republican-dominated legislature to enact a capital gains tax overhaul that educators said could help end a statewide walkout now in its second week.

Headline: U.S. senator is first to give birth while in office
Article: Tammy Duckworth on Monday became the first member of the U.S. Senate to give birth while in office, welcoming her second daughter, named Maile Pearl Bowlsbey, her office announced.

Headline: Illinois Republicans warn against repeat of partial state budgets
Article: Illinois Governor Bruce Rauner on Monday called on state lawmakers to pass a full-year fiscal 2019 budget that adheres to a revenue estimate and not a partial spending plan meant only to get the state past the November election.

Headline: Senators ask Trump to suspend EPA's use of biofuel waivers
Article: Five Republican senators on Monday called on President Donald Trump to temporarily halt the use of biofuels policy waivers for small oil refineries, after reports the Environmental Protection Agency had issued a recent wave of such exemptions.

Headline: White House seeks to speed reviews of major infrastructure projects
Article: The Trump administration announced on Monday a new effort to speed environmental reviews for major infrastructure projects, a White House official said.

Headline: Signs of struggles on big cases as Supreme Court pace slackens
Article: Members of the U.S. Supreme Court appeared to be struggling over how to resolve a key case recently when Justice Stephen Breyer suggested that the best course might be to put off a decision altogether.

Headline: Judge denies Trump's ex-campaign manager Manafort's bid to loosen bail terms
Article: A federal judge on Monday denied President Donald Trump's former campaign manager Paul Manafort's latest request to loosen the terms of his bail conditions, saying some of the assets he offered to post as collateral are too tied up and cannot be used to meet a $10 million bond obligation.

Headline: Zuckerberg to meet with U.S. lawmakers today: sources
Article: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg will hold meetings with some U.S. lawmakers on Monday, a day before he is due to appear at Congressional hearings over a political consultancy's use of customer data, two congressional aides said on Sunday.

Headline: Exclusive: As elections near, many older, educated, white voters shift away from Trump's party
Article: Older, white, educated voters helped Donald Trump win the White House in 2016. Now, they are trending toward Democrats in such numbers that their ballots could tip the scales in tight congressional races from New Jersey to California, a new Reuters/Ipsos poll and a data analysis of competitive districts shows.

Headline: In key Kentucky House race, healthcare anxieties loom large
Article: Andy Barr, a Republican lawmaker representing central Kentucky, won his last three elections promising to repeal and replace Obamacare. This year, his Democratic challengers for Congress in Kentucky's sixth district are betting that message will ring hollow.

Headline: Tech group urges U.S. to recruit allies to take on China, not tariffs
Article: A trade group representing top technology companies on Monday told U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin that it opposes the Trump administration's focus on tariffs to try to change China's unfair trade practices.

Headline: Trump predicts trade concessions by China, despite rising tensions
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump predicted on Sunday that China would take down its trade barriers, expressing optimism despite escalating trade tensions between the world's two largest economies that have roiled global markets in the past week.

Headline: U.S. names prosecutor to oversee production of documents sought by Congress
Article: The U.S. Justice Department is announcing it has named a top prosecutor to oversee the production of documents demanded by Congress and is producing 3,600 pages of additional records on Monday.

Headline: Trump's national security spokesman plans to leave White House
Article: The spokesman for President Donald Trump's National Security Council plans to leave the administration, the White House said on Sunday, a day before Trump's third national security adviser formally takes up his post.

Headline: Arizona election database targeted in 2016 by criminals, not Russia: source
Article: A hack on an Arizona election database during the 2016 U.S. presidential campaign was carried out by suspected criminal actors and not the Russian government, a senior Trump administration official told Reuters on Sunday.

Headline: U.S. Treasury Secretary Mnuchin says he does not expect trade war
Article: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Sunday there was a risk of a trade war between the United States and China after the countries proposed imposing tariffs on billions of dollars' worth of one another's goods, but that he did not expect one.

Headline: Trump stands by embattled EPA chief Pruitt in Tweet
Article: President Donald Trump on Saturday defended his embattled head of the Environmental Protection Agency, Scott Pruitt, and said the official's travel and security expenses were reasonable.

Headline: Oklahoma approves tax deal but teachers vow to extend strike
Article: The Oklahoma Senate passed a $44 million revenue and tax package on Friday to fund the state's public schools, but the amount fell short of new spending sought by teachers who walked out in protest of a decade of education budget cuts and low salaries.

Headline: Trump administration grants license for Taiwan submarine project: report
Article: The Trump administration has approved the marketing license required for American manufacturers to sell technology to Taiwan that would allow for building domestic submarines, Taiwan's Central News Agency reported on Saturday.

Headline: Panic! Don't panic! Navigating the trade talk proves dicey
Article: "Don't overreact," President Donald Trump's chief economic adviser told investors on Wednesday, when U.S. stocks were deep in the red over worries about the administration's plan for $50 billion of import duties aimed at China.

Headline: U.S. attorney general renews calls to prosecute first-time border crossers
Article: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions ramped up calls on Friday to criminally prosecute immigrants who cross illegally into the United States, adding to a barrage of statements on immigration by the administration of President Donald Trump this week.

Headline: Trump, UAE leader push for unity in Gulf as dispute drags on
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump and Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed of the United Arab Emirates agreed on Friday to push for unity among Gulf nations, the White House said, amid a bitter standoff between Qatar and other U.S. allies in the region.

Headline: U.S. lawmakers skeptical of promises to shield farmers from trade dispute
Article: U.S. lawmakers and the farm industry were skeptical of the Trump administrationâ€™s promise to shield farmers from the rapidly escalating trade dispute between the United States and China, concerned about the lack of details in protecting the U.S. agricultural export sector now embroiled in the back-and-forth.

Headline: Former Senator Akaka, first native Hawaiian in Senate, dies at 93
Article: Former Senator Daniel Akaka, the first native Hawaiian in the U.S. Senate, who strove for recognition of Filipino veterans who fought with the United States during World War Two, died on Friday at age 93.

Headline: Trump signs memo ending 'catch and release' immigration policy
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a memorandum on Friday ordering the end of a policy, known as "catch and release," in which illegal immigrants are released from detention while awaiting a court hearing on their status.

Headline: Scandal-hit Republican congressman Farenthold steps down
Article: Republican U.S. Representative Blake Farenthold of Texas, accused by a female former aide of sexual harassment, abruptly resigned from Congress on Friday after admitting to allowing an unprofessional culture to flourish in his Capitol Hill office.

Headline: Embattled EPA chief's calendar shows industry had his ear
Article: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency administrator Scott Pruitt held 25-times more meetings with industry representatives than environmental advocates during his first seven months in office, according to a Reuters analysis of his schedule, reflecting the agency's pro-business approach under his tenure.

Headline: Facebook backs political ad bill, sets limits on 'issue ads'
Article: Facebook Inc backed for the first time on Friday proposed legislation requiring social media sites to disclose the identities of buyers of online political campaign ads and introduced a new verification process for people buying "issue" ads, which have been used to sow discord online.

Headline: 64 Democratic lawmakers urge Trump to dismiss EPA chief Pruitt
Article: Dozens of Democrats in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday urged President Donald Trump in a letter to ask embattled Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt to resign.

Headline: Trump to mull U.S. biofuels policy options in cabinet meeting Monday
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump will review a list of potential changes to the nation's renewable fuel laws at a meeting with members of his cabinet on Monday, two sources said, as biofuels groups warned against any action that would weaken ethanol demand.

Headline: 'We can't just trust': The thinking behind Trump's get-tough approach to China
Article: When Liu He, Chinese President Xi Jinping's top economic adviser, came to Washington in late February, he was expected to make arrangements for restarting trade talks that President Donald Trump had put on ice.

Headline: U.S. would consider more than 4,000 national guards troops at border: White House
Article: The White House said on Friday that it may consider sending more than 4,000 National Guard troops to the border with Mexico and will continue to work with California, which has resisted President Donald Trump's call to use the reserve military to support the border patrol.

Headline: Russia sanctions will not affect Trump-Putin meeting plans: White House
Article: Preparations for a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin will not be affected by sweeping U.S. sanctions imposed on Friday on Russian government officials and businessmen, the White House said.

Headline: Pelosi calls for EPA chief Pruitt to resign as scandal grows
Article: U.S. Representative Nancy Pelosi, the top Democrat in the House of Representatives, on Friday called for Scott Pruitt to resign as head of the Environmental Protection Agency amid a growing scandal involving a condo he rented at well-below-market rates from a lobbyist's wife as well as his spending of public money.

Headline: Trump to snub White House press dinner for second consecutive year
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump, who has feuded with several media personalities and organizations, will not attend the White House Correspondents' Association annual black-tie dinner for the second straight year, the president of the group said on Friday.

Headline: Trump to tap No. 2 official to run U.S. auto-safety agency
Article: The White House said late Thursday that President Donald Trump intends to nominate a top auto-safety agency official to run the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration as regulators debate reducing planned fuel efficiency increases through 2025.

Headline: Trump says he did not know about $130,000 payment to Stormy Daniels
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump, in his first public remarks about an intimate relationship he has been accused of having with an adult film star, said on Thursday he did not know about a $130,000 payment made by his lawyer to actress Stormy Daniels to keep her quiet.

Headline: Exclusive: U.S. willing to talk trade with China, no session set yet - official
Article: The United States is willing to negotiate with China on trade, but only if talks are serious, as previous attempts produced little progress, a senior U.S. official told Reuters late on Thursday as trade tensions between the two nations escalated.

Headline: U.S. envoy Haley says she shares Bolton's disdain for U.N.
Article: U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley said on Thursday she shares incoming national security adviser John Bolton's disdain for the world body and believes the two will work well together.

Headline: Trump: Pruitt has done 'fantastic' job, will look into ethics
Article: President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a look into ethics allegations against Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Scott Pruitt over his condo lease and other issues, but added the official was doing a "fantastic job."

Headline: Trump says looking into allegations against Pruitt
Article: President Donald Trump told reporters on Thursday he was looking into allegations about Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Scott Pruitt, who is under fire for renting a condo at below-market rates from a lobbyist's wife, but added that Pruitt had done a fantastic job in the post.

Headline: Trump taking 'serious look' at policy options on Amazon
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a serious look at policies to address what he says are the unfair business advantages of online retailer Amazon.com Inc

Headline: Minnesota's ex-Governor Pawlenty seeks another term
Article: Former Minnesota Governor Tim Pawlenty on Thursday said he would run this year for another term, shaking up a competitive race and boosting chances the state's leadership could turn Republican.

Headline: Trump wants National Guard on Mexican border until wall built
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would probably station a few thousand National Guard troops at the 2,000-mile-long (3,200-km) Mexican border until the wall he wants to build there to keep out illegal immigrants is done.

Headline: EPA sued by 14 states over delay in methane emission standards
Article: Fourteen states filed suit on Thursday accusing the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency of failing to issue regulations for curbing emissions of methane, a potent greenhouse pollutant, from existing oil and gas operations as required under the Clean Air Act.

Headline: Trump fundraiser suffers setback in suit against Qatar over emails
Article: A U.S. District Court judge in California refused to issue an order blocking Qatar and one of its lobbyists from disseminating emails and other documents that top Republican fundraiser Elliott Broidy has alleged in a lawsuit were stolen in a hack of his and his wife's computers.

Headline: Trump says taking a serious look at policy options on Amazon
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a very serious look at policies that might affect online retailer Amazon.com Inc.

Headline: Support for Trumpâ€™s immigration stance slips among supporters: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Article: While people who voted for President Donald Trump are still largely supportive of his immigration policies, their approval has eroded somewhat since he took office, according to Reuters/Ipsos polling.

Headline: U.S. House Ways and Means Committee to hold tariff hearing April 12
Article: The U.S. House Ways and Means Committee will hold a hearing on the effects of recent tariff increases on April 12, its chairman said on Thursday.

Headline: U.S. congressional panels probe whether Russia got Facebook data: sources
Article: Investigators on two congressional panels are looking into whether Russia acquired the data of millions of Facebook users and if companies with ties to then-2016 Republican election candidate Donald Trump's campaign played any role in providing it, three sources familiar with the inquiries said.

Headline: San Francisco sues U.S. attorney general over repealed civil rights memos
Article: The city of San Francisco filed a lawsuit against U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions on Thursday, asking a federal court to overturn his December decision to revoke legal guidance designed to protect minorities, the indigent and disabled.

Headline: Trump says still has confidence in environmental agency head Pruitt
Article: President Donald Trump on Thursday indicated he continued to back Environmental Protection Agency head Scott Pruitt, who is under fire for paying low rent on a condo owned by a lobbyist.

Headline: Civil rights 'Freedom Riders' cherish MLK's lasting legacy, 50 years on
Article: Bob Singleton only met civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. once, but that meeting changed his life.

Headline: Trump, stymied on wall, to send troops to U.S.-Mexico border
Article: President Donald Trump, unable to get the U.S. Congress or Mexico to fully fund his border wall, will post National Guard troops along the Mexican frontier, officials said on Wednesday, in a move that was likely to escalate tensions with a key U.S. ally.

Headline: Mexico Senate rebukes Trump over border deployment plans
Article: Mexico's Senate issued a stern rebuke to U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday, urging its government to end cooperation with the United States on migration and security over Trump's plans to deploy the National Guard along their shared border.

Headline: Central American 'caravan' to end in Mexico City, migrants defiant
Article: Central American migrants stranded on a journey through Mexico because of U.S. President Donald Trump's pressure on the Mexican government say they will struggle on toward the United States, even as their "caravan" said it would disband in Mexico City.

Headline: Trump to order National Guard to protect border with Mexico: official
Article: President Donald Trump will sign a proclamation on Wednesday ordering the deployment of the National Guard to help protect the border with Mexico, Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen said.

Headline: Two Bill Clinton impeachment shows abandoned by U.S. TV networks
Article: U.S. television networks have scrapped two planned series about former President Bill Clinton's affair with Monica Lewinsky and his 1998 impeachment.

Headline: As elections loom, Democrats vow not to be baited by Trump's name-calling
Article: Before last month's special congressional election in Pennsylvania, U.S. President Donald Trump, who ridiculed his rivals in the 2016 election as â€œLiddle Marco,â€ â€œLyinâ€™ Ted,â€ and â€œCrooked Hillary,â€ tried it again, tagging Democratic candidate Conor Lamb as â€œLamb the Sham.â€

Headline: Judge skewers Manafort's civil case challenging Mueller's powers
Article: A federal judge tore into all of the legal arguments that a lawyer for President Donald Trump's former campaign chairman Paul Manafort made on Wednesday in his long-shot civil case to convince her that Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation has run amok and should be reined in.

Headline: Senate Intelligence panel interviews ex-Trump business associate: sources
Article: A former business associate of President Donald Trump who worked as an informant for U.S. government agencies met with representatives of the U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee on Wednesday, according to three people familiar with the meeting.

Headline: Ex-Trump aide Bannon: 'To hell with Wall Street' view on trade moves
Article: Steve Bannon, President Donald Trump's former chief strategist and 2016 campaign CEO, had a fiery response on Wednesday to Wall Street's dim view of Trump's trade actions against China.

Headline: Ohio's Kasich says unlikely to challenge Trump as independent in 2020: CNN
Article: Ohio Republican Governor John Kasich said on Wednesday he was unlikely to challenge U.S. President Donald Trump, a fellow Republican, in the 2020 presidential election as an independent, CNN reported.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (April 4) - Border laws, China
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Trump says 'we are not in a trade war with China': tweet
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump denied on Wednesday that the United States was in a trade war with China, hours after Beijing slapped tariffs on a list of U.S. imports in retaliation for similar duties levied by the White House one day earlier.

Headline: Mexico vets and disperses Central American migrant 'caravan'
Article: Mexican officials on Tuesday screened a dwindling group of hundreds of largely Central American migrants who are moving through Mexico toward the United States, seeking to break up the "caravan" that has drawn the ire of U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headline: Liberal judge Rebecca Dallet wins Wisconsin Supreme Court race: AP
Article: Liberal judge Rebecca Dallet cruised to victory in race to serve on the Wisconsin Supreme Court for a 10-year term, the Associated Press reported late on Tuesday.

Headline: Mueller said last month Trump not a criminal target 'at this point': Washington Post
Article: U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller told President Donald Trump's attorneys last month he was continuing to investigate the president but did not consider him a criminal target in the Russia probe "at this point," the Washington Post reported on Tuesday.

Headline: National Guard part of Trump's Mexico border strategy: White House
Article: President Donald Trump's strategy for the U.S.-Mexico border includes mobilizing the National Guard, the White House said on Tuesday, after Trump had earlier spoken publicly to reporters about "guarding our border with the military" to stop illegal immigrants.

Headline: Fifty years after King's death, U.S. civil rights leaders lament Trump's rise
Article: A half century after the assassination of Rev. Martin Luther King Jr., U.S. civil rights leaders say they are fearful President Donald Trump could reverse progress made on civil rights in the United States since King's death.

Headline: Lawyer tied to ex-Trump aides gets 30-day sentence in Mueller probe
Article: The Dutch son-in-law of one of Russia's richest men was sentenced on Tuesday to 30 days in prison and fined $20,000 for lying to Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigators about contacts with an official in President Donald Trump's 2016 campaign.

Headline: Trump sticks by EPA chief as lawmakers call for resignation
Article: President Donald Trump expressed support on Tuesday for EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt, as U.S. lawmakers including two fellow Republicans called for Pruitt's resignation after reports he paid far below market rates to live in a condo owned by a lobbyist.

Headline: Trump's Mexican border strategy includes mobilizing National Guard
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's strategy for dealing with illegal immigration coming through the border with Mexico includes mobilizing the National Guard, the White House said in a statement on Tuesday.

Headline: Trump seeks Syria pullout as advisers warn of hard work ahead
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he wanted to "get out" of Syria but offered no timetable, as his advisers warned of the hard work left to defeat Islamic State and stabilize areas recaptured from the hardline militant group.

Headline: States, cities sue U.S. to block 2020 census citizenship question
Article: A group of U.S. states and cities sued the Trump administration to stop it from asking people filling out 2020 census forms whether they are citizens.

Headline: Trump says he thinks he could have a good relationship with Putin
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump, standing alongside the leaders of three Baltic countries most concerned about the potential for aggression from Moscow, on Tuesday said he thought he could have a good relationship with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Headline: White House postpones planned Trump summit with Gulf leaders: sources
Article: The Trump administration is postponing until September a summit with Gulf Arab leaders that had been planned for this spring amid an ongoing dispute between Qatar and other U.S. allies in the region, according to five U.S. officials.

Headline: U.S. states vow to defend auto fuel efficiency standards
Article: Nearly a dozen U.S. states and Washington D.C. on Tuesday promised to defend federal automobile efficiency standards against a rollback proposed this week by Scott Pruitt, the embattled head of the Environmental Protection Agency.

Headline: Memphis workers reflect on Martin Luther King Jr. assassination 50 years later
Article: A half century ago, Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. came to Memphis to march in support of the city's striking sanitation workers. It was the last trip the Baptist minister turned civil rights leader would make in the name of social justice.

Headline: Trump discusses Iran threat with Qatar emir: White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump discussed the threat posed by Iran with the emir of Qatar on Tuesday and also stressed the importance of resolving the rift among Gulf nations, the White House said.

Headline: Americans reflect on Martin Luther King Jr's legacy 50 years on
Article: A half century after Rev. Martin Luther King Jr.'s death, visitors still flock to the Memphis, Tennessee, site where the civil rights leader was assassinated and say that while there has been progress in racial equality, more strides need to be made.

Headline: Trump says he will decide soon about future of U.S. troops in Syria
Article: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he is thinking very seriously about pulling U.S. troops out of Syria, and will make a decision soon about lessening support in the war-battered country.

Headline: Trump says will use military to protect U.S. border
Article: President Donald Trump on Tuesday said he planned to use U.S. military forces to protect the nation's southern border with Mexico until there is a border wall and "proper security."

Headline: Trump to meet with Mattis to discuss military protecting U.S. border with Mexico
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he is meeting with Defense Secretary James Mattis to discuss a proposal for the military to secure the country's border with Mexico.

Headline: Trump attorney seeks to force porn star's lawsuit into arbitration
Article: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer asked a federal judge on Monday to force adult film star Stormy Daniels to use arbitration to settle a dispute over an agreement to keep quiet about a sexual encounter she says she had with Trump.

Headline: Mueller has broad authority to investigate Trump's former campaign boss
Article: Robert Mueller, the U.S. Justice Department's special counsel, is specifically authorized to investigate allegations that Paul Manafort, President Donald Trump's former campaign chairman, colluded with Russia to interfere with the 2016 presidential election, a court filing showed late on Monday.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (April 3) - Sinclair, Honduras, CNN
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (April 2): DACA, NAFTA, Amazon
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Trump declares DACA 'dead,' urges Congress to act on border
Article: President Donald Trump declared as "dead" on Monday a program that protects immigrants brought to the United States illegally as children and pressed Congress to pass legislation to secure the U.S. border with Mexico.

Headline: White House probing environment chief Pruitt after condo report: WSJ
Article: The White House is reviewing Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt's activities after reports he paid below the market rate to live in a condo owned by a lobbyist who deals with issues overseen by the agency, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, citing an unnamed White House official.

Headline: Trump to nominate Muzinich as Treasury deputy secretary: White House
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump intends to nominate Justin Muzinich, an aide to Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, to be the deputy secretary of the Treasury, the White House said on Monday.

Headline: Puerto Rico governor slams congressman over 'dictatorial' letter
Article: Puerto Rico's governor on Monday fiercely defended his administration's right to help steer the insolvent, storm-ravaged island out of bankruptcy after a U.S. congressman said the process should be led by the island's creditors and federally appointed oversight board.

Headline: Accountants urge IRS for clarity on business meals deduction
Article: The largest association of accounting professionals on Monday asked the U.S. Treasury Department and Internal Revenue Service (IRS) to clarify whether the new Republican tax law allows continued deduction of business meals and other work expenses.

Headline: Connecticut Rep. Esty not seeking re-election to House
Article: Connecticut Democrat Elizabeth Esty announced on Monday that she will not seek re-election to the U.S. House of Representatives in November, just hours after she asked the Ethics Committee to expedite its review of her August 2016 dismissal of a staffer.

Headline: Trump to unveil China tariff list this week, targeting tech goods
Article: The Trump administration this week will unveil a list of advanced technology Chinese imports targeted for U.S. tariffs to punish Beijing over technology transfer policies, a move expected to intensify trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headline: Explainer: Trump muddles DACA program in anti-immigrant Twitter comments
Article: While President Donald Trump has said illegal immigrants heading toward the United States are trying to take advantage of an Obama-era policy that shields certain people from deportation, the program known as DACA is actually not open to new entrants.

Headline: U.S. sues California over law trying to curb federal land sales
Article: The U.S. Justice Department sued California over a state law that aims to stop the Trump administration from selling or transferring federal lands to private corporations, hitting the state with yet another legal challenge.

Headline: Trump's consumer watchdog proposes to trim agency's power
Article: The head of the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau asked Congress on Monday to trim the agency's power to write rules and spend money.

Headline: Trump congratulates Egypt's Sisi in call, affirms strategic partnership
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump congratulated his Egyptian counterpart, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, on his re-election in a phone call on Monday and reaffirmed the U.S. strategic partnership with Egypt, the White House said.

Headline: Environment chief Pruitt under more pressure after condo reports: lawmakers
Article: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency chief Scott Pruitt may not survive long in his job after reports that he paid below market rate to live in a condo owned by a lobbyist who deals with issues overseen by his agency, lawmakers and a former Trump official said in television interviews on Sunday.

Headline: Trump says DACA deal for young immigrants is off
Article: President Donald Trump said on Sunday that there will be no deal to legalize the status of young adult immigrants called Dreamers and he said the U.S.-Mexico border is becoming more dangerous.

Headline: Trump on Twitter (April 1): DACA, NAFTA
Article: The following statements were posted to the verified Twitter accounts of U.S. President Donald Trump, @realDonaldTrump and @POTUS.

Headline: Republican senator Graham warns against Syria troop withdrawal
Article: A senior Republican senator on Sunday warned U.S. President Donald Trump against pulling U.S. troops from Syria, saying it would lead to a resurgence of Islamic State and increased Iranian sway over the Syrian government in Damascus.

Headline: Trump attacks Amazon, again, over U.S. postal rates
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump launched his second attack in a week on Amazon.com Inc on Saturday, accusing the world's biggest online retailer of getting unfairly cheap rates from the U.S. Postal Service and not paying enough tax.

Headline: Senator Warren, in Beijing, says U.S. is waking up to Chinese abuses
Article: U.S. policy toward China has been misdirected for decades and policymakers are now recalibrating ties, Senator Elizabeth Warren told reporters during a visit to Beijing amid heightened trade tensions between the world's two largest economies.

Headline: Trump tells advisers he wants U.S. out of Syria: senior officials
Article: President Donald Trump has told advisers he wants an early exit of U.S. troops from Syria, two senior administration officials said on Friday, a stance that may put him at odds with U.S. military officials who see the fight against Islamic State as nowhere near complete.

Headline: Trump freezes funds for Syria; signals exit: Wall Street Journal
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday froze more than $200 million in funds for recovery efforts in Syria as his administration reassesses Washington's role in the long-drawn conflict there, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing officials.

Headline: Trump supporter Malloch says he will testify to Mueller grand jury
Article: An American academic who supports U.S. President Donald Trump and is a strong advocate of Britain's exit from the European Union will testify next month before the federal grand jury considering evidence in the investigation into possible collusion between Trump's 2016 election campaign and Russia.

Headline: In gun-friendly Vermont, lawmakers pass firearms control bill
Article: Vermont lawmakers gave final legislative approval on Friday to a bill that raises the legal age for buying firearms and expands background checks, becoming the latest state poised to tighten gun restrictions after last month's Florida school massacre.

Headline: U.S. visa applicants to be asked for social media history: State Department
Article: In a broad expansion of the information gathered from applicants for U.S. visas, the federal government is proposing to collect social media identities from nearly everyone who seeks entry into the United States, according to a State Department filing on Friday.

Headline: Mueller probing Russia contacts at Republican convention: sources
Article: Investigators probing whether Donald Trump's presidential campaign colluded with Russia have been questioning witnesses about events at the 2016 Republican National Convention, according to two sources familiar with Special Counsel Robert Mueller's inquiries.

Headline: Ex-FBI deputy McCabe's online legal defense fund nears $300,000 in hours
Article: Former FBI Deputy Director Andrew McCabe, who was fired by the Trump administration but has said he was terminated because he is a crucial witness in the Russia investigation, has raised more than $292,000 in seven hours to help cover costs defending against other ongoing government probes, the funding website showed.

Headline: Exclusive: Under Trump, prosecutors fight reprieves for people facing deportation
Article: The Trump administration has sharply curtailed a once-common practice of granting long-term reprieves to immigrants targeted for deportation, a Reuters analysis of court records shows, adding to an already huge backlog of cases in U.S. immigration courts.

Headline: Trump says infrastructure plan will likely have to wait until 2018 elections
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his infrastructure plan will likely have to wait until after the November congressional elections.

Headline: Exclusive: Trump weighs dropping personal efforts on biofuel reform - sources
Article: President Donald Trump is seriously considering abandoning efforts to remake the nation's biofuel laws after wading deep into an issue that divides some of his core constituencies, according to three sources familiar with the administration's thinking.

Headline: U.S. prosecutor reviewing Republican complaints against FBI: Sessions
Article: U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions revealed that Utah's top federal prosecutor is investigating a variety of Republican allegations of misconduct at the Justice Department and Federal Bureau of Investigation, according to a letter to lawmakers released on Thursday.

Headline: Trump has talked to Mattis about U.S.-Mexico wall funding: Pentagon
Article: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis has spoken with U.S. President Donald Trump about the potential use of military funds for a border wall with Mexico, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

Headline: EPA poised to announce rejection of Obama vehicle fuel efficiency rules
Article: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is expected to use a Virginia car dealership on Tuesday as the setting to tout its rejection of the Obama administration's landmark vehicle fuel efficiency rules, a move that could put automakers in the middle of a battle between the Trump administration and California.

Headline: Trump pushes out Shulkin at VA, nominates Jackson as replacement
Article: President Donald Trump ousted Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin on Wednesday in response to heavy criticism and nominated his personal physician, Rear Admiral Ronny Jackson, to replace him in the latest turnover among Trump's team.

Headline: Porn star Daniels loses bid to question Trump, get quick trial
Article: A federal judge has rejected adult film star Stormy Daniels' request for permission to question Donald Trump and schedule a trial soon in her lawsuit to end her agreement to remain silent about her alleged sexual encounter with the U.S. president.

Headline: U.S. ends presumed freedom for pregnant immigrants
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration said on Thursday it would no longer presume that many pregnant women detained by immigration authorities should be released from custody, reversing an Obama-era directive.

Headline: Frustrated with Trump, green group goes local with clean energy campaign
Article: U.S. environmental group the League of Conservation Voters on Thursday launched a $2 million campaign to press this year's candidates for state and local office to embrace clean energy, citing a lack of leadership on the issue in Washington.

Headline: American Samoans sue U.S. seeking birthright citizenship
Article: Three people born in American Samoa have sued the U.S. government, saying that its failure to grant them birthright citizenship violates the 14th Amendment of the Constitution and renders them "second-class Americans."

Headline: Trump taps doctor, decorated diver to rescue Veterans Affairs
Article: When a Republican congressman was critically wounded in a shooting at a baseball game last summer, U.S. President Donald Trump dispatched his physician, an Iraq war veteran trained in emergency medicine, to the hospital to check on his condition.

Headline: New York Fed chief selection process draws fire from politicians
Article: The selection process for the next Federal Reserve Bank of New York president has drawn the ire of New York City, state and other elected officials amid a report that San Francisco Fed President John Williams is the front runner for the job.

Headline: U.S. judge refuses to toss suit against Trump on foreign payments
Article: President Donald Trump's legal troubles deepened on Wednesday as a federal judge refused to throw out a lawsuit accusing him of flouting constitutional safeguards against corruption by maintaining ownership of his business empire while in office.

Headline: Supreme Court finds solution elusive in pivotal electoral map case
Article: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Wednesday appeared conflicted over what to do -- if anything -- to rein in politicians who draw state electoral maps with the aim of entrenching their party in power in a closely watched case from Maryland over the practice known as partisan gerrymandering.

Headline: Trump aide communicated with ex-Russian intelligence officer during 2016 election
Article: A former Russian intelligence officer who worked with U.S. President Donald Trump's former top campaign officials Paul Manafort and Rick Gates was communicating with Gates late in the 2016 presidential campaign, according to court records filed by Special Counsel Robert Mueller's office.

Headline: U.S. watchdog to probe Republican claims of FBI surveillance abuses
Article: The internal watchdog at the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday he is launching a review into allegations by Republican lawmakers that the FBI made serious missteps when it sought a warrant to monitor a former adviser to President Donald Trump's 2016 election campaign.

Headline: Trump attorney discussed pardons with Flynn, Manafort lawyers: report
Article: An attorney for President Donald Trump raised the idea of Trump pardoning two of his former top advisers last year as Special Counsel Robert Mueller was building a case against them in his probe into possible Russian interference in the U.S. presidential election, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Trump 'stands in solidarity' with Orange County on California sanctuary law
Article: President Donald Trump on Wednesday extolled a major California county for joining his administration's legal challenge to the state's new limits on how much local police and sheriff's departments support his rigorous deportation policy.

Headline: Trump gives positive sign on talks with Kim, good review of Xi meeting
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that North Korean leader Kim Jong Un looked forward to meeting with him, indicating the planned landmark talks between the isolated Asian leader and Republican president will go forward.

Headline: California county joins Trump 'sanctuary city' lawsuit
Article: Leaders of Orange County, California on Tuesday voted to join a federal lawsuit against the state's sanctuary law as part of a growing backlash in some conservative parts of California to state laws that protect illegal immigrants from deportation.

Headline: Exclusive: Spurned by top lawyers, Trump's defense elevates Washington outsider
Article: A little-known former prosecutor with a doctorate in medieval history will play a central role on U.S. President Donald Trump's legal team, as many top-tier lawyers shy away from representing him in a probe into Russia's meddling in the 2016 election.

Headline: Trump to end special status for Liberian immigrants in U.S.
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday ordered an end to special legal status for certain immigrants from Liberia, including some who have lived in the United States for decades, citing improved conditions in the West African country.

Headline: States vow to fight U.S. plan to ask citizenship question on census
Article: New York, California and other states vowed on Tuesday to stop the U.S. government from asking in the 2020 census whether people are citizens, arguing the question could stop immigrants from participating and skew the makeup of Congress.

Headline: Worried about Bolton? Pentagon chief Mattis dismisses concerns
Article: U.S. Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Tuesday he had no reservations or concerns about President Donald Trump's incoming national security adviser, John Bolton, a hawk who has advocated using military force against North Korea and Iran.

Headline: Kentucky House passes bill restricting abortions
Article: The Kentucky House of Representatives passed legislation on Tuesday to ban a common abortion procedure from the 11th week of pregnancy, in what would be one of the strictest abortion limits in the United States.

Headline: Ex-Supreme Court justice urges Second Amendment repeal in U.S. gun rights debate
Article: A retired U.S. Supreme Court justice on Tuesday called for the repeal of the U.S. Constitution's Second Amendment, which gives Americans the right to keep and bear firearms, and the White House responded by reaffirming its support for the provision.

Headline: Ex-Trump campaign manager Manafort seeks to dismiss Virginia charges
Article: U.S. President Donald Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, on Tuesday asked a federal judge in Virginia to dismiss an indictment brought by Special Counsel Robert Mueller, saying the case falls outside the scope of Mueller's authority and is unrelated to Trump's 2016 election campaign.

Headline: Before expulsions, a brick-by-brick hardening of U.S. stance toward Russia
